text: Its ok. I have had better Thai food. The resto is nice inside although they are so busy. Maybe we got the wrong dishes but the dishes we had like the Thom Kha was nothing spectacular. It was average. I had high expectations because of what I heard from people but unfortunately it did not rise to the occassion.

I really love Archie's Thai Kitchen. My husband and I have been going to the Flamingo location for years.. We normally order the Pad Woon Sen, the beef fried rice and the wonton soup which is incredible..
We have had unpleasant experiences here at this location several times now. It is closer to our house than the Flamingo or Rainbow location so we really wanted it to be more convenient for us. Sadly enough, every time we go here our order comes out wrong. We order a spicy number 6 and no spice is added, we order a spicy number 4 and it burns our heads off. We don't run into this problem at any other location. 
We have also been to this location and it is super busy and their is no one to help us sit or order food. 
New management is needed here. They really need to change these things. I would love to frequent this restaurant but find that it is hard to trust that our food will be done consistently.
Pad Thai with tofu was real good and flavorful.  Prices were very good.   It's one of the few restaurants in Vegas that doesn't feel designed for tourists or as an afterthought.

I went there for dinner tonight and had a most annoying experience ever. They greeted us so I told the worker 2 adults and 3 kids. I need 2 high chairs and room for a stroller. Then a girl took us to a big table which was perfect. She brought us 2 high chairs and kids were all seated and we got everything situated then they told us we needed to move because they thought there was more people. That place wasn't even that busy. I was annoyed but just swallowed and got all the kids and went to a different table. It was a same size table that they sat us! So we were trying to get situated again and someone came and told us to move to a smaller table. I was annoyed AF and the girl saying I thought more people.. WTF do they not understand English or just plain stupid? I was so pissed we decided to leave. They didn't apologize or anything. If you're stupid then that's fine with me but don't be wasting my time and energy. Definitely not going back there.

We had a bad experience at the restaurant. We ordered fried rice and their country curry; the fried rice came out 10 minutes before the curry and it got cold, the servers did not check up on us to inform us about our curry dish or even help to improve our experience, and the country curry was not prepared up to its usual standard. As we were leaving the restaurant, the owner was standing at the register and counting cash, and he did not acknowledge our complaints. There are better Thai restaurants all around town that maintain a standard of service and this restaurant did not have it.

Loved Archi's Thai Caf√©.  It was recommended by a friend in the area, and it didn't let us down.  We had basil chicken, yellow chicken curry, pad thai, & fried rice.  My 1 & 4 year old devoured the pad thai and fried rice...this may be a direct result of the amount of thai food I consumed while pregnant with both of them. 

The basil chicken and yellow chicken curry have to be some of the best I have ever had.

With that said, I had 2 babes with me and the service was a little slow, and less than attentive. They also put us in the very back corner, which felt a little like "they have kids keep them out of the main area." It took a long time to get drinks and have our order taken.

Oh well, we had the back to our selves and my kids got to sit on the long bench and were stoked!  We will be back!

I really like Archi's. Good food, nice ambience, fairly inexpensive and close to my house. What's not to love?

Since discovering Archi's I've stopped going to my old, cheap Thai eats place, Thai Style Noodle. When I can pay an extra $2-$3 for an infinitely better dish, it's a no brainer. The noodles are great. I usually get the Pad Seeyoo(sorry about the spelling) or Pad Thai. Both great options, but it really depends on the day. The chefs are usually pretty consistent.

Thai Basil Fried Rice is good too and the curries are delicious. One of my only complaints is that even though they ask you your spiciness preferred level (1-10), their tastes usually run hot. No biggie, but when I'm with people that want mild, they expect mild and I don't want them having a bad time that night or the next day.

Anyways, Archi's is now in my restaurant rotation so I hope they continue to stay yummy.

I didn't even like Thai food until I started going here.  I wonder if they secretly add some kind of crack to this food because I crave it fortnightly.  Sooo good.  

My favorite is the Pad Kapow (spicy basil), Pad Thai, and the chicken fried rice is the.best.ever.  It is seriously amazing.  Yes, I know that's a "boring" dish.  I order it for my kids and wind up eating whatever they don't finish.  It's even better the next day.

We usually get take out but the actual restaurant is wonderful.  I love the plantation shutters everywhere.  The staff is friendly, although not always fluent in English.  I love this place.  I hope they don't change their business model any time soon.

When I first walked into this place, the atmosphere felt warming and it looked very authentic. Normally when I go to a Thai restaurant, I usually order pad Thai. The pad Thai tasted so delicious. The portion was just right, the spice level was on point also. The staff was also very kind and helpful.

Archi's has the best Pad Thai. The food is consistently good, unlike some other Thai restaurants in town. The beef salad is always great and refreshing; and has a modest proportion of beef for the price. The curry is creamy and not overwhelming with a perfect blend of spices and goes great with the pineapple fried rice. I've tried plenty of Thai restaurants in town, but definitely keep Archi's as my top pick.
I love this place, its a little expensive but they do have a lunch special suring the weekdays....you get the choice to pick how spicy you want your plate 1-10
Above average tasting thai noodles for slightly above average prices, over all a solid 4! The service was good and the place feels clean. Definately would recommend for people in the summerlin area.

You can't beat great Thai food, and Archi's has just that. When we first moved here it was one of the first places we ventured to and has remained a favorite. Not only is it great tasting food, the service is also wonderful. They are very welcoming, attentive and the food comes out pretty quickly. I love their pan nang curry. I tend to stick to that dish while my husband ventures out and loves everything he gets. This is a great little, friendly place for quality food. They are closed on Tuesdays....which is when I crave them the most!

When we arrived there was no waiting area and we were standing around tables waiting to be seated. There were tables open and people weren't being seated in a timely manner.

After we sat down a server came and told us and "you want drinks?" And we all just wanted water and the guy gave us a dirty look. After we got our waters we waited 15 minutes for someone to come take our order. We had to go ask someone to take our order. After taking our order they took forever but as I was looking around people who sat down after us got their food and was practically half way done with their meal. I got up to speak with the manager and he walked away from me. He had our food on the tray he was bringing out and walked over to our table and started to place them on the table as I was trying to tell him about how terrible the service is. After he put 2 of the 3 plates we ordered down he told me that they are busy and that's why it took so long. Being busy doesn't excuse you to give some of your customers crappy service. And when someone is speaking to you, you shouldn't turn your back and walk away.

Food was okay. Had a lot of toppings in the curry but no soup.
I love this place! I've been to Thailand many times, and it taste just as good.

Voted best in Las Vegas for 10 yrs for a reason! Always fresh, always professional. We usually order at least once a week. Everytime we come inside we always think how CLEAN everything is and how nice. We are always greeted warmly and the wait is never too long. Archies makes it easy and what's not to love!

I had a very similar experience to Jill C.'s.  I also had the Basil Chicken lunch special and I thought it was great, also great was the $6.95 price.  I ordered the level 5 spiciness and it really wasn't hot at all.  I will definitely keep this place in my lunch spot rotation.

Been this location 3X plus 2 others. Hidden deep in rear of lot next to movie theater on NW corner.  Pad Thai noodlesw/shrimp combo, spicy eggplant, Kung Pao w/pork, Pineapple fried rice,  All delish! I got level 4-5 spice and do not consider that to hot, but I like bold, spicy food. If you don't get zero heat or only 1.  The Thai iced tea is so good and different. Tea but rich and spicy, creamy and you get a huge glass.  I recommend you tell the waitress to go light on the ice but am hooked on it and going to beg for the recipe. This is not for people in a hurry on a 30 min lunch. Everything is custom cooked, hot, fresh and delicious. You get your choice of meat w/each dish and choose your heat level. The lunch combo includes a side of greens, spring roll and cup of soup with your entree all for about $7-$9 depending on your meat choice. Good for Vegan's too.  Best Thai I've found!

Great Chicken Pad Thai and Pad See Ew!

Every other dish I have gotten here has been good as well including soups and appetizers. 

Great service too. Very fast and friendly.

They brought us water, the place  is NOT busy! Why can't someone take our order? I don't get it, they put us in the corner now no service! What a dump! On new years eve  when it's not busy customer service does not exist here!

I just moved to Vegas and this is my favorite place to get thai food! Their red, green, and yellow curry with tofu, and tom kha are heavenly! The wait is a bit long so if I get take out, I make sure to call at least 25 minutes ahead of time.

Archi's is my current favorite Thai restaurant in town, and I have tried many including Thai Spice, Komol, Lotus of Siam, Thai BBQ, Pin Kaow, Marnee Thai, Promarres, King & I, Panna Thai, Tipps, and Basil 'n Lime. This is their 3rd and newest location.

We usually get the Pad See-Ew, Pad Thai, Spicy Eggplant, and sometimes a Thai Iced Tea. My wife also loves their Green Papaya Salad and enjoys their various curry dishes. For the spicy dishes, they will ask you how spicy you want it on a scale of 0 to 10. We usually go with "2" because their "3" can be extremely hot, as in sweat-inducing, nose running-like-a-river hot! I can't even fathom what a "10" might be like. Their prices are very reasonable except I do get annoyed when they charge you $1 for a small bowl of rice without letting you know ahead of time. Pet peeve, I know.

What distinguishes this place from most other Thai restaurants (and the original location) is the warm, clean, and contemporary interior. You feel like you are dining in an upscale restaurant instead of a hole-in-the-wall joint. Service is typically friendly and efficient.

The combination of quality food at reasonable prices, solid service, upscale ambience, and as an added bonus its proximity to home make this our go to place for Thai. Well done, Archi, well done.

I was introduced to Archi's by a friend of mine shortly after moving to Las Vegas in September and I have been hooked ever since! Honestly I think I stop in or take home an order at least once a month. Their beef pad thai and pork satay skewers are two of my staple favorites.

Their lunch special is a great deal with a ton of food that usually adds up to at least two lunches if you take half home like I do.

This place is truly dangerous being a couple blocks from our house but we love the food and the service so I know we will continue to be happy customers!

Love this place so much. One of three restaurants that I crave on a multi-weekly basis. Everything is always fresh, service is superior, and ambiance is true to the classic Thai restaurant. 

Drinks are easy. They usually either crack open a young Thai coconut with a straw, or pour me an ice cold glass of Thai tea, depending on my mood. If I'm hungry enough for an appetizer, I go with the veggie egg rolls, and sometimes a cucumber salad with peanut sauce. For dinner, it is almost exclusively a beef salad with a request for lean beef (no, I don't like chewing on fat) and my absolute favorite, PANANG CURRY with chicken beast. I'm literally drooling while writing this. Panang curry is so creamy and spicy you'll want to order extra curry sauce, which I usually do. I've tried other things, that were admittedly delicious, but I can't not order panang. 

If you're lucky enough to come in often, the hostesses/waitresses will likely remember you. This always adds to the experience, when they welcome me back and ask if I'd like my regular order. Nothing beats that feeling. 

Amazing service, amazing food. Get here.

I have driven past this place for awhile now and finally decided to stop in, WHOA I have been missing out, this place is awesome.  We were greeted immediately and given a nice booth. Our server was prompt, courteous and very informative. We loved the food and will be back for sure

Not going back to this location after today!

 About 2 weeks ago my 3 year old daughter and I went to eat there just before 5 pm on a Friday. We got our food and after only a few bites, my daughter needed to use the restroom. I could not locate a staff member to let them know that we would be right back so we left our practically untouched food there and quickly went to the restroom. Just before that, the restaurant started to get extremely busy and large numbers of people began showing up. We returned to our table about 5 minutes later, only to find that our plates had been cleared and they had already seated somebody else there. When i let the hostess know that we were at the restroom and not done eating, she said that they threw our food away because they thought we left without paying. I asked if we could be seated in a different table and have our order re-made quickly and she said that they did not have any tables for 2 people and that there was going to be a wait. I asked if they would be able to make our order to go and again, she said that there was going to be a long wait since they were busy. I also spoke to a manager about this who apologized, but again did not offer a solution. Even though we did not get charged for the few bites that we ate, i find it very frustrating that my dining experience was ruined (not to mention that I am trying to feed a 3 year old dinner) all because they got busy and in a hurry to seat everybody that showed up just after 5. I vowed then that i would never go back to this location. 

Then...today I was in the neighborhood and thought i would give them a second chance. I ordered a Thai beef salad (spicy #2). I have ordered this more than 5 times at this location and it was always perfect amount of spice for me. I also order it this way at the Flamingo location (which has always been amazing!) I was sooooo disappointed to taste my salad, only to discover that they did not put ANY spice at all. (totally changes the taste of the salad!) I called them from work (30 min away) and let them know. Instead of apologizing, they started yelling at the cook (with me still on the phone) and came back on the line and said that they did put spice and that #2 is not hot and i should have ordered it hotter. I told the girl that i always order it this way and i know they did not put any spice, she just said sorry i asked the chef and they did put spice (basically calling me a liar). She said that i could bring it back in and get a new one. I let her know that i work 30+ min away and i am not coming back on a Friday after 5 (considering my last Fri experience). She put me on hold and I think talked to a manager. She came back on the line and said that next time I should have brought it back right away. 

Clearly, not returning here! Also, I am pretty upset about the whole thing, considering I have never left a review good or bad on yelp.
Pad Kea Mow - The best dish I like only in this location. We had been to many thai restaurants all over US and only liked this dish over here.

Attempted to have dinner here, been to Archi's before for lunch many times at both locations.  Horrible service or just awfully mismanaged!  Waited 10+ minutes to be seated, wasn't ever even greeted (even speak some basic Thai).  We watched them setup a table for 2, our party was 3.  At that point we walked..not sure any of us will return.

LOVE Archi's! Always a clean and friendly environment to enjoy a meal. Yellow curry with chicken and shrimp is always a favorite with a side of brown rice (rare in town) and has a few specials for lunch. Never a long wait and the restrooms are immaculate here. A pleasure to come to Archi's! Z

This is good Thai-American style food. Service is fast and good, prices are right and it is clean, and tidy.  We were a party of 3 and ordered 3 dishes to split. All were good but the green beans and fried tofu with basil was very yummy. They gave us an ample amount of rice and a hot sauce that was actually hot! The spring roll was fresh and flavorful, but the brown sauce they served it with was uninspiring. I prefer a more authentic taste of Thai, but this place is good.

The review is purely about service we were seated and given our drinks and then nobody showed up to take our order people came after us and their orders were taken.. still paid for the soda we had and left.. need to improve service.
We love Archi's for dining in or taking out! Our go-to is the Basil rice, panang curry, yellow curry, and drunken noodles. They never disappoint and the service has always been great

I would give this 5 starts but my order was wrong last time.  I asked for an 8 and 2 and I got a 10 and 8.  Needless to say, I couldn't eat it and lunch time was over I had to get something else.

On the positive side, their portions are nice sized and the food is very flavorful.  I used to go to the one on Flamingo and Rainbow and stopped going there because I found a hair in my food.
Other than that I like this place.

Great food but WTF is up with them advertising they close @ 10pm when they turn u away when you walk in @ 9:30pm. They told us kitchen was already closed but if we wanted to order for take out we could!!! WTFFFF!!! Kitchen's close but if we order to go they'll open it??? Unprofessional, your in America practice american restaurant practices & serve till your advertised closing hours. I can see if we had walked in @ 5 or 10 mins of but WTF 30 mins before?  You lost me as a customer, there's plenty of better & less expensive Tai restaurants all over Vegas & with better service!

Came here for dinner. Geez, no one bothered to greet us, seat us or act like we existed. Waited long enough & finally gave up & left.  Take your business & eat where they welcome customers. These people could care less

So my I brought my folks here for a post-Christmas dinner. I ordered my favorite pineapple rice. Not only did they make it spicy, I found a strand of hair! So the server made us a new one. But it was still spicy. I have brought my guests and friends here many times but this experience ruined it. Makes me wonder how sanitary they are in the kitchen.

What a great restaurant.  The food was delicious and so very reasonably priced.  We had pineapple curry with pork, pad prik king (spicy green beans) with chicken, vegatable chow mein, white and brown rice.  We each had two beers and the check was a very reasonable $53 with tax.  Plus there was enough left over for lunch one day this week.  The service was right on target, the food hot and delicious.  What more could one ask for?  Really great meal.
Really good thai food with quick service. Portion sizes are decent. Average pricing.

Delicious food at reasonable prices has my family coming back over and over again. I usually order the massaman and thai iced tea. They do charge $1.50 for extra rice, which perplexes me because they expexct three adults to share one scoop of rice, but whatevs. The service is fast, even when it is busy.

The food and the service is excellent!  We drove to this location because the location near us was closed! Great ambiance and clean! They even have a drive thru. There are 3 locations, you must try! Enjoy!

Nice environment. Went with friends. Good portion. Vegetable ginger stirfry and Thai salad was good. Padh Thai was a little too sour for me, maybe a bit too much of lemon grass. Pineapple fried rice was good too.

Busy little place on a Sunday evening. Our food was good, the price was reasonable. Service was fine and the restaurant itself was nice. My only complaint was that our food was not really hot. Maybe it sat on the counter waiting to be served? It was only one of the dishes that wasn't very hot. I'd go back & give them a second try.

Just tried to call in an order for pick up. They put the phone down and never came back to take my order. I could hear staff talking in the background the whole time. I actually hung up and tried to call back as I was really craving Thai food and the line was tied up. Out of curiosity tried back several minutes later - line still tied up. They either completely forgot or just didn't care. This was mid-afternoon on a Monday... Not exactly a lunch or dinner rush.

I regularly go with my family and friends to this restaurant only b/c of the food. In the recent times the staff here became a nightmare the serving is horrible, they always mess-up the order and spice level, Zero respect to the customer (They think they are serving the food for free). I go so regularly (Almost every week) but my last visit made me decide never to visit this place again. This restaurant needs a serious discipline I request to the regular customer's to teach them a lesson by avoiding it. The owner of the restaurant has to put lots of effort to improve the behavior of the staff (The basic step welcoming the customers with a smile).

The service was horrible and the food was mediocre at best. I waited 25 minutes after ordering for my bland portion of prik king to come out. After eating, it took another 10 minutes for them to actually notice and bring over my bill. Will not be returning.

I have really been wanting some good Thai food. A co worker told me about this place. Turns out it's around the corner from me. Hubby and I ordered the stuffed wings, (Sounded interesting) and I'm so glad we did. They were delicious, served with a spicy sweet sauce, yum! We ordered larb. They made it perfectly, with just the right amount of spice. We shared the beef salad with lemon dressing. The sear on the beef was perfection and the dressing was very refreshing. Hubby had a pork dish, pad prik pow (yes, that's really the name), but it was great. The service was very fast, friendly and done with a smile. I highly recommend this place. Excellent food, even if some of the names of their dishes sound.......wrong. Lol

Best pad see ew and mint leaf/basil fried rice in town. However the pad thai is not nearly as good as in Pin Kaow by a long shot. Overall one of the better Thai restaurants in Las Vegas. It is clean and easy to find and very convenient if you live in or near Summerlin. 

One area of constructive criticism since I do eat here often with the family: I would say is the customer service needs to be improved drastically since this is the only area that has a lot of room for improvement since their food is very good. It is not bad by any means, but they often appear disorganized. Some servers are better than others. Specifically, when lines start to form the given estimated times are more like guesses and substantially differ depending on who passing by at the front. It appears that having a hostess at the front at all times (during the peak times) would be a quick fix.

Tried Archies cafe for the first time. The service was great and the food was the best Tai food I've had so far. I ordered the Pad Tai 6 on the spicey scale and it could have been a little hotter. It is a great atmosphere and overall a great restaurant.

It doesn't matter what you order on the menu... it's going to be good. Last night we had the Chicken Satay and the Yellow Curry (we always go with a spicy level of "5") and both were delicious! Love those fresh coconuts with the coconut water too... better than beer or wine!

The owner needs to take a customer service class. I admit I had mistakenly ordered at wrong location. I had called in an order @rainbow instead of Sahara. But I come all the time at Sahara location since day 1 that they opened and they won't let me eat today or make another order.. I understand its my fault but he said" I have to give you hard time",thats not how do business
I cannot say enough good things about Archie's.  I highly recommend this place.  Food is amazing and the service is great

To be honest I've been coming here for such a long time and the flavor is really good. Recently I noticed that they are becoming stingy on meat. I didn't order a full plate of onions with 7 pieces of beef. (Which really just happened) Sadly, I'm disappointed because when I complained they came back with the same amount of meat but with more peppers to make the plate look more full. I won't be coming back.

I've eaten here once before and I think they're pretty good.  We came late in the evening.  I just wish the server would have told us the kitchen was closing.  You know...last call?  We wanted to get dessert but when we asked after another server unceremoniously dropped the check on the table without saying a word, we were told we could not order anything but mochi ice cream.   But the rest of the service was pretty good.  Waters were filled, though I did ask once.  And someone checked on us after we had started eating.  I hope to try Lotus of Siam soon and see how the 2 compare.

We love this place!!!! They have great food! Most of their dishes are pretty tasty and the portions are pretty good size. We know the owner and he is always around all 3 of his locations which it makes a difference. We definitely commend it.

We frequent this location whenever we want to see a movie at Village Square.  They have expanded their seating recently so the wait isnt too bad.  Tasty chow mein and soups.  The papaya salad is also good.  Food comes out in a timely fashion, and they are good to hurry your order up if you are pressed for time to get to your movie.

Lots of times when people say they like Thai food that sometimes means their talking about the Pad Thai. lol I'm one of them~
Anyways I love coming here EVERYTIME I eat here I am satisfied and happy. 
Service-excellent fill up my drink all the time and food comes out fast
food- oh yes. hmm....spicy eggplant. yes try it. try try try. any food that comes out of their kitchen is the bomb. It might be a illogical fallacy but whatevs. Archis make good food all the time ;deal with it

Yesterday I came in with a friend to try out their fresh spring rolls and peanut sauce. I also ordered Kung Pao Chicken. I was impressed that the food was good and I did not have to wait as long as others. While devouring the spring rolls we were immediately served chicken soup or something like it. It was good. By that time our food was being brought out. I asked for medium by right away I determined I should have asked for HOT. Anyhow, Archi's delivered. Go try it for your self.

We are frequent diners at both of Archi's locations. We use this one if we plan on seeing a movie. 

Our experience today will make us never come to this location again. We were seated promptly in their new section against the windows. We waited for 5 minutes before someone even approached out table. We ordered drinks and waited to have someone take our food order. Another 5 minutes. We didn't get anything crazy - 1 order of Thai egg rolls and 2 plates of Pad Thai. This took a little longer than usual but they were busy so it was understandable. However, we were only approached once for a refill and that's it. 

When I say that's it, I mean WE HAD NO MORE SERVICE. No one came to check on us again, no one asked if we needed to go boxes, no one asked if we were done and ready for our check. I tried flagging down our waitress since we were trying to get to our movie to no avail. Finally, my boyfriend left to purchase our tickets thinking I would be ready to go by the time he got back. Nope. He actually had to ask for our check and a box at the hostess stand. What a horrible experience. I felt bad for the people who got seated 2 tables down from us who had to wait 15 minutes to be approached. However, the people who came in 10 minutes after us and ordered, ate, and left 10 minutes before us (ordering more food AND getting refills and checked up on) maybe you could give the rest of us some advice on how to handle this place.
Yummy!! The Pork Larb and Chicken Curry fried rice were delicious. The Spicy Basil was meh. But my family thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We can't wait to come back.

let's be honest. the food is great here. The service? friggin sucks big one. they are so rude. I think our waitress forgot to put one of the dishes in. our crab fried rice came out when we were almost done with our meal. than she told us that crab fried rice takes longer than any other dishes to prepare. wtf? she must thought we were stupid. as i said, go there for food but don't expect good service. tall nerdy looking guy with glasses seem like he didn't care when I complained. PinKow is just as good and I always get good service there.

I love Archi's! I've been eating here for years. But I have to say the west flamingo location shits on the west Sahara location, in service and consistency. On flamingo, I know the pad Thai is always going to taste the same and the service is on point. Sahara.. The food is always good, but always different. And the staff is never in a hurry. Tonight I saw one server in the entire dining room. As it got busy, she looked like a deer in headlights. Really? Get more help! This happens every time I go there.

Was late from my work today due to stupidity of the waitress in Archi's Thai Restaurant. Stop by today and order food to go at 11:14am. Ill keep asking the waitress every 30 mins where's my order & waiting for almost 1hour & 30mins. Just find out that they forgot my order & missed up. Not even apologizing there mistake from the start & never even offer any discount or even just a decent apology for there mistake. Im not happy. I'm very disappointed and upset!!! Sad to say...been spending a lot of money here for almost 6times every month to dine-in with friends & take out order. This is was a worst experience I had with this restaurant. Never come back here again!
This place used to be really great prior to their expansion.  They are just ok.  The foods never persistent.  Different cooks, several locations = Avg quality.

Service was excellent! Food came out quickly and tasted very good. I like really spicy food and ordered spice level 20 out of 10. The waiter warned me that if it is too hot, they can't adjust it. It sort of made me scared. But, the spice level ended up being about a 7 out of 10. The flavors were great. If I had to make one minor compliant, it would be that the beef tasted just ok. I'm from Miami, and there is a restaurant named Ruson that has cooked the same dish, Beef Basil, for me about 30 times. There beef tastes better than Archi's beef. Not sure if it a different quality or just a different method of cooking it.

The bottom line is that I highly recommend Archi's. There prices are actually too low! They could charge one and a half times what they do and no one would complain.

Oh so disappointed. Everyone raves about this place so we finally tried it and were let down. We were seated in the corner and totally forgotten about. We ordered the tom yum soup and it was bland and barely had anything in it. It was more like a bowl of broth. The masaman was watery and flavorless. In my opinion they cant compare to Pin Kaow on Lake Mead and Rainbow.

Disappointed with the service, we came in ,5 employees ignored us to seat us down. Asked for soy sauce she said yaa we have! Never got it! Asked another lady and she ignored us, I was like what is going on here.... Wanted to leave right away but I couldn't cause she took for ever to get me the bill ! Wow . I usually, when I got the bill I got charged for two ice teas two Thai ice teas one soft drink extra, all we ordered and got was ice teas wow keeps getting worst by the minute. I will never ever come back!! I'm pissed! I

Wow what an obnoxious manager they have running this place. My daughter ordered Sweet and Sour chicken and normally it's deep fried and their's isn't however the taste of the sauce was horrible so I explained that she wasn't going to be able to eat it and he told me I would still be charged because everyone else in the restaurant was eating the same chicken. In all my years of dining out that has never happened to me. I told him that I wasn't going to eat my food and we walked out! Horrible customer service skills. Their are a lot of great restaurants in town so good luck in the future Archi's.

I loved their food till today. Customer service/management was POOR! A meal for one person at our table was completely forgotten, until we reminded the server of it. The server did not seem to understand that we were ALL eating a meal there at the same table at the same time. The meal was then brought out when everyone else at the table was almost done. Drink refills were never offered as well. To top it all off, NO apology was offered AND they would not adjust the bill. The management actually argued with us. That is NOT how you keep customers coming back. There will be a least six less Las Vegans dining there from now on.

I'm giving Archie's a 3-star review based on their phone service should be one star but I've had their food in the past and it was excellent. Tried to call earlier this evening to order some pineapple fried rice , lady asked me if I could hold for a few seconds and then set the phone down, 5 minutes later she is still not come back on the line. Frustrated I hung up and attempted to call back now it's been 25 minutes and the line is still busy. I'm presuming it's still sitting on the counter waiting for someone to pick it up and take my order from my original call. I guess you have to order in person.
My first Thai food experience 5 years ago and I've been a frequent customer ever since.  Lunch specials are great and we love that they can customize each dish to our liking.

One of the best Thai restaurants on the west side.  My boyfriend and I eat here a lot.  We usually order the Chicken Pad See Ew, Chicken Pad Thai and Tom Yum Kai.  The Pad See Ew is one of the best I have had, ranking up with the ones I ate in Bangkok.  The Pad Thai and Tom Yum Kai are very good as well.

I have been a fan of this place for about 4 years. I finally got my husband to eat here and he is hooked! We both love the pad Thai which is super yummy. I also really like the Yellow curry with sticky rice. If you enjoy spicy foods this is your place cause they don't mess around when it comes to spicy!
Horrible customer service. Waited 45 minutes for our food, the waitress only acknowledged us once.
Yummy!!! Had the panang curry and pad ke mao noodles 7/10 spicy and they made it vegetarian for us! Delicious found a fav by the house.
My favoriteThai restaurant in Summerlin area .Price reasonable, clean,service fair. I love Pad se ew, beef with broccoli, thai tea and pad thai.

I've been coming here for years and it's fantastic! I almost always get the Tom Kha soup with a side of rice, sometimes I get the pad Thai but it's always great no matter what. The iced tea is so great, kind of floral, and the service is always on point. 

Keep being great, guys! :)
Food ok..took about an hour for my order to be ready..way to damn busy..dont go here on a weekend

I was referred to this place from the Rocky Fritz store owner and said it's really inexpensive and they tasted good. So why not give it a try since I haven't had a Thai cuisine for 2 years already. I asked the server what can he recommend and he pointed out the Spicy eggplant which I like eggplant also and you can combine with your choice of pork, vegetables or seafood and I chose pork. Hmm for a skinny person like me I ate the whole plate LOL!!! My bf ordered Pad Cha2x and it tasted good also. So far I'm loving this restaurant already and will come back for more.

Garlic pepper beef!! Yes please!!! One of my favorite Thai restaurants when I'm in town. Wish I could magically appear whenever I get the Thai bug, Sacramento is LACKING! If you are in the mood for good Thai in Archis is a must!

My first review on Yelp. And I had to leave a review here.
Oh my holy God. The WORST of the WORST!
It was my first time at a thai-sh restaurant and I truly do wish I could write a happy, positive, 5star highly recommended kind of review but I can not and you will know why in 2 seconds.
I found two pieces of tapes(LONG) inside the chicken noodle soup after having a couple bite. I first thought it was a piece of uncooked noodle because the texture was similar, but it was a piece of shittttt!!! Imagine what would have happened if I swallowed it by accident? Thinking of, 'oh this one piece is not cooked throughly, but its oki doki my stomach is strong enough to digest anythang' 
Anyways, I called the server A.J and he apologized sincerely along with a free dinner (we prolly ate about 15% of the dish)which really did stop me from calling the health department for a further investigation. Seriously I feel sick right now.
Everything else we ordered were okay except for the beef jerky which was tough...loved their phad thai the most
I come here at least once a week. Delicious food with very quick service. Great for take outs too. I highly recommend this place.
I actually love Thai food and have tried so many Thai restaurants. Archie's has its select dishes that are absolutely delectable. Including the choochee I think that's what it's called amazing!
Had to get my dishes 0 spicy because I was sharing them with my child.  Lo and behold, everything was still mighty tasty! Service was good & the food came out fairly quickly.

Archi's is fine gourmet Thai cusine that have higher standard of quality restuarant over all Thai resuarants as well as all others type.Focus only on few popular dishes that would be everyone favorites is hit the local market of can't live without it.All locations are cleaned service is good.You always will be happy with the test of Thailand here.The prices and sizes are awesome.
The Tom Kha soup was amazing. We will be back soon! The atmosphere was quiet and felt traditional. It also appeared to be family run which I think makes for better food.
I recommend the chicken pad thai, tom ka soup and yellow chicken curry.  The food is authentic and the service is ok!
we eat here once a week with our three kids best larb chicken salid on the planet

A co-worker and Yelp coaxed me in to trying this place and it did not disappoint.  I came specifically for the Tom Yum Chicken and it was quite delicious! (I'd have given it a 5, but I've never had Thai before so there was nothing to compare it to.)
I ordered to-go...the cashier was very pleasant...and my order arrived quickly.
I'll definitely be back!

I always end up coming to archis at this location, just because it's the closest one to my house. I've tried archis that are at different locations. For all of the locations I've tried ( sahara, flamingo, and warm springs), heres my review:

Food : always on point with their spicy level, tastes and look fresh, never found a hair in my food, and everything I've tried tasted so delicious (esp. Pad thai with beef)

Waiting time: if you go there at a peak time for lunch or dinner, wairing time to be seated or get your food will take longer than usual but that's expected for any restaurant. Usually I find my waiting time to be OK

Customer service: this part let me drop down 2 stars. No matter what time, day, or which location I go to, customer service is just not good. One time I was still working on my plate maybe half finished,  but my server just took the condiments without asking me if I'm done with it or if I still need it. I find that so rude... and nobody really smiles

I love how there food is authentic. I always order extra peanut sauce.& Thai tea! :)
My experiences with takeout and din in are always awesome!

My friend Susan is always draggin me around to try new things.. 
I was a little hesitant to try it... but she was driving . 
We sat down and ordered. 
I ordered Pad Thai and She ordered Pineapple fried rice.
Then we did what our Momma's taught us and Shared our dinners with each other. 
Truly good food. 
I was very impressed with the textures and flavors of the pineapple fried rice. 
the Pad Thai was not overly hot, and was pleasant on the palate
Definitely gets added to the MUST TRY AGAIN list.

Food gets four to five stars. Service gets three to four. To be fair, I went on a Saturday night so they were busy.  Their prices are lower than I would have expected. All in, it's a good restaurant. I will go back.

By far the best Thai food in Las Vegas! The Pad Thai is delicious the spice doesn't take away from the flavor of the dish like a lot of other places seem to do. All of their curries are flavorful and well prepared. Overall this place has great quality Thai cuisine.

We can't get enough of this place!  It is the BEST Thai food in Las Vegas hands down.  You MUST try the Pad Kee Mao, nobody makes it better.  Their Thai Tea is also the best you will find in town.  Highly recommend!!!!!

This has the best Panang Curry I have ever tried. I don't how they make it so much better than any of the other Thai places I've been to before.  Also, make sure you try their curry fried rice (make it spicy is even better). You can't go wrong at eating here.

I loved Archi's on Sahara and was so bummed I would no longer be able to eat its yummy dishes when I moved back to NY.  I am in love with their stuffed chicken wings and their curries. All colors and flavors of curry are delicious.  Their noodle dishes are also quite good and soups. No dish has been disliked by me yet. 

One bad thing is they are not open late. They're only open til 10p and for late night diners, this sucks. There are three locations which is a good thing though.
I've been a regular here and always get the pad Thai or their curry dishes. I wish I had know of yelp! since I had my iPhone!

My favorite Thai place in town. I've been here many times over the past few years and it never ever disappoints.

The service is usually very good and the servers are very attentive.

The yellow curry is by far my favorite and the best curry in town I think. The chicken and seafood varieties are very good although I prefer the seafood.

Their pad Thai is also very good and the fish cake app is amazing.

Great place! This is my first time at this location but it was just a great! I've recently lived in Thailand and this is closest to homemade Thai food from the streets of Koh Samui! Highly recommended!

So, i love the food. Its the best Thai restaurant I've been to EVER...butttttt recently the service there has been very poor over the past couple of months. the last two times I've ordered take-out, both orders were completely wrong and I've had them read it back to me as well to make sure we were on the same page. Apparently, i need to take out my entire meal from now on in the shop to make sure I've gotten what I wanted correctly....
First time. Very slow service. Not bad food, but not worth the trouble waiting to get served. First and last time we will eat their.
The food here is very good, one of my favorite Thai restaurant. Service is excellent. Foods came quick. I had pad thai spicy level 10, was not disappointed!

Ridiculous pick up service.  I put in an order and they said it would be 25 minutes because they were backed up. Then, when we went, we had to wait ANOTHER 25 MINUTES!  During that time, they could have cooked many other meals which they did.  They helped all the people in the restaurant first even though they told me it would only take 25 minutes.  Plus, we went to pick up the order ourselves.  If you are backed up, you need to tell people not to come and give a better wait time.

When I called in to complain, the manager was not very nice.  He wasn't very apologetic and just said he would talk to the person taking orders.  He didn't offer a discount or any other good will.  We have been to that restaurant countless times and the manager was very rude.  He just hung up and wasn't willing to talk it through and just complained that it was "very busy" today.  Instead, he should have offered some sort of discount or something else for having us wait for so long.

Do not order take out from them.

Last time we did it online and then found out the restaurant was closed because all of the servers had quit that day.  

This time we ordered and had to wait an additional 25 minutes.  What is the point of ordering take out if you have to wait that long.

Finally, BEWARE when you order certain dishes.  We have ordered some dishes like curry, and the entrees, and the portion sizes are extremely small.  They aren't even big enough to fill half the plate.  I think when they are busy, they split the dishes into 2 so they can accommodate 2 take out orders.

Delicious!

Their walls are covered in awards, and every last one is well deserved. I'd post a picture of my food, but I ate it too fast.

Highly recommend the pad see ew. I've had it at a lot of Thai restaurants, and theirs is the best. Lots of egg, wide noodles, and plenty of flavor!

I took my parents for dinner. It was quiet and nice, and about half full. My parents ordered Pad See Ew and Pad Kea Mow, and I ordered Panang Curry. After a bit of waiting, they brought orders for my parents but mine. My parents started first thinking mine would be served shortly after. But it never came. And I was never updated on my order until I asked the servers twice all I got was "it's almost done". It never came till my parents finished theirs, and when I asked, answer was "it's because we have so many orders right now." So I had to cancel my order and the server just said OK. There was no apology or anything. My parents enjoyed the food. So good food. But not good service.
You know the food is good when you're full but want to keep on eating. Had the red curry lunch special. Delicious. Really great price for what you get.

I have been searching for years to find great pad thai here in Summerlin.....Done!  I have yet to dine in but it looks really nice.

I do the pick up option and the portion is do big I can have half for lunch and the rest for dinner!  Not bad for $8.  

Hoping to go in one of these days.

Can't go wrong with the pinapple currie! I never skip it when I go here. I love the environment and the service is attentive, even though some can be stingy sometimes. The prices are on the high side. Have had desert here too and its really good. Great thai food altogether.

The best Pad Thai noodles in the Valley, bar none.  If you haven't had a chance to try their Pad Thai noodles,  you're missing out.  If you do decide to give it a try, you may want to consider trying their shrimp fried rice too.  The best thing about this spot is that they're consistent.   Enjoy!

Still my favorite in the City!!!  Pad Ke Mao, Panang Curry, and the Pad Thai all amazing. Love the atmosphere, classy and comfortable. My one critique would be their portion size on their curries... for the price you would expect it would be a similar serving to  their other dishes.
Great food, Ok (not so great) service.  Strongly recommend. This is probably the best  Thai food place in Vegas.

Outstanding food - the service was not great though. A server met us as we were sat and asked if we were ready to order, and when we said we had not looked at the menu yet, they did not check back for a really long time. When we were ready to leave we also had to "flag them down" for the check.

Food is always good! However, the staff needs to work on their service. Little things like greeting their guest or when people are paying cash and there's a bunch of money left over ask if we need change. I bought a dish which cost 10.77 and i gave the host a 20$ and put it straight into the register. Their service ruins the experience for guest that want to dine in.

Stopped in for lunch today and three of us sat down to enjoy Thai food.  An order of Suki Hang  came with a well cooked, well seasoned whole napkin in the middle of the food.  No idea if the napkin had been used by the cook to wipe his nose or wipe his brow, etc.  The waitress apologized and went to the kitchen to have another order prepared.  The waitress returned in a few minutes to let us know the owner was contacted and allowed for no charge on that one order.  The manager on duty and the owner never came to the table to offer an apology, instead they allowed the waitress to handle the situation.  The incident caused all of us to lose our appetite when we considered what the napkin had been used for and how it made it into the food.  A totally disgusting situation and we have eaten at this restaurant previously and had one other incident of food not being prepared properly.  Look before you eat your meal at this restaurant!
Great for take out! Just remember they are closed on Tuesday. Beef salad is amazing - choose a 5. Just the right amount of heat.

The BEST curry and pad thai I have ever had..and they give such big portions. My boyfriend and I come here a lot. I introduced this place to him not long ago and he never had thai food before. He was astounded by how good it was. Very friendly staff and the place is big so it holds a lot of people and wait times aren't long when it's packed. I recommend this place to literally everyone.

Neat little place, the food was great but like other reviewers the service was lacking. It wasn't busy when we arrived but an hour and a half to wait for food is kind of ridiculous. Also, they forgot one of our dishes which took another half hour after asking about it three times. By then the place was busy. And three hours later we finally got our check.
My favorite in Vegas!!!!  I travel a lot for work and try not to head to Vegas on Tuesdays because Archie's is closed on Tue!

Hands down a very good place to have lunch.  The food was delicious and hot.  The service was good are cups are always full whenever are drinks are almost halfway.  Price for food is awesome especially for good large portions.  I will come again for lunch or even for dinner no doubt thanks guys.

Every time we try to go to Archi's, they're closed!!! It's either remodeling, taking extra time off for the holidays, or it happens to be Tuesday and they're closed every Tuesday. How does a business stay open? So annoying!!!

So, I'm pretty much ALWAYS in the neighborhood/general vicinity of this place, it's also been there for close to four years and yet as a lover a Thai food I STILL haven't tried this place? I hit up Buldogi's, Jollibee and Pyaar (R.I.P.) long before I even bothered to check this place out. Could it be living across the street from Basil n' Lime? I really don't know.

So I finally did check the place out. What a wise decision. :)

This may seem a little underwhelming to some because I had Pad Thai. I know, I know, too "Americanized," but that's the very dish that eased me into trying and loving Thai food, and to this day I feel the only way l I can trust a Thai restaurant is if they do Pad Thai right. Anyways, on to how I felt about the Pad Thai. It came out in a HUGE plate, and they don't skimp on the meat (a very good thing since Basil n' Lime is starting to get skimpy with the meat in their Pad Thai). It was fresh, and of course it would be ridiculous to expect Pad Thai to not be greasy at all, but the grease was at a minimum, which was great. No groggy, increased blood pressure feeling afterward. The only issue I had with the pad thai was a few too many glass noodles, they really could have cut back on that (and looking at other plates around the restaurant it seems like they smother EVERYTHING in glass noodles) In addition to the Pad Thai, I also had the Thai spring rolls. These definitely could have used a little more seasoning, but they were fine when dipped in the sweet chili sauce on the side.

The service wasn't very attentive unfortunately, I had to flag people down for pretty much everything, and the fact that the restaurant wasn't even that crowded made it even weirder. The dining floor is very nice though. Small but cozy feeling, not cramped. The ambiance is also in a sort of middle ground between casual and formal. The decor was also very in character (with the exception of the small Budda (not Buddha) statue on the front table....wtf?). The chairs were uncomfortable though, just saying. 

My bill came out to be about $13. At B n' L, it would be almost $16 or $17 for a similar meal, so that's one pro Archi's has over them.

THE FINAL VERDICT:

Pros:
Fresh food.
Reasonably priced.
They didn't screw up the pad thai, a good enough pro in of itself.

Cons:
Iffy service.
Too many glass noodles in everything.
Uncomfortable chairs, so it's probably better to do take-out.

The wtf?:
Is the fat Buddha (appropriately known as Budai) apart of Thai culture at all?

Suggestions:
Be more conservative with the glass noodles. You only need a little bit of them for some crunch in the food, since they don't have much of a flavor on their own. 

Will I return? I'm really not sure.

My friend and I ate at this restaurant on a whim after watching a movie together. We started lunch off with a pork satay with a peanut sauce that had a slight kick to it, which was delicious. For the main course, we had chicken pad thai and beef panang curry with a side of rice. Since my friend and I aren't big fans of spicy things, we got level 2 spiciness for our dishes (which can be rated out of 10). The pad thai was mediocore; it had good flavor and tender chicken, but nothing memorable or special about the flavor. The panang curry had a creamy sauce; the spices used to flavor it were good but like the pad thai, nothing memorable or special. For my drink, I had an iced thai tea; it was a large portion, but it was a bit on the sweet side. 

Though the dishes at this restaurant are good and served in an adequate amount of time, the dishes are not that special.

Great decor, relaxed environment and awesome staff. They offer great service and the food is outrageously tasty. Spicy level can be deceiving. I suggest 1-3 unless you're the adrenaline type. Rating is 1-10. Definitely recommend for casual or formal dining.
I've definitely had way better thai. I always order tom kha soup at thai places and this was by far the most bland I've had. They also need more help answering phones and seating people.

This place is great! 

The food is fantastic, good menu selection and everything is always consistently tasty. The Pad See Ew, Pad Kapow, Pla Moo and Masaman Curry are all great choices. The waitstaff is cordial (enough), but if you go for dinner... be prepared to be a little patient, as you may have to wait a bit to get serviced. Although in my opinion, it's a good thing when a restaurant is busy like this. One of my fave spots for Thai!!
Fresh spring rolls and Satay chicken are good appetizers. Pineapple curry combo was delicious. Sweet and sour chicken is the same as anywhere else.

Great Thai! The green curry was loaded with chicken and had good flavor, not the BEST I've had though. Their spice scale is serious, more intense than most. Papaya salad was huge, but missing more dried shrimp- I hardly saw any.

I wasn't going to write this review, but after contacting Archie's and not getting a reply to resolve the issue, I figured I should share. On Tuesday 5/15 a co worker and I got lunch pick up. I ordered the garlic pepper chicken. After only a couple of bites I noticed something firmly attached to a piece of chicken, but hoped it was a seasoning. Unfortunately I pulled it off and it was a shorter black hair. I was unable to eat my lunch after that. My $12 lunch was in the garbage. Such a waste. I know these things can happen, but fix it for your customers. Wasted food and money.  See attached photo.

So good the food you crave it after you et it I will be back. The service was great this was a spur of the moment place to dine before a movie.I have had a lot of  Thai food around town and this is really good food

Great Thai restaurant with lots of choices and a very nice ambiance. The staff there were super friendly. The Panama curry was to die for - rich and creamy just like our waitress told us. We also got the Pad Thai which was excellent. Great prices too!

I ended up ordering the chicken Pad Thai which was ok. A bit on the dry side. Also, it would have been nice if the server asked me if I wanted a lunch special or the full entr√©e. A bit pricey for the quality of food. I'd rather go to Corner Thai Kitchen. Better food and better prices.

Just went to Archi's on a Saturday and while it was busy, the host told me a table for 2 would be about 5 minutes. I put my name on the list. 15 minutes later and 10 empty tables later still not seated. The tables were cleaned and reset by the other staff but no one bothered to seat us. The host seemed to be doing anything but seating customers which they probably seat everyone at the same time and cause a strain on the back of the house. Get your game together. We left to say the least.

After having tried various Thai restaurants around Vegas we had finally arrived at Archi's.  Let me just say that we should have tried here first. 

Ate the Panang Curry, fried tofu, and broccoli. Way more than enough for two and much much better service than lotus of siam. If you're in the mood for Thai then this is the place.

Consistent. Love coming here for casual dining. Very clean, friendly. The food is spot on. 
This time around had the ginger, ginger beef and curry pandang wit chicken. It was delicious. 
Great Thai food!

We had kind of a strange experience this time. Walked through an open door way with the door broken off the hinges and propped up against the wall outside. So it was a bit drafty inside and we walked to be moved further from the door... we were sat directly to the left of the open door maybe two tables down. After we were moved it was less drafty but still on the cool side. This was the day we had the snow storm for 2.5 minutes. We got our usual with the addition to the deep fried tofu. The pad Thai came back with a chemical taste and wasn't edible. So that was a bummer. Seemed like they're didn't properly clean or let burn off whatever cleaner was being used. So we then split the veggie basil. Towards my last bite I wasn't sure if it tasted odd or maybe it was just cold at that point. Our Thai tea was even a different color... we thought it might have been a different batch or bottom of the batch scenario. It tasted normal for the most part but the coloring was darker than the norm. Other tables had the same and no complaints so we over looked it. The service was still good. Never had a complaint about the service though!! Seems like just an off day.

Below average.  Use to be good, but now they just toss stuff together.  Too much spice ( turmeric) in one dish.  The other dish -papaya salad tasted a few days old.
I won't be returning.
Try Natalie Thai.
Have eaten here numerous times. Probably My favorite Thai restaurant in the Vegas area. Food it consistent quality and fresh.

Archie's has some of the best Thai food in the valley but has the worst take-out. The location is always slammed and living local it's nice to pickup and eat at home but after witnessing through others and first hand, the servers constantly get orders wrong and then you get stuck waiting close to an hour for your food. After this being my 3rd experience, we've decided to order take out some place else.

Got here to The Sahara location at 9:28 and they are already cleaning up and the guy In the front says were only doing take outs. REALLY it's 30 mins until you close. Not 30 min until you lock the door and leave. I really hate placed that are in such a damn hurry to get out and close. I assure you the Owner of the company isn't there it's just the lazy workers who want to go home as early as possible.  I come here a couple times a month and have never experienced this.  Might not come back.
The place is a little pricey compared to other Thai Restaurants around town but the good food is really good and worth it.

Service was poor. We ordered yellow chicken curry spice level of #7 and it wasn't spicy whatsoever. We asked for chili paste/yellow mustard, they said they only have siracha (sp). Overall was very disappointing.

Update: Not happy! On 5.17.2015 I dined in the restaurant with a friend and the male waiter ran my card at the wrong table, then proceeded to run my card for my check for the full amount when we paid half cash. He brought it to me to sign and I called him out on it. He went back and ran he it for the correct amount, but I'm pissed. Who does that??? You ran my card at the wrong table?!? Not okay!  Then took my cash and ran my card for the full amount... Not okay!!! They should have offered my meal free or discounted. I eat there at least 3 times a month. I'm very disappointed and upset! I'll be attaching a photo from my bank statement showing all 3 charges that are still pending on my account. 

Update: I really love this place! I've tried other Thai restaurants and I have yet to find one that is better than Archi's. The Yellow curry is my favorite. I've inly eaten inside the restaurant maybe 2-3 times. We typically order takeout.
solid penang curry. i ordered to go and it was delicious. had some leftovers and re-heated two days later, and it was still solid.

I often order from the lunch menu.  My go to lunch order is ginger ginger chicken.  Food is served quickly and it's a fresh made to order food!

Fresh Thai food at good price.

Archi's is a decent enough Thai restaurant - 3 stars - but when we visited today the manager/supervisor who seated us was surly and angry, for no apparent reason. She seated us and then came to the table 3 minutes later to take our order- "are you ready"(add attitude)...we ordered a few minutes later and she didn't say thank you, or do you have any questions... Menus taken away with a sneer... Saw her leave at 5pm, barking orders to her staff. Bad karma rolls downhill Ms. Supervisor/Manager ... Not coming back. RUDE.

Love me some Archi's. my husband always gets the chicken pad tai. I love the pad woonsen. It's very thin glass noodles. If you don't know what to order at a Thai place (that was always my problem) I'd star with pad woonsen. I ordered with no mushroom and scarfed it down.

I went there with my boyfriend and my best friend.  I ordered the pad Thai and it was delicious. The portion was huge,  (for only me) so I ate half of it and took the rest home. Prices are very affordable. The  only thing I dislike was how long we waited for the food. They also brought out my friends food first, which left her waiting another 10 mins or so until our food got there. I really liked it but it didn't surpass my expectations. The service was just okay, not too much attention was given like other restaurants. I will most likely visit again but Pin Kaow is still my favorite Thai restaurant. I would give it 3.5 stars!

Archi's is my go to Thai place in Vegas! Anything you get here is going to be delicious, no lie. Some of my favorites are..

Panang Curry - I would definitely recommend this dish with tofu, it literally will melt in your mouth. The tofu is slightly fried so the outside has some texture and it is served over white rice. Sadly brown rice is an extra $2. 

Pad Kea Mow - This dish is so satisfying and delicious. Best Pad Kea Mow I have ever had.

Tom Yum Soup - Sometime I will get this as an light appetizer before my main entree, but  be careful they make this REALLY spicy so get a low number for spice.

Pad Thai - always a winner.

I also really like the red and green curries, pineapple fried rice, pad prik king, spicy basil and rad nar. 

The service here is usually pretty good and the servers are attentive. The prices are reasonable and the food is always delicious. I can't get enough Archi's :)

Really great and quiet atmosphere. I ordered the pad Thai noodles combo with chicken. Definitely recommend that however I feel like the wonton that came with it wasn't great. Had a tiny filling while the wonton itself was the size of my hand, didn't make sense.

I've heard lots of folks talk about this Thai place called Archie's.  this is my favorite kind of food. I've eaten here 4 times now. Ordered different food each time. I think the food here is good. Good I say, not great. I could not find anything that puts this restaurant above any other Thai restaurant. The price is high for the for the food you get. I recommend it but with a note added that the meals will cost almost double that of other good Thai restaurants.

This place is AMAZING, to say the least. 

I've been looking for amazing Thai food, and thanks to some friends, I found it. We ordered about 7 different dishes, and they were ALL delicious.

You will definitely find me here.

Great Thai food and very authentic! I had several dishes shared with my friends and we all loved it! I will be back for sure and it's a new go to Thai place for me! The pineapple fried rice was the star of the show but everything was good.

I love thai food and usually stick with Pin Kaow 3, but I had spotted Archi's Thai Cafe (during multiple trips to Bachi Burger...shh don't judge) and made a mental note to try it soon.

I'm glad I did! Came here for a late lunch with friends. There were a handful of other people in the restaurant. Service was ok, the waitresses were mostly attentive but there were long gaps between water refills. Other than that, the waitresses were nice.

What really made me happy I tried Archi's Cafe was that their spice level is actually SPICY! Their scale is 1-10 (like Pin Kaow and other thai restaurants) but ordering a 9 here, felt like a real level 9! 

It was spicy, my lips were on fire halfway through my plate of veggie pad thai and I was in heaven. I consistently order spicy level 10 at other thai restaurants and it's hot but not truly spicy. Archi's did that for me.

Unlike the other Archi's Thai restaurants in Vegas, this one is very very close to my home. This is a very dangerous thing!

I get, exclusively, the Chicken Panang Curry because it is delicious. I use Archi's Panang Curry as my bar to which other Thai food is compared.

Pro-tip: they'll ask you if you want spicy level 1-10. If you're a fan of spicy food, it actually goes to 30 (in increments of 5 after 10). I get the 30. It's good. At the one on S. Rainbow a 30 is *incredibly* and inedibly hot for me. Here, however, it's only *incredibly* hot, and thus edible. Different Archi's have different levels once you venture into the land beyond the 1-10 scale. Tread lightly. Work your way up.
Always pleased with their lunch special very delicious fresh food.  It's close to a lot of shopping centers and a local favorite

After having a bad take out dinner at Basil and Lime down the street... I have to apologize to Archi's for not giving them an excellent review since I've been going here for a few years. It's time to give them props.  Tom Yum - right amount of spice and sourness, pineapple fried rice awesoooome, Pad Thai yum yum, Panang Curry so delish, Pad See Saw - I guess that's what its called also perfection.  Props to this chain great food, I won't cheat on you again, only did it cuz you close on Tuesdays.... why Thai food is good any day in my book.

This is a great lunch spot. I wouldn't get too crazy by saying you will have an authentic experience but you will leave satisfied. The spice levels are a bit low so you might consider kicking it up a notch like your buddy Emeril.

Food is quite tasty, menu is sufficiently varied.

However: they add sugar to almost every dish during preparation (I ask for "no sugar"), the spice range (1-10) varies greatly depending on who's in the kitchen ... and for goodness sakes, PLEASE change your music!

Highly recommended

I am a big fan of Thai food, so when I moved here, I saw a whole bunch of Thai Restaurants that didn't impress me much. I happened to accidentally stumble upon Archi's Flamingo location by turning into that parking lot since i couldn't make a U-turn. I decided to give it a go a week later with my auntie and I was impressed. 

The atmosphere inside the restaurant is warm and inviting, something about it makes you feel like you belong there. I dunno, it's weird. I got there a little after lunch time started and it wasn't that busy. I was greeted by two waitresses and they were very friendly. 

The menu has a pretty good selection, and most dishes you have the choice of what type of meat (or shrimp) that you want. I pretty much just looked for what I know, and ordered it up. My auntie ordered the Pad Thai with Chicken, i ordered the Curry and we shared a plate of Papaya Salad. YUMMY. It was so good, the curry had a nice balance of spiciness and creaminess with a touch of sweetness. The papaya salad was good too, when we ordered it they ask how spicy you want it. Well, other places you go to, when you say spicy it's usually just mild. HA HA. No, not in this case, it was so spicy we had to take it to go and work on it another time! :) But my favorite dish, till this day is the Pad Thai. It has such a RICH flavor to it, and when you receive it, YOU mix the noodles, sprouts and peanuts yourself. :) 

So far, I'm liking it, I will be back hopefully next time to try out more dishes!

pretty good place.  my father would rate this place a four star, he is here every moment that he can get to eat. i luv it because it is clean and it is good for family gathering. If you get a chance to eat here and love seaqfood try as an entree the tom yum soup (sea food mix). It will be good enough for four or more people to eat. Also, most their plates can feed more than two. check it out!!!
Ive always ordered the Tom yum soup here. But lately, it's been too sour for me. My stomach always gets upset after eating here. Sad to stop ordering from here :(
I have been to every Archi's location in Vegas.  You cannot go wrong with the food.  It is fantastic.  Service is good, but can be a bit unorganized when its busy.  Overall definitely worth going to.

Lunch special is good.
 Panang curry is my favorite! 
when i take out, food was little different,, but its ok still good
It's my favorite restaurant. Great food, excellent selection and great service. My favorite dishes are num tok beef and pad see-ew w/ chicken. I highly recommend this place

Yummy Thai food!  Lots of menu options.  Love the Tom Yum soup.  They managed to scale back the spicyness without losing the flavor.  

Wait staff was. Friendly and accomodating.  Will be back for sure!

Lots of gluten free choices!! Best of all the 
Accommodate you make it.. Very consistent restaurant thank you you don't see that in restaurants anymore

Ordered to go two times so far and have been thoroughly satisfied both times. I've visited a few other Thai places in the valley and have yet to found one worthwhile. Sadly I think this is the first place I've been to that had somewhat fresh vegetables. I think Archi's is "the one"!

Never been disappointed here--dinner and lunch specials always hot & fresh at a good price.  The fried tofu appetizers are crispy delights, their panang or red curry dishes are savory, the stuffed chicken wings amazing (how do they get so much stuffing in there?).  Servers are attentive and friendly.

This was my first time at this location- I usually go to the Rainbow location. The food tastes the same. I got the Tom Ka, Pad See Ew, and Panang. My friend likes to eat very spicy food and I can handle only some bang bang! in my food so we agreed on a level 5. The food came out in a good amount of time. The soup came out first, and it was very good. My only complaint was this - the restaurant wasn't that busy, and our waitress took our order by memory. I understand that there are alot of people out there with stellar memories and take orders like this all the time, but she was not one of them. When we first gave our order, she messed up our meat selections for each dish several times. We wanted beef pad see ew, shrimp tom ka, and chicken panang. She had to recite our order to us several times. I even suggested jokingly that she should write it down just in case she mixes it up! She just laughed and said she got it. Trustingly, my friend and I were like ok, and we weren't worried. When we finally got our food, every dish had the wrong meat selection. We were thinking about sending it back but we were too hungry to even argue. All in all, never coming to this location again

I stopped in for the first time last week for dinner and gave them a 5 star review. Today was lunch with my little one and I have to say the service was subpar. Food was still great so the cooks know what they are doing, but the service not so much.

I ordered the lunch Pad Thai and a side of plain rice noodles for my one and half year old (didn't see any children's menu or offered a separate children's menu). 

Soup it came with was good. They brought out a bowl of rice which I thought came with lunch, and my food a bit later.

No noodles for the baby. Had to ask about 5 minutes into my own meal all the while trying to keep me quiet by giving him the rice which he just threw on the floor.

The baby started to fuss toward the end of the meal so I handed them my CC so we could get out of their quickly. When I got it and bill I noticed they had charged me for the rice, which I never asked for. Not wanting to flag them down and reverse the transaction I signed their copy and made a note on the itemized copy about the overcharge. 

Because this place doesn't seem family friendly I will not be coming here on a regular basis. Maybe once in and blue moon for dinner when we have a sitter, but even that will be rare. In the meantime, I will be looking for another thai place that meets my expectations.

I haven't been to Archie's in about 5 years, but as I am back in town to visit family I decided to take my dad to lunch to one of our former favorite places. The cuisine at Archie's never disappoints, and today was no exception. I ordered the seafood combination green curry and my father ordered his favorite, po-tak soup. Both entrees were equally delicious, but I was partial to the green curry. It was PERFECT. The seafood was fresh and not one bit overcooked. The green curry sauce was light and creamy, but still extremely flavorful. I all but licked the serving plate. My only complaint would be that we were left alone for about 15 minutes after initially being seated, and we had to get up to ask to order some drinks. However, the service steadily improved from there on.

Hands down our family's favorite restaurant!  Anytime my husband and I want go out for food, we always say "let's try something different." And we go right back to Archie's! LoL however, this review is solely for their THAI BEEF SALAD!! After I eat this, I dream about it for the next week. That's how good it is.  I get that salad at other Thai restaurants and nothing can compete with Archie's. They put tons of beef in it, which I like- because some restaurants only put like 4 slices. And the dish itself is the tastiest thing in the world!! So refreshing, spicy, and just overall delicious. You need this in your life!

I never knew I'd love eating catfish orr curry. I guess archi's has given me a reason to. It's called chu-chi here and it has both curry and catfish in one dish. I get it at level 7 cus I love the spices from Thai cuisine. We always have celebrations here or sometimes just roll deep for no reason. I'd say it's prolly the last great thing standing at village square, besides the movie theater next door.

By far the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. Also I'd like to add that this is my new overall favorite restaurant! The service was great and the food was amazing!

I'd recommend this to ANYONE & EVERYONE in the Las Vegas area even if you're just visiting.

First time coming here with my cousin and husband and kids. Very small place but the service was good and the menu had a good selection.  Love how they rate the level of spicy for you, although we got a 5-6 it was pretty spicy! We loved it!  We couldn't finish everything and we has left overs! Awesome! Very authentic Thai Food!!

Terrible service... good food. The server took the order and vanished, never brought the requested spice tray nor refilled drinks. I think her name is Dhen. Unfriendly, coarse and unprofessional. But the food is consistently good.

Archi's is definitely my go-to Thai food place. I've been coming here since it opened and replaced my beloved Pick Up Stix. I LOVE their pad thai and can live off of it for days. A few other favorites are the Sweet and Sour chicken and Masaman curry. I eat here about once a week and the only thing I don't love is the consistency of the service. It's always the same handful of workers and sometimes they are fabulous and sometimes they just drop our plates on the corner of the table and walk away. I still love the food and just order it to go to avoid the chance that the service might not be as good that night.
Came in for lunch. Such a cute place.soft instrumental music playing. Clean big comfy chairs, but the food took a while. The service was poor, but I enjoyed their food.
Great dining experience, wonderful service and excellent Thai food!  Highly recommended if you are looking for great Thai food that allows for spice accommodations from 1-10.
Sucked. No one came to seat us. Waited over 5 minutes and left....and I'm starving dammit!

Good chicken Tom Kha--great broth and the chicken had little to no fat, but it had that stale chicken flavor that I hate...the tinge smell--that almost ruined it but great broth!  The pad seayou chicken was great--- so so good!  It was better than the beef by far!  Generous portion of Thai iced teas, and clean and good service.  I will be back--hopefully often but I am always scared of chicken that's of fresh.

Pyaar Indian Restaurant a few stores down...Y U WEBSITE SAY U HAVE BUFFET MONDAY BUT U NO OPEN MONDAY?!?!

Maybe it was for the best...Original plan was to hit up Pyaar for indian buffet and get some spice and flavor on. Too bad it was closed but this couldnt have worked out better as a vast majority of people leaving their parked cars were migrating toward Archi's.

Shapow man ordered a beef salad which came real quick. My red curry lunch special took it's sweet time but what lacked in readily available made up in mmmm mmmm good.
