The soup that is included with the lunch special was kind of a thai american fusion. It was chicken soup but was thickened and egg dropped. Thick cuts of onion, carrot slivers, and celery with decent sized slices of chicken white meat.

I was overall impressed with the red curry. Medium wasnt quite as spicy as i was expecting ordering a medium but it had a very pleasant creaminess from the coconut milk. Lots of bamboo shoots which i love. Salad was perfectly dressed with a thickened fish sauce (i think) based dressing. Overall everything on that plate was friggin good.

Total damage done between an order of the red curry lunch special, a beef salad, and a cranberry juice: 21.49

Wait....what? the total damage rung up to twenty one fiddy?? Oh hells no i'm bout to come back a few more times.

My go-to place for thai food :) Although it's kinda far from my house, I still like to come here whenever I want thai food.
I have tried green, red, and panang curry, pad thai, pad kee mao, pad see ew, tom yum kong, pineapple fried rice. All of them are amazingly good.
The portion is pretty decent for the price too.
Service is decent, the waiter/waitress always have a smile on their face, which is a good thing.
Definitely worth a try :)
They have the best Thai Beef Salad in town. I accidentally stumbled upon them almost two years ago and I'm so glad I did!

My go-to place for days when I can't be bothered to cook dinner and am looking for some real&good Thai food in a comfortable setting. I've come to always gravitate towards the spring rolls, green curry and spicy eggplant with tofu. The service has generally been great, and the food consistently hits the spot.

Take-out here is also a great option; they usually take 15-25 minutes to prepare my order after I call in, which gives me enough time for me to make the drive to pick it up. The to-go containers they use are really convenient for any leftovers.

I hadn't been to a Thai restaurant before. I had the medium spicy garlic pepper chicken and it was absolutely amazing!!! Great, friendly service too. I will definitely come back to try other items. I thought the prices were good too.

DONT ORDER TAKE OUT! **update** shrimp roll appetizer was good but Tom Yum not near the kind I had in Thailand this soup was bland! I just got back from Thailand and was craving Tom Yum so I called an order in that took FOREVER to get. I will say despite my horrible first experience from waiting forever after calling my order in and showing up 10 minutes AFTER the time they said it would be ready to get my food and having someone jump in front of me in line they seem to have good customer service. If I decide to return is sit inside I'll update post with review on tom yum shrimp soup once I finally make it home to taste it! Crazy part is I still left a $6.00 tip  at take out because something is mentally wrong with me and I still tip even when I'm mad.

love Thai food.  we tried this place one random night the husband was away for work.  las vegas is a large grid.  so going down one main exit street could take hours to find the end.  we just moved here so we drove down 215 and found an exit to travel down one such street and chance stumbling upon a restaraunt we wanted to eat at.  

again, the streets can go on forever as ever.  we were almost to
our own street [buffalo] so we had to decide fast.. 

we came upon a plaza that had a jollie bee, a fancy shmancy, a couple other things... and archi's thai cafe.   though I told the kids they could pick what they wanted, I came out the winner in this game.  again, I love Thai food.

theirs lots of parking.. 

the decor is very traditional thai and is a really good sized restaurant with lots of seating.  our waitress was friendly and though it was busy.. she never forgot about us.

the order:

appetizer- stuffed chicken..  [wow]  the kids loved it..  my son, who doesn't often venture from the norm,  loved  this dish a lot.  super good..

i had my usual yellow chicken curry mildly spiced and i they had an excellent curry..

won ton soup- the won tons were juicy and the broth flavorful.. the vegetables and slices meat slices were plentiful.  it definitely did not disappoint.

shrimp fried rice- comes with a lot!  it's tasty.

after trying archis for the first time..  i'm a fan!
will definitely try the one closer to our house.. not sure when i'll ever see this particular location again.. but if i were closer i'd probably be a regular!
Had the cashew beef Spicey and it was outstanding we were a group of 13 so had a number of different dishes and they were all good - clean good atmosphere and excellent service
I love the food but the service is very disorganized, I feel I'm always calling them. They seem to have language barrier and it's frustrating to get service here.

Best Thai we have found so far after moving to Vegas.  An Extra Plus is that they have knowledge of Celiac Disease and what has Gluten.  We had family visiting for a conference.  We showed up for dinner.  We were seated promptly.  Pad Thai was some of the best I have had.  We will return, especially on a movie night!!

This is my favorite thai place, possibly ever. Service is attentive, the food is fantastic and never takes very long to arrive, the price is incredibly reasonable, and the aesthetics are super nice. With the movie theatre right next door, it is the perfect location for a low-key date night. The pad see eau never does me wrong, and as someone who is gluten intolerant, I feel like it is worth saying that I have never had a reaction from their food, either.

One of the best Thai restaurants I've been. We were seated right away on a Saturday evening, and the service was fast, accurate, and very friendly. 
We ordered pad kee mow - amazing! And also the country curry. I would recommend the pad kee mow because the portion is quite big. Mild spicy doesn't taste spicy at all. The country curry wasn't that impressive, unfortunately. It is water based, so it doesn't taste like the traditional coconut based curry. 
The dessert was fantastic. We ordered coconut ice cream with sticky rice. Wow! It was so big and delicious! Definitely do it if you like coconut. 
Will come again next time we are in Vegas!

Picked up take out, shrimp fried rice and ongchoi with pork.  Packaged nicely. 

Exactly what I wanted.  Delicious !
I love this place!!! My favorite place to get pad Thai. My husband & I come here at least once a week.

This is our regular Thai restaurant place, the food is good, reasonable price, decent portion. Our favorite are beef pad prik king, beef salad, papaya salad, sea food panang, chicken pad kea mow, and sea food pancake.

Definitely deserves a 5 star rating! My friends and I have been coming to the Archi's Thai Cafes for a few years now and we always order BIG family style! If you're lucky to get Pete at one of the Archi's, he's a real cool guy! We used to order the Catfish Delight until Pete highly recommended the Choo Chee Catfish at #3! Soo good! The mood is right for casual dining or if you'd like to have a good quiet dinner with a special person ;) Our friend is Thai and they said it's one of the best they've ever tasted!


Our usual order looks something like this: Tom Kha soup, Choo Chee catfish, Pad Kee Maw, Lard Na, Eggplant beef, and LOTS of steamed rice! Hope you're prepared for some knockout food! Sawadee ka and bon app√©tite! (dang, three different languages?!)

I have been to Thailand and eaten at many Thai places in Vegas. Archies is not my favorite, but its not far behind. For a quick lunch, it may be the best via lunch combos. Yes its a chain, but Archies keeps the food very authentic in my opinion.

Lunch combo is $7.95 and comes with a full soup, wanton, egg roll and entree. My GF and I usually split it as its to bog for one person. The Thai Basil rocks as does the PadThai. There Thai Tea is excellent as well.   

NO WIFI! I go here for lunch break and sometimes i need WIFI to make it a working lunch and keep me out of the office. That sucks but I guess they dont want people hanging around after they finish their food.

Kept hearing from everyone that Archi's is awesome.  Overrated in my opinion.  You sink in the chairs and feel like a child in a high chair and I'm a very tall person.  Food was not as good as my favorite Thai place - Thai style noodle house, and was more expensive.  Won't be returning.  Nothing stood out.

Pad Thai was a little salty and greasy... and they charged my friend $1.99 for extra rice !!!  Been coming here several times already and not been charged extra for additional servings of rice (which is the usual for Asian Restaurants)... Rice is like water to most Asians... should be free !

Awesome service.
Awesome location.
Solid atmosphere.
Excellent food!

Been here for lunch and for dinner and it rocked both times.  All very very good: Red Curry Chicken, Spicy Basil (both Beef and Chicken) and Pad Thai.  Fresh spring rolls are just so-so but thats not because of Archi's.. they are always just so-so anywhere.

Hot rating runs a little hot from my experience... a 4 here is like a 6 at other places but its still super good.

Don't miss this place, the great food or the great service.

Been to just about every Thai place in Vegas. Archis is definitely one of the best. Best beef noodle soup in town by far. Spent a month in Thailand and although the name kind of has an american feel, the food is authentic! So good! Do your self a favor and eat here. For the price, one of Vegas' gems.
One of my favorite Thai restaurants in town. If you have a chance, visit during lunch. Their specials are extremely reasonable and delicious!

The pad Thai was exceptional... A 5 was spicy, but still consumable:) one person in our Group ordered a seven and that was a bit much. He was sweating like crazy!!! There was another person in our group who had the pepper steak, it was really, really good, another person in our group had the Red Curry &  that was really good as well.  I absolutely loved the cucumber salad & overall it was a great experience. It was a little busy for a large group at lunch, so you might want to think about that if you have to get in and out!  The service was 2 star and they charged us an automatic 18% .. Not cool, as the service was Soooo Bad.  We would go again, as the food was excellent, not with a group... If the service is horrible again, we won't go back. 4 Stars, only because of the tasty food!

Location wise is perfectly situated right by Regal Cinemas in Village Square! Conveniently accessible for those hunger cures before of after a movie.  For those unfamiliar...Archi's Thai Cafe may seem like another Asian/American Fusion like PF Changs...or pick up stiX...but in fact when one takes a closer look, 100% Authentic Thai is clearly shown.  Try and behold for this is true.  Upon first walking in, the restaurant feels small, but the wooden shutters, and wooden tables and chairs balances this out and gives you a good feel of solidity to its decor.  This is not your usual Asian themed furniture but don't let this fool you, for the food is as good as it gets.  

Waiters will take your order and ask you from a level of 1-10 how spicy you would like your food to be, and plenty enough to satisfy all types of taste buds and spice level to handle.  Tom Kha may not be for everyone but It is a great little soup starter like won ton soup for Chinese food.  Price could be cheaper, but the quantity of food is decent enough and good enough for the price.  I don't know if your typical person would go everyday, but nice to have once in a while.  Thai food is comparable to Pin Kaow or Lotus of Siam

Archi's is clean and food comes out at a respectable time frame. A little advice tho, get there before 6pm or off times because after 6pm the restaurant starts to get busy and picks up a lot of customers...you may have a line out the door or wait.  Others must think it is good though to keep coming back for more.  Give it a try...It is pretty good.

Decent Thai food, but didn't quite blow me away. True to what others have said, they really do make "spicy" spicy. I ordered the tong yum soup and the red curry, both at medium spicy level, and both were indeed quite spicy (I am also a fan of spiciness). They were generous with with the seafood in the tong yum, and the curry was solid. Portions are also very generous. I"m not from the area, so I can't comment on how it compares to other places in Summerlin, but it's decently good in my opinion.

We love the food here! The pad Thai never disappoints. The lunch special is the best deal ever. Huge portions. BUT... DON'T ORDER A SODA at this location. They bring you out a glass of ice and a can of soda... NO REFILLS and it's $1.95. Crazy to pay that for a can of soda. The Thai tea is delicious and it's $3.95. No refills but comes in a big glass.

First time trying Archie's. We were in the area and we found it strictly based on Yelp reviews.

Really enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was extremely attentive!

I personally enjoyed the Pineapple Chicken Curry a lot. Chicken had lots of flavor and was cooked perfectly.

My wife had the Chicken Chow Mein (and I must agree) it was very bland and lacked any type of seasoning.

Our biggest issue was the "Fresh Spring Rolls" which are a signature of any good Thai restaurant. These had a very doughy wrap and felt more like vegetable sushi rolls. Once again, no seasoning or signature flavor at all. The peanut sauce was extremely tame and didn't add much.  Did not enjoy these at all (mainly because of the wrap)

I wanted to give Archie's five stars right when we walked in... It's a beautiful spot. But it wouldn't be the truth after eating the food.

This place is always serving great Thai food and have not had a problem yet with any of their dishes. The spring rolls have a nice mix along with the pork and shrimp wontons which have a nice crunch and flavor with their sweet sauce. I love the spice so I usually stick with the Chicken Pad Thai spicy level 15 Even tho its spicy the flavor is amazing and to help wash it down get a large Thai tea
Huge portions, great tasting food, and very good service. I will be back again.

Archi's is THE BEST Thai Food in Las Vegas. Honestly it might be the best I've had anywhere. The Sahara location is jsut as nice as all the others, and a little less crowded.
Do yourself a favor and go here as often as possible!

I always like going to Archi's.  Nice folks and good place to get consistently good quality Thai food.  This location has a nice ambience and hasn't been too horribly crowded when I've been.

Get the stuffed chicken wings.  Best in town.

Lately, we've just been getting food to go.  Last time we just walked in and ordered and got our food in 10 minutes.  Awesome!  

Spice levels are from 1-5.  3 isn't really spicy at all so if you want spicy, go for a 4 or 5.  In my experience, this restaurant doesn't do crazy Thai spicy and they have been pretty conservative with the spice, at least with us.

Archi's for me always always been my favorite Thai spot in Vegas. I have been a fan ever since there first location on flamingo. Just seeing Archi's grow with two more locations all on my side of town not only makes it more accessible. I love seeing non franchise chains or that small family style run restaurant succeed. The thing about success and growing more restaurants is will the consistency be there at ALL locations. I can honestly say before I tried this location the one on rainbow my go to since closest to home. The food has been just as awesome, amazing, and on point every time. I am huge fan of the lunch specials! I also come lot for dinner with my brother family. I have never had bad dish on the menu. Some of my favorite are the spicy basil, any of the curry, and really can go on and on. Just ry it if never had Archi's. 

This location it right next to the movie theater so makes for perfect before movie or after movie spot. Honestly that shopping center almost ridiculous amount of quality and assortment of food can get not just Thai food. Leave that for another review. Lol! 

Two things that stood out for me came to this location versus the others. I felt like the lunch special portion was twice the size compare the rainbow location. I would order the same thing spicy basil with ground chicken. Swear the spicy basil was twice the size. The plate was full full compare to rainbow location everything looked nicely portion size. Just overflowing almost. Thumbs up for me!!! The dining area might be the same size as rainbow location but feel like bigger again maybe double in size. Fair the set up lot more different. The dining room has high ceilings compare to the rainbow location. Upfront almost like dining room next to dining room. Not as loud so comes lunch time or busy no need to shout out conversations. The tables not literally next to one another then rainbow location. The decor like definitely know walking into Thai restaurant. The service feel like they stop by more often check up on you. I went right around prime lunch hour and not as busy as rainbow location. 

Overall Archi's is my five star Thai hands down. Just happy not only do they have multiple locations but knowing that get the same great food at each one. Five star all on its own. Consistency...
Always great food and people here....lotta people here for lunch...we love the chicken satay and Pad Thai combination house special.

5 stars for this visit. Food was ready in the exact time they told me for my takeout order. All the food we got was excellent. Best Thai food restaurant that we've been to in the Summerlin area - and we've tried a bunch. Glad they got their takeout business on track and glad I came back for a 2nd try.
Ok so I am from LA.  This is not LA thai...  It is very good.  We had the Tom Yum soup with shrimp...  Very nice.  We had the red curry.  Very nice...  Best I have had in Vegas...

Really solid restaurant. The service is great and so is the food. If it had the option I would rate it as a 4.5. The reason not a five is because its great but its also not the absolute best I have had. I would say it is authentic and I would highly recommend!

So Archi's turned out to be a hidden gem after going there for the first time, I thought the food was decent but not spicy as I had ordered. I LOVE spicy food- the hotter, the better. I know most people think they like spicy food and when you give them a mildly hot dish they start crying like a baby. Which is why I always order my dishes at the highest spice level a restaurant serves. And so, my first visit to Archi's I did as such and was disappointed by the lack of heat. I mentally crossed them off my checklist of my favorite Thai spots....  A month later I was craving Thai and Archi's is literally a block from my house so I gave them another try. After the first 5 bites of food, I was breathing FIRE!! I couldn't believe the extreme turn around of spiciness level and I absolutely loved it! 

Archi's has now become one of my top favorite Thai places and I know I can count on them to live up to my expectations. I work in a smoky bar and when I get home from work I usually feel sick to my stomach from breathing in second-hand smoke all day. The Tom Yum with chicken (level 10) always does the trick to make me feel better or cure a hangover. I also LOVE the Pad Pak w/chicken (lot's of delicious veggies with choice of meat), Garlic Pepper Chicken, and Red Curry. The only think I don't care for is the Pad Thai at this place. It's reddish orange for some reason....??

As a lover of Masaman curry, I've been trying a lot of places to try and find the best one.  At around 10 dollars (including tax) I'd say their beef masaman curry is well worth the money.  It's definitely not the best.  My favorite so far would be Komol's (in Sahara) but this is a good alternative considering I live in Summerlin.  The reason I don't think theirs was as good was because the beef pieces were "sliced" (as opposed to chunks of beef like at Komol) and the potato wasn't cooked as thoroughly as I'd like (it was still kind of hard).  The service was subpar.
Love love love this place!!  its missing a star because they NEVER have mochi  Take it off the menu if youu dont carry it anymore

This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the valley (yes, I've been to Lotus of Siam). We always split an order the chicken pad thai ((no bean sprouts)) and chicken satay and typically have enough for lunch the next day. Their satay peanut sauce is BOMB and service is ALWAYS fast.  Takeout is just as good and satisfying as dining in and your order is usually available in under 20 minutes. We've tried the location on Rainbow, but it just didn't seem to be the same- a bummer because we're moving soon and won't be at all close to this location anymore. The corny instrumental versions of popular songs are always entertaining to listen to while waiting for your food!

Great spot for a date before catching a movie in the same shopping center.

Service is the pits. Get ready to settle in. We waited a hour for a take out order that had 3 appetizers, 3 entrees, and a soup. The Tom Yum Chicken soup was delicious, but everything else was just okay. Other places do it just as well, in a timely manner.
Mine and my husbands default place for food. I get the same thing every time and love it: spicey basil with chicken.

One of my favorite Thai Restaurants in Vegas, great food at reasonable prices. We usually get their chicken Pad Thai and chicken fried rice both are good. My only complaint is whenever we try to call for a reservation they never ever answer the phone it always goes to voicemail. 

So we usually just drive there wait for a table and the food is always great. We've tried to call for reservations on three separate visits and never get through. But the great food makes up for this inconvenience.

I was feeling ill last week, so I decided to get some soup and noodles to sustain my cold, and I tried this place out since I live down the street, and I was impressed! the chicken soup and a variety of vegetables and had a good bite of spice to it which helped clear up my chest congestion and the chicken noodles especially tasty with carrots and lettuce chopped in it. I'll be trying this place soon again with it being right next to the movie theater makes it even better.

I've dined here probably 15-20 times since my coworkers love this place, it's close to work, and they have good lunch specials. I'm happy with everything I've ordered except the fresh spring rolls with Chinese sausage. I would not order that again.

Their lunch specials all come with their soup of the day, a fried spring roll, and a fried wonton. I've finished their lunch specials except for their Pad Thai. It's a huge serving, enough for two or three people. I like to eat Pad Thai with jalape√±os for an extra spicy kick. Spicy basil with ground beef or fried tofu is another favorite of mine.

Their non-lunch choices- Pad Prik King, Rad Nar, Panang curry, red curry are wonderful choices too.

Tip-They are closed on Tuesdays which I thought was a weird day to be closed.

Everything was really tasty as always. I tried the pork jerky for the first time. It was tasty but too fatty for me. I had to have them throw it back on the stove to crisp it a little bit more. Green curry is always tasty, yellow curry is yummy and pad thai.

We come here pretty often actually, and I was happily surprised by the prompt service. Sometimes during lunch they get a little overloaded with customers. From the time we ordered, it was about 10 minutes (or less) that the food came to the table. While I'm usually a fan of their soups, spicy eggplant, and the basil chicken, tonight we decided on Pad Thai and Yellow Curry. Both dishes were delicious as usual!  I must admit that sometimes the service is hit or miss depending on how busy the restaurant is, but the food we've gotten here is always delicious and fresh.

Food is always good but service is not good. They've expanded the place but it made service worse. A lot of empty tables but a line at the door with one guy working register, seating people and acting as a waiter too!!! Normally I would get up and leave but food is good
All said and done I'll still come back
Adios

Always had a fairly good experience here. I have better food when I order take out, the one time I ate at the restaurant my food was not as good as it was when I order to go. The chicken Pad Thai is my favorite I have had in a long time! The staff is usually very nice, and I have always had my food out promptly.

"You never know how strong you are until being strong is your only choice"
- Bob Marley

Archi's Thai Cafe was the first Thai spot that really stood out to me and got me hooked. They had my favorite Pad Kee Mao for years. Now, I typically go to other places because I have found almost all of my favorite dishes done better at other Thai restaurants, but Archi's remains consistent and I'll probably always have a soft spot for some of their recipes.

My love really enjoys the Yen-Ta-Fo at Archie's. I know without a doubt that if I stop by to pick her up some soup I can always pick up and enjoy some Pad Kee Mao or Panang Curry for me. While the Pad Kee Mao is not my absolute favorite version of Pad Kee Mao anymore, Archie's is still a very good and robust one, with lots of character...easily one of the better versions in town...throw in the fact that they do so many dishes well above average and you won't hear me complain about coming here.
Food is always great. We love the Beef Salad and Panang Curry. Very friendly atmosphere.

This is my go to Thai restaurant. I always order pad thai and a curry for me and my wife. We noticed that when we dine in, the curry portion is a lot smaller than take out. Weird. The pad thai is very flavorful. we get a spice level of 5 and it is perfect. My only problem is they don't allow you to order takeout when they're busy. I tried a couple times and at first, they said the wait would be 45 minutes then said it's too busy for takeout right now....
so yeah...if you want to order takeout here, call when it's not dinner time.

I have to comment on the service here above all. Our waitress brought paper for my granddaughter to draw on. When she got fussy she gave me the check quickly.

I had the Pad Soon Wen. The bean sprouts were crisp and the egg bits tasted freshly cooked. For $2 more I had five shrimp. The shrimp were pretty big. To be honest I would rather have seven medium shrimp especially for two dollars. 

The food was good and the service was great. I will definitely visit again.

Love this place for years.. great flavour, fresh food, nice ambiance and reasonable prices esp lunch specials. I love their soups and dishes. The only complain I have is the service can sometimes be a little slow.

Good food if u like it! If u r new and don't the service on behalf of the management is HORRIBLE!!! Pete the manager not only compared our experience to others on the sales item, but wouldn't be courteous enough to remove the item. I have NEVER heard of the customer when dining having this matter. 
I enjoy the food but because of treatment will NEVER eat here again!
Consistently great Thai food. They are always busy for a reason. Pad Thai, pineapple fried rice and pineapple curry are all fantastic. Service is attentive and fast.
This has been my favorite Thai place in town for years and each of their locations is just as good as this one. Everything is great about his restaurant.

Their spice levels are out of this world! Make sure you get the lowest level of spice if you're like me and can't take spicy foods. If you love spice, this is the place for you! My friends ordered 7's and I spent the entire time sniffling and sweating. Let's just say it was a very uncomfortable meal for me.

The tom yum kah with flat noodle was nothing special. It was loaded with mushrooms and noodles. I wish there was more chicken in it. The spicy garlic chicken was vey garlicky and served atop a bed of cabbage and broccoli. Healthy dish that came with a side of rice. The Panang curry was probably my favorite dish here. Definitely a must try! Lastly, the pad see ew was also yummy but nothing memorable.
Love this place! The Pad Thai is sooooo good! Be careful though, we looooove spicy food but the level 5 spice is almost too much for us to handle!
Dinner review only.  The red curry is very good! But the portions were small and I felt like the amount of rice was too small.  I prefer pin kaow.

First time here and will definitely come back. Food was delicious and pad Thai was amaaaaazing. We ordered sweet sour pork, chicken pad Thai and beef curry all spicy 6. It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. Definitely the proportions are bigger and better then Pin kaow (located on rainbow and lake mead). I would recommend to just get an entree because for a dollar more, you get more food than the lunch size ones. I love their decor and their friendly staff. I would definitely recommend it to any food lovers out there!

We were very eager to try this restaurant out after seeing how moist and saucy their noodle dishes looked in other yelper's pictures. The reviews also seemed like this place wouldn't disappoint.

What started off as a positive experience, slowly and annoyingly became a long & drawn out waste of our time. 

After 30 minutes of waiting for our food, I became drawn in and aware of the time - I was starving! I saw that there were tables that were seated after us, receiving their food, I suppose it's because they were appetizers? I couldn't tell. I was still annoyed and very hungry. 

I kept looking at the time and it had soon become 35 minutes, yet still no food. At this point I was very antsy, hungry, and aggravated. My soda has watered down a lot at this point (I like to drink it fizzy with my meal.)

45 minutes later, our food arrived. We asked the server if they could be so understanding to swap out my coke for a fresh one, since I hadn't even drink it yet and it had gone flat since we waited so long for the food to come out. The waiter didn't understand, he thought we wanted a coconut water - so he got the manager involved. The manager listened to our concern and request, but he said that they don't do that here and that our request was unusual. So we just had to say - ok thanks, never mind then.

It's just a simple coke - we were agitated about the extensive wait, my watered down coke that was clearly not drank from, but they weren't concerned about our complaints. He was polite and professional - but I still feel slapped for the whole experience. It wasted our time and not once did our server or any server come out to explain the long wait for our food or check on us. 

Although, we requested spice level 7, it was really a level 1. We asked 3 times for a chili tray to be refreshed as the chilies were gone - 3 different servers later, brought the chili tray. We also asked for lemons 2 times in a row, the second person finally brought it for us. There were a lot of servers but no one wanted to help our table. Our food was getting cold as were were waiting for these things.

The positive things I could take from this place was that the noodles were moist, the pad kee mao had nice flavor, and the pad thai (although bland) was a massive portion - I feel like it was at least 4 portions that they brought out, which is a good deal. 

Yet, I wasn't a fan about the horrible service.  If I ever feel inclined to come back, I would order take out instead.

My search for a no fail and delicious thai restaurant close to home continues.
Love the food but not at 90 degrees. I sweated the whole time and was ignored when I asked if they could make it cooler. Sorry, Not coming back.

"It was the best of times, it was the worst of times", sums up our most recent visit to Archies. "The best " was the food. Pork Satay, Pad See ew and Pad Kea Mow are favorites and always perfect. "The bad" was the service. Usually its okay at best, but today they acted like we were interrupting them by showing up. Every phase of customer contact was terrible, from the time we walked in and waited at host stand for 10 minutes just to get a grunt of an acknowledgment. to the server who seemed almost angry with us. Would have given 5 stars if service was good. Will still go there, but no as often and will probably try other locations first.
Good food.  Poor service. Ordered ice tea and never received it.  Never seen the server after I was brought my lunch.  Very unfortunate because it used to be a great place!

I've eaten here twice with friends & I always let them order because I'm no Thai food expert, but I know when stuff is tasty, and Archi's serves up some tasty food! I used to frequent the movie theater next door when I was a teenage hoodlum and remember when this place used to be some really crappy Americanized Chinese food place that always smelled like crappy Chinese food. I was really surprised it was the same place considering how cute & Thai-like the inside looked! 

We've sampled their yellow curry, panang curry, beef and basil, pineapple fried rice, pad thai, pad kea mao, and papaya salad. My favorite is the panang curry! Omgosh, it was so delish, until I went home and checked out the calorie content. Panang curry typically has about 40-50g's of fat for one serving. Ouch! Well, anything with that much fat better be worth it, and I'd say that one serving of panang curry is worth it. Their pad thai is on the greasy side and kind of bland when you think about what's in it. I definitely prefer the pad kea mao because it has more veggies and tastes like basil (yum!!!)  compared to what you'd get in pad thai with just bean sprouts & peanuts.

I did not enjoy the papaya salad. It was my first time trying it, but for $10, you get a "salad" that has a grated green papaya and this "dressing" that just tasted like fish sauce? Did they give us the wrong sauce? I don't know. Regardless, I will be back to Archi's! It has a cute ambiance with some delicious options. Definitely try the panang curry & pad kea mao!

I ordered the pad Thai lunch special with two "wontons" instead of the egg roll, I was not informed that it was a won ton skin only... no sense? I called back and asked her if I would've ordered the egg roll if it were just the skin and she said no it comes with vegetables. I don't understand why they give you a wonton skin if they advertise the wonton
best thai food in Vegas.  Came here every week when I lived in Vegas. Now I am coming here everytime I visit. :-)

I love Archi's.  While it's not the place I go most often for Thai food, it's the place I go when I want a decent assortment of dishes on the menu and Thai food prepared consistently well.  There's enough variety there to satisfy what you're looking for most of the time:  appetizers, salads, soups, entrees (including curry and noodle dishes) and desserts.  I've eaten at the W. Sahara restaurant, and Rainbow Blvd. restaurant and found the food and service to be consistently good at both.

Lunch portions are almost as big as the dinner portions and include an egg roll and small soup.  They're definitely worth choosing from during the lunch hour.

Dinner is always delicious.  For those who enjoy Thai food, you'll see many of your usual favorites there.  If you're new to this variety of Asian cuisine, consider adding your choice of meat to the Pad Thai (everyone seems to love this dish), Pad Se Ew, Pad Prik Pow, or Broccoli.    If you're in the mood for curry, there are eight dishes to chose from and they're all good.  If you'd rather go with soup, I highly recommend Tom Yum or Tom Kha.  (Tom Kha is essentially Tom Yum but with coconut milk added to make the soup creamier rather than brothy.)

I prefer the fried Egg Rolls (they're served warm, right out of the fryer) rather than the fresh Spring Rolls (served cold).  And if you've never tried one, don't forget to treat yourself to a Thai Iced Tea.  They're almost too sweet for me, but they still taste fantastic.  It's almost like a liquid dessert.

Finally, like with most Thai restaurants, you can dial the spiciness up or down.  The waitstaff will ask, so go conservative if you're a little nervous and dial up from there.  You'll start to feel the heat with anything above a moderate level, and if you're adventurous, go for "Thai hot".  (But you better like spicy food.)

Parking (at the Sahara location) is ample since the restaurant is located in a storefront.  When you enter the parking lot, look for the Regal Cinema.  Archi's is to the right.

I stopped in here the other night before a movie, without having done any research or prior yelping, which is very unusual and risky for me! The menu is vast, and prices pretty decent for the area, selection, and ambiance. I had the drunken noodles with beef and a HUGE portion was delivered. Tender wide rice noodles arranged on a bed of fresh veggies, wood ear mushrooms, lettuce, and flavorful beef. Around $13 w/ tax + tip I believe, quite the bargain and provided me with leftovers! Would go back if I was in the area.

Normally I would say that Archies is one of my favorite Thai food places, but this time was not as pleasant. I walked in to a busy atmosphere and it took one of the girls walking by me three times before I was greeted. I place my order at 1:23 for just basic pad Thai and some red curry.... After patiently waiting, at about 1:55 she says it's coming out in just a minute. Finally my food is here and I can go enjoy it at home, well the pad Thai was great as usual, but I've been having bad experiences with curry lately so I'm always extra careful when eating it... And of course there it was, a giant, black, wavy piece of hair, I almost puked. I couldn't believe it, I'm literally still in shock as I'm writing this review! I didn't pay 23$ plus tip for food with nasty hair in it! I just don't know if there are any decent Thai food restaurants left in this town, so discouraging.

I usually love Archies, however tonight was a horrible experience from the time we walked in. The guy at the front was trying to do too many things and wasn't seating people in a timely manner when there were tables available. Then some how my name got crossed off the waiting list and they sat the people who came in after us...he did seat us as soon as I brought the t to his attention but I shouldn't have had to. Then we placed out order and they brought my dinner date the wrong order and they had to wait. And mine got cold. Then they rushed us out with the to go boxes and taking out dishes away, however they took forever to bring the check. It wasn't the good service that we are used to. Hope they get their act together or we won't continue coming here...

This would be a 5 star if for the food alone.  It would be a 4 star if the only issue was the fact that the rice portion that comes with the red curry was too small. It became a three because the service we had wasn't very good. I admit I will give it another try in the future as I think every place can have an off night for some patrons.

Not authentic!! I was very fooled by the pictures I order pad see ew.. I expect Chinese Broccoli due to what the previous Yelp pictures showed it did not look the same it also had no flavor and the noodles are very mushy definitely not fresh noodles and to top that they had very bad customer service which I was going to let pass but for the food to not be good I had to leave a review.

I am a huge soup fan and I just love their shrimp soup. Very Fresh tasting and I will go back here. I do like other thai places in town which I have reviewed but this one is near my house in Summerlin and is very good.

I have heard many people rave about archie's and I agree!.  I was unaware of how close this place is to my home, which is definitely a plus!

Food: Variety of options with lunch specials served on weekdays (except for holidays) that are reasonably priced.  We came on the weekend so I did not have an option of trying these.  My husband and I started with the stuffed wings appetizer.  5/5 YUMMY!  I had the red curry with shrimp 5/5.  Flavor and spice spot on #6 spice level very tolerable.  My husband had the yellow curry with chicken spice level #5, equally tasty!  I prefer things more on the spicy side so next time I'll try #8  I love how the rice soaks up the juice from the sauce!

Service: decent.  Not over the top.  We did wait a bit for our bill, but nothing to complain about.

Overall I would recommend and will be back to try other things on the menu!

Fresh but very bland Thai food.

Pleasant but I would never come back.

Way too many choices out there.

Broccoli main entre had no taste.

Spring rolls very bland.

Ginger ginger tasted like soy and ginger.

Vegetables were fresh.

Dishes $10-$13 mid range for neighborhood fair.
I just had dinner on Sahara location great place good food can't wait for next time ...

Been living here in Las Vegas for almost two years now and have not found a great Thai cuisine place with decent prices off of the strip until I ran into this place. The food is very flavorful and great! Pricing is not sky high it's just right. 5 stars for friendly staff and great food. Decor and atmosphere is nice a cozy inside. Come get one of the best pad thai in town. And your option of spicy level 1-10 is absolutely awesome! Finally found my go to for Thai cuisine from now on!

Archie's is a Thai restaurant chain with locations convenient to both my work and home. I love their lunch specials for the good portions and value. I would recommend their Pad Thai lunch and Kung Pao chicken (better than Chinese kung pao). They serve consistently good Thai food with my only complaint being the spice number is not consistent. I've asked for spicy number 5s that may be more like a three on some days and like a nine on others. Yikes! But it's so good, I'll eat it anyway. I would suggest not getting the salads or the soups too spicy because the spice tends to overwhelm these dishes. Better to add more spice later than be sorry. Besides the lunch specials,  a few other favorite dishes of mine are the Panang curry, Massaman curry and Tom Kha Gai soup. If in season, try the mango and sticky rice for dessert. Love it!
My wife loves the Tom Yum soup, and the Thai iced tea is great.  I pretty much like everything on the menu. We always visit this place when we're in Summerlin.

I've been coming to Archi's for years! (The rainbow and warm springs location) and the service never disappoints- the staff is friendly & quick. Also, the atmosphere is always extremely clean and modernized with a nice "cultural" feel. And don't get me started on the food! Everything is decently priced and i've never had a dish that I didn't like- Id recommend the Thai macaroni, pad Thai, or their chicken chow mien!

Food wasn't bad, only problem was the wait. They don't take reservations and it was hard getting a table. At least the food was good enough to bring it up to 4 stars. Quality is way better now than 6 years ago which was the last time I was here. Friendly staff. Kinda loud and was hard to hear my gf I felt like we were shouting at each other.

There food is great but organization is a total shit show. They have no idea who is waiting and or who has to be seated. Sad because this was really close to my workplace. I'll continue to go to the rainbow location but this location sucks!
One of my favorite restaurants!  Best Thai Food in town.  Great environment great food excellent service.

My fianc√© and I went to Archi's when the kid was in school. We asked for the Pork Pad Thai. We also ordered the chicken panang and they both were a delight. 
The restaurant was pretty comfortable spacious unlike many Thai bistros or restaurants. I appreciated the decor it was very nice inside. I gave it a four because they were not busy at all on our waitress was not really on top of our drinks. It was a warm day and spicy food ='s Need for water and Tea. After our meal we had some scrumptious Coconut ice cream after our meal and it helped cool us off. Being that the place is one block from our home it will be a new spot for me and my girl.
I posted a menu link for this Thai restaurant. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Great food.  Good ambiance!  We got there early so seating was quick.  The place filled up fast.  It ski wonder because the food is that good.  Beware ... When they say "10".  They mean it!   I liked the stuffed chicken appetizer and the spicy basil!  My friend had the catfish.  Now that was good!  She picked 10 so ...,I just tasted it.  Overall a great place for a meal !

I went there today and it was absolutely horrible....service was something I normally would have walked out but I was meeting someone there....It took at least 10 min of waiting there before anyone greeted me and I was the 2nd table in the whole restaurant. I finally had someone greet me and I asked if I can have there WiFi password and they dont offer that...which ruined my whole meeting. 

There were at least 4 servers on the floor and none of them cared that we were sitting there.....Service is not worth it but food is good.

My boyfriend and I visited this restaurant based on a recommendation from our new apartment manager. It was delicious! Very authentic and affordable. I ordered the fried wonton's as an appetizer. For my main lunch, I ordered the Pad See Ew, and it reminded me of my mama's cooking! 

Our waitress was very friendly and was quick to take our orders (even though it was quite busy that afternoon). We will be going back to enjoy more of their food and service!

I've been to this location a few times before and its always been good food and good service however I met up with my friend just 45 minutes ago and I couldn't wait to get out of there! 
We walked in and a girl with a bob haircut was at the computer, she looked at us and looked back down at the computer then looked back up to us with the most miserable facial expression. Um 2 please. She grabs two menus, puts it on the first table and walks away. Uh okay weird but whatever. Then after five minutes another girl asks if we want sometimes to drink and then another girl comes and asks what we want to order. The food comes out quick but here comes the girl with the bob again, she puts down the food at the edge of the table, doesn't even look at us and walks away. So now we're watching these girls and they're nice to every other table except us! My friend is Ethiopian and there is no one else in this restaurant with darker skin color and I don't want to say they were being racist but I don't know why else we were treated so horrible. These girls didn''t come back or say anything to us except fill waters but they kept watching us from a far and kept looking at us. I don't know, maybe they were hungry? But regardless, never coming back to this location again.
The food here is really good.  The fried rice and pad Thai is excellent.  Having said that,  we had to ask for someone to take our food order. Really?  Take out is highly recommended .

I love Thai Food. Like, a lot. And I'm super picky about my Thai. I moved to vegas about a year ago and tried a few places. They were all ok but none were really amazing that i had to go back. Then someone recommended Archi's. Since I'm giving it 5 stars (which honestly may not be enough stars), you can probably assume I love this place and go often. I have finally found my Vegas thai restaurant and will continue to go back. Pretty great deal on the lunch special with large portions. Can't go wrong.

Not bad for a good Thai restaurant. I've gone to all of Archi's Thai restaurants and I believe this one is the BEST! I came to this Thai restaurant with my cousin many years ago. After many years of not going, this restaurants seems to get BUSIER every time and GAIN popularity. 

From my last visit (3/ 25/16), I ordered their Chicken Pad Thai, Beef Salad, and many more at this restaurant and it's very GOOD and DELICIOUS!

I RECOMMEND coming here because this Thai restaurant is the best around this area. They have good staff but I recommend coming around 2-5 p.m. because they are not that busy around that time. Otherwise, you will be waiting for your food at least over an hour with the place crowded and servants busy.
Delicious! I went here 4 times in 1 week. LOL...can't get enough of their curries.

Ohhhh man this place was so good! I've taken take out before but couldn't remember how it was. We ordered the pineapple fried rice and this was the BEST! Definitely a must order. The size is pretty big I was surprised, enough for 2 people. Also ordered the pad see eww and it was good. Not the best I've tried but not the worst. Overall price, quality and amount of food is great!

I remember when Archi's was the namesake for Thai food 25 years ago when it sat on Flamingo/Torrey Pines and didn't have a liquor license.  I have eaten a lot of Thai food since then and finally stopped in their new location at Village Square.  I had what may have been the best pad Thai ever.  Everything was excellent.  Had the beef salad, spicy basil beef, chicken pad thai, tom kha soup  and red curry chicken.  The only plate that I was not blown away by was the red curry chicken. The curry was excellent, but I think it was the chicken slices that could have been better. They were a little flat and dry.  But seriously this is one very small complaint.  Everything else was exceptional and again, best pad thai in a long time!!!

This is usually my go to Thai spot but I visited today before heading to the movies next door. The service was horrible. Not only did the server seem put out by taking our order, she never came back to check on us during the meal leaving our glasses empty. After asking for our check and a few to go boxes, I had to wait another 10 minutes while trying to decide which employee would bring me the damn boxes so we could make our movie on time. Sorry Archies, but if I don't want take out, I'll find a new spot.

Archi's is by far my  favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. I've been coming here with friends for the past couple years now and the food here is to die for. You can get your food however spicy you want it ranging in a scale of 1-10 of how spicy you want it. I've always left this place with a smile. They have great service and three convenient location here in Las Vegas. Definitely a place to go for some good Thai eats.

Very cheap authentic Thai in a nicely appointed dining room.  

I liked the spicy basil beef.  They also have a great coconut soup with shrimp.  Definitely home made and tasty.

Go as spicy as you can handle or keep it mild!  Gooood Food!

This is our favorite Thai restaurant! I am not a picky eater so every restaurant is my favorite, but that is not the case for my family. Everyone in my family is ridiculously picky and this was the first Thai restaurant that nobody complained at. The pad Thai, rad na, and shrimp fried rice were phenomenal and the prices were very fair! I love the Village Square plaza so the location was also perfect. We will never go anywhere else for Thai food!
Nothing to write home about but not horrible.  Probably wouldn't want to come back since there are other options for Thai nearby.

Classic Pad Thai today for lunch special!  Great atmosphere. Attentive service. Located right next to the theater deep in the shopping center. Soup came out warm, not as hot (temp) as I like or should be; but flavorful and full of ingredients. The Pad Thai special is touted as their signature dish. Delicious and hit the spot for me.  Sweeter than the other Pad Thai dishes I've had around town; like Pinkow, Lucky Thai, or Le Thai (my favorite for atmosphere-but small and parking sucks.) I got a 6 on the 1 to 10 spicy scale at Archie's. Medium as it should be at 6. You might want to go to an 8 or higher if you want to clear your sinuses. Nice place for lunch. Quick, clean and classy. Good parking.
When ever I visit, I make it a point. To stop by Archi's for some DELICIOUS Thai food.  Never disappoints. Dinner time to go orders is really busy so be patient with the people on the phone.

Just a quick and non critical warning.  The shopping center is under renovation and the parking situation is pretty hit and miss.  You will likely park on gravel and have to walk a bit till they get the lot fixed.  That having been said, this is a solid choice for delicious, well done authentic Thai food.  I've been here three times and all meals were first rate.  I have had the Pad Thai with tofu and once with chicken--8/10 hot level--both excellent.  My son swears by the sweet & sour chicken.  Pad Se Ew was excellent.

Service has been first rate here, and the lunch specials are well priced.  Will be back.

Ate here with my girlfriend this evening. She had the Mongolian entree and I had the Pad Cha Cha Cha entree. Both were excellent.

We've also eaten here once before and had no complaints that time either.

Service was prompt and friendly.

We'll definitely be back again.

Was greeted right away when I walked it.  Ordered a chicken satay and fried rice, was offered an ice water while I waited which was nice.  Chicken satay was yummy but fried rice was just so so, was not heated through.
Worse service ever. The tables around us were all complaining so this isn't me being overly picky. Food however was good.

The food is very tasty here.  When the server says a dish is spicy believe her or him!!  
The bathroom (women) was disgusting, however, and looked as if it hadn't been checked for an hour or two. In all fairness, I did let somebody know so I imagined it was looked into.

A classic case of a restaurant that lost quality and service as they expanded too quickly. 

We used to frequent their original location on Flamingo. It was so good. We used to bring friends and a few bottles of wine.  And honestly, we were so happy when they opened closer to our home. 

This location used to be pretty good.  Their Rainbow location was never good

My wife and I just had dinner at the Sahara location tonight.  Friday night and it was half empty.  They no longer serve Thai toast.  Their little marinated peppers are no longer the actual Thai peppers... they use Serrano peppers.  

Food was decent.  The part that really bothered me was their take out containers.  

Thai food is saucy with curry. They gave us the generic styrofoam containers.  We asked for soup containers, and they gave us styrofoam containers.  Lol.

Maybe I'm a snob, but when I go to a sit down restaurant... I expect nicer takeout containers.  Theirs is worse than fast food.  

Most likely the last time we come here.  Too many new Thai spots in town.  If Archie's doesn't renew their commitment to quality, they will be closed within two years.  Mark my words.

Waited for our food for 30 mins . Good food but horrific  service .  Spoke to the manager of which wasting our time because he doesn't listen but saying excuses. Though this place was in featured in dirty dining but still given them a chance .This place I only give 1 star since they ruined our appetite no more Archie for us !

Best Pad Kea Mow in town if you ask me and the Basil Fried Rice is just too good.  I eat my meals here at spice level 9 or 10 and it has such flavor - but be warned some say the spicing is hot (not to me but I think something is broke with me - can't get it hot enough).  

Friday's soup with lunch specials is a fantastic coconut chicken soup (Tom Kha

Also a must try is the Papaya Salad - great with a Thai beer.

And if you love Curry then get the red curry with chicken and buckle up.

3 stars only because their food is good. Stopped by with my boyfriend at around 7. The place was full but not super full. We were quickly led to a table in the back corner and given two menus, great! I start looking at the menu but soon notice no one has passed by to ask us for our drink order. I look up at another table that had came in after us and noticed they had already received their drinks. Annoyed with this drink situation, my boyfriend starts looking around and then a male worker comes up to ask us if anyone has taken our drink order. We respond no and he asks us what we want.... okay, everything is fine. While we are at it my boyfriend asks for some crispy wontons..... the waiter says "I'm not your waiter".... ummm k......so he leaves and then two minutes later another girl comes by asking our drink order. We explained someone had stopped by already. This waiter theme continues throughout the night, literally 3-4 different waiters stopped by dropping things off at our table or to ask us something. Also, why is everything placed in the corner far away from the customer? Lol, I don't mind reaching, I just don't understand. In the end, we ate our food, it was great! I just didn't particularly like the service per say.

On the pricier side without the ingenuity or traditional backing to justify.  This is typical thai food served in a sit down, westside establishment.  Lunch specials are fine but still put you back about $11-12.  It comes with soup, a little salad, and an option of about 10 meals.  The menu is Southern Thai but it feels Americanized and not very creative.  My combination salad was just a mountain of greens and meats, with not presentations whatsoever.  The service was slow during the lunch rush but manageable - in and out in about 45 minutes. Archi's may be fine for a quick bite on the way home, but I would go to China Town for the real stuff.

I love thai food. This is one of our favorite places. Usually always do take out but have ate here a few times. 
Service is great overall from dining in to phone orders and pick-up. 
Favorite dishes are chili mint ground beef with a spicy level 6. That level is a happy medium too spicy for those who cannot handle spicy. 
Another favorite is the pad thai. So delicious usually get chicken and a spicy level 6. 
Love their food and I will keep coming back!
Way too expensive!  We just ordered Papaya salad and 2 orders or sticky rice with mango and it came to $33.00?????!!!!!
I eat here at least once a week. Basil fried rice, beef salad, and the pad see ew is my usual order. This place is a must go.
Food is very good and the price is reasonable but the service tends to be on the slow side. So don't go there if you are in a hurry.  Be ready to spend time.

i wasnt as impressed as i thought i would be. The food was good but i think I was expecting more based on the great reviews. I didn't care for the fresh spring roll, it was not like any other fresh spring rolls I've ever had. It was more like a sausage roll with some veggies and glass noodles rolled in a dough. The silver noodle salad medium spicy was good.

Hands down BEST Thai food I have ever had, better yet...best of Las Vegas!!! Amazing service, beautiful restaurant, great for family dinner or date night. The food was absolutely delicious!! Not one complaint for this lovely place!! Highly recommended to anyone and everyone!

We love Thai Food and Archi's is where we go for our fix. It's definitely spicy though so those of you who think you can handle the 5 may want to rethink it if you want to taste your food. I'm typically a 5 but usually go with a 3 here. Just the right amount of hot.

Big restaurant, nice decor, great tasting food but really slow service. I waited over 30-minutes for what was supposed to be a quick lunch. Didn't leave until an hour later and late to work. 

Here's the thing, Las Vegas has a huge Thai community. Therefore there are many Thai restaurants where the food is just as good with far better service and efficiency. normally i don't do  this but as I was walking out and people were walking in, I recommended they go elsewhere if they we hungry because of the wait time.

I am Thai and l love the food here. Pad Kapow Beef and chicken Panang are my favorite.  I got my in-laws hooked on these dishes. Then l'd brought my cousin who just came to visit from Thailand and she even said how awesome the food here was!

Good Food best thai food i town. 

The only thing that we dont like about this place is when we come here around 9pm they start cleaning and mopping flor. Which is kinda rude and the smells of clorine is bad!

Unbelievable. They lost my credit card. 

I stopped in for a solo lunch, sat down, and had their Pad Thai which I'd probably rate a 4 out of 10 - it's super greasy and not all that good. 

After I give the waitress my card to pay the bill she brings me a book with a receipt to sign but not my card.

I ask her where my card is and she's saying she would have brought it to me.

I'm wearing sweats without much stuff in my pocket -keys, wallet, chapstick, phone.. I hadn't moved the entire time - not to go to the restroom or anything. My wallet barely fits any cards so there's only one secured place it fits.

There is nothing under the table or in the seat. 

I emptied the contents of my wallet into the table in front of her.

Flipped the book inside out.

They spend all but a few seconds to look for it around the restaurant and suggest to me to cancel my card. 

No person acknowledged responsibility or even offered a genuine apology. Just the suggestion to cancel my card. 

Great advice.

No. No. No. Service was awful. We were served several dirty dishes. The food was decent, but not worth the awful service! You couldn't pay me to come back and deal with this service. Look out for hidden fees.

I really thought the food was good but just a little underwhelming.  Beef salad was actually very tasty but there was a definite lack of juice that accompanies the dish.  Hubbs ordered chicken pad thai, was lacking in a little acidity but it was not bad.  Again, the food was okay, but nothing fabulous.  On the plus side, portions were generous.The only weird thing was that we both ordered #6 spice to our dishes and my husband's dish was about 2 levels under my spice.  I really think mine was the true 6 ;) .  I hope it wasn't done on purpose after they took one look at the whiteboy and decided to underplay the spice request.  We did not attempt dessert because the service was way too slow.  I want to give it another try sometime but maybe during  lunch.

Awesome food! Archi's son came over and introduced himself, it's so cool to hear about how Archi's has grown but still remains int he family. We love the Papaya Salad and Pad Thai and always get spicy level 8-10 depending on how bold we feel that day. They also have a fish chili oil (can't remember the name) that is amazing, one of the spiciest and tastiest hot sauces I've ever had!

Archi's has very good Thai cuisine. Their menu is comprehensive, the restaurant is clean and modern, and the only drawback was the service, which seemed a little disorganized and inattentive.

We tried the Pad Thai and Shrimp Fried Rice on a recent lunch outing.  Both dishes were excellent, full of flavor and seasoned just right. Lunch specials come with soup of the day, a fried Spring roll and a Wanton.  The portions are on the large side, maybe a bit too much food. 

Recommend highly.

We were in the mood for Thai and came across this place so decided to get food to go. When I first walked I noticed they were very busy with people waiting to be seated and others picking up food they had ordered to go.  I realized there will be a wait time for my food so I ordered our food and was told it would take 40 minutes which I didn't mind. I left and came back 40 minutes later only to be told it was not ready yet. It was 1 hour since the time I ordered that we finally got our beef salad and wor won ton soup. I must say the food is good however the only reason I gave it stars 4 is because of the long wait time for to go orders. 

Tip: either eat there or call in your order for pick up.

Came here 3 times in the past 3 days. I also wore the same clothes each time.

After some rad bouldering in Red Rock, I ate at Archi's Thai Cafe to carb up and replenish that muscle glycogen and glucose derived ATP.

Got the Pad Thai and the Fried Rice. Both good, but tofu fried rice all the way. So important to carb up.

We came here only because next door at Bachi burger they left us waiting to be seated for 5 minutes without greeting us, so we left and thank goodness we did. I went with my mother and two children and we ordered way too much food. Pad Thai, fried rice (for my picky child), fried wonton, shrimp green curry, chicken satay and my other son also wanted tofu soup. Why so much? I have no clue but I'm glad we did because everything was delicious and now we have more for later. The only complaint I have is that the pad Thai wasn't as hot (temperature) as we'd prefer but it wasn't cold. We will definitely be going back, I just wish I knew of this place sooner.

This Archi's is a classic case of resting on one's laurels.  They do some good things well: Pad Thai, Tom Yum Soup, and other staples, like beef with noodles.

But the attitude that they serve along with the food makes it an unpleasant experience.  Also, they fail to attend to the details, especially keeping the place super clean, which is what you want a restaurant to do.  (Not a surprise that they were featured on "Dirty Dining."  Gross.)

I used to do take-out, but even that takes a loooooong time.  And you still get treated to their snotty, high-school popular girl type of attitude.  I would put up with it when my mom was alive because she enjoyed the shrimp soup (Tom Yum). But now that's she gone, I don't have to put up with this.  (Little did she know how haphazard they were about cleaning, or she would not have enjoyed it.  But I didn't know that at the time, as I usually came at night.  Only when I came during the day did I see the dust and food particles around).

Their location makes them not have to worry about these things.  But if you wanted to eat Thai, and particularly Archi's, maybe try their Spring Valley location.

Just saw this restaurant on channel 13 news Dirty Dining with 42 demerits! Archi's should be ashamed of taking money for unsafe food they are serving to the public. You once had a BEST OF LAS VEGAS rating!  What happened? 

Your cooks apparently learned NOTHING in the food sanitation class to get their food handlers card through the health department. The update was the demerits were corrected- but how long will it be maintained? It's very apparent that your cooks lack responsibility of handling raw food properly when the comment was made on TV that the cooks were unaware raw meat and seafood were being held at unsafe temperatures. A class can teach you technique in handling food properly to avoid a food borne illness it can't teach you to have integrity for the food you are serving to the public!

I just so happened to eat here a few weeks ago and ordered Chicken Pad Thai and thought it was drenched in too much sauce making it a soggy clump of noodles. I asked for lime wedges and my server came back and said they didn't have any. He brought me lemon wedges instead. What? A Thai restaurant that has no limes? Limes are  a common ingredient in Thai cooking and the kitchen doesn't have any? 

The service was inattentive. The server came with my order and never returned to see if everything was good. Several staff walked by several times but never took my plate or came back with a check. I waited and waited. I finally went up to the hostess desk and asked for my check and paid it right there and felt a tip was not deserved. 

Now, to hear of them being on Dirty Dining too? I am sure long time customers of Archi's are very disappointed!

Food: 
Pad Thai with tofu 8/10
Amazing pad Thai!!!
Tofu Panang with brown rice 8/10
Delicious Panang!!!

Service:
Took a little long but that's okay they were a little busy I def understand. Saw us a couple times trying to get a check,not a biggie at all.

Cleanliness:
WOW, the wall I was sitting by, food particles everywhere. Above us was a hanging light, dust all over it. A/C vent, dust all around it blowing that crap who knows where. One of the services sneezed in his hands then wiped it on his apron then served food. The lady expo coughed on her hands, texting on her phone, then prepped food and put her hands on the plate. Absolutely disgusting. Not the Restaurants fault because I'm 100% they go through servsafe for this kind of stuff. Unbelievable, please attend to your employees.

I give this place two stars and here's why I ordered my food and it was 45 minutes later and my waitress said it will be 10 more minutes or would u like to leave. What she should have said was how about a beer on the house because we're taking so long and another thing they put the seats for the people waiting on their carryout food right in front of where I'm eating at - like I'm a animal in a zoo--this place needs to move the carryout seats for people somewhere else it's ridiculous. The food was fine.

I'm impressed!  This was some pretty good Thai food.  And my favorite part is that they have a spicy level that goes from 1-10.  I like my food on fire so of course, I ordered my food at a 10.  She told me it will be "very spicy."  After I did that, I was nervous for a minute. Then, I got my food.  I got a Tom Yum Seafood soup at spice level 10.  Okay, it was hot and you could just smell the spice.  But for me, I think it was just right. In fact, I think I could've handled it spicier.  And from reading the reviews below, it appears that the spice level may even go higher - to a 30?!?!?!  Perhaps I'll have to try a higher level next time.  But in any event... the food was good.  The only thing that I didn't like was the summer rolls, but that's only because I think in my head I was thinking of the Vietnamese summer rolls.  These particular rolls were actually wrapped in a flour tortilla and on the inside, it had Chinese sausage, veggies, and other stuff.  It was different. It was good.  But it was just not what I expected.

I love Archi's 

I highly recommend the seafood pancake! I don't think they list this on their menu... I'm not sure why but I heard about it from my mom and it is amazing! 

Don't leave without having the sticky rice and coconut ice cream either ^.^ 

Only down side... the service was slow. It was busy so I know it can get crazy trying to take care of all the tables but we didn't get a single refill and tried to flag the waitress down like three times before we were able to get her attention.
Excellent quality and flavorful cuisine.   The beef salad was so delicious!  The portions are also good and the prices are just right.  I will definitely eat here again.

Oh Archi's.  What has happened to ye?

I used to love and frequent this place often, but then went through a phase where I just wasn't feeling the Thai vibe.  Recently, though, I got a craving for some red curry.  I could just taste that flavorful goodness as we drove down to the restaurant.  My husband was excited about the Pad Kea Mow.

Unfortunately, I was disappointed in my grand comeback to this former go-to spot of mine.  

- The service was terrible.  We waited almost 20 minutes for someone to come and take our order.  I felt so bad for the couple next to us, hidden in a corner.  The staff completely forgot about them back there and the husband had to go ask the hostess TWICE to send over a waiter.  Maybe it's because it was a Monday holiday (President's Day) and they didn't expect such a big crowd?

- The prices had increased.  One of the things I loved about Archi's was their price point.  It's still moderately priced, but it was still disappointing to see the increase.

- My beloved curry (spiciness level 3) was over spiced and over powering.  The beef was overcooked and tough.  The Pad Kea Mow (also a level 3), on the other hand, was bland and had no spice to it!

Ohhhhhh Archi's.  Of course I'll come back and try again because I love you so much, but I really hope this isn't the end of our relationship.

Amazing place, full of authentic decor and ambiance! Papaya salad is so refreshing and full of flavor. Combination pad thai with pork beef and shrimp is enough for two meals.  Thai toasts for an appetizer consists if minced chicken and shrimp baked on toast served with cucumber salad. It us a must try!!

2 visits, 2 stars.  OK, so for the good and the not-so-good:

I had eaten here for a late lunch and had the Tom Yum / Shrimp Seafood soup and hot tea.  I liked that you can control the spice level of the soup from 1 - 10.  The soup tasted very good, and very fresh too.  I left feeling very satisfied.  And, I liked the decorum and presentation of the place.  Its location is very convenient, near Summerlin right by the movie theater.

I liked this place enough, that I decided to head back several days later for another lunch.  I wanted to try one of their salads.  

Before I ordered, I went to the restroom.  A worker from the kitchen was using the restroom at the same time, and I noticed that he did not  seem to wash his hands after.   While it is possible he might have washed his hands in the kitchen after he left, it is certainly not something I wish to speculate about nor think about when eating.  

I would have said something to the waitress, but she was busy. I ended up leaving without ordering anything, and it is highly unlikely I will ever return.

I don't know why I keep going back to this place, it hasn't been a pleasant experience the last three times I've been, I need to remember to scratch this place off forever.  The service is mediocre and the food is not what it used to be.  Waiters do not bring food out in unison and the food is no longer exquisite, flavor is just not the same anymore.
Pedestrian Thai selection and vibe to me as a frequent business visitor to the Las Vegas area.  Pretty close to my work-stay lodging.

We love this place! The service is always fast and the people are nice. The food and prices are excellent. We've tried a lot of items on the menu and everything has been good. The tom yum soup is fantastic.

Ordered Phad Thai, Pad See ew, Beef Panang and Papaya salad. Papaya salad came in first and it was delish and while enjoying eating it, guess what, it has hair. I told the waitress they apologize and gave us a new one. Phad Thai came and it has no peanuts and just ok. Pad see ew was overcooked. Beef panang is not that bad but just ok.

I'm really picky when it comes to thai food. I've tried a lot of different places but more importantly have personally known people from Thailand who have cooked authentically for me. The only reason this place gets less than 5 stars is because the service is weird, (sometimes slow) and I question the cleanliness. We've encountered pretty rude servers, but I didn't even care because it's some of the best restaurant thai food I've found so far. They have, hands down, my FAVORITE yellow curry (and I freaking LOVE YELLOW CURRY) it's so delicious. They have an amazing pad thai, that isn't too gooey, just the right amount of vinegary and peppery; all around amazing. So good!

Came in here for lunch for the first time today. My husband orders from here pretty regularly during the work week and he said it's great so I figured I'd try it out. Ordered the chicken pad thai and the basil chicken. SO YUMMY! Service wasn't bad at all, had about 3 different members of the staff come to see how we were doing, refill our drinks pretty regularly and ask if we were enjoying our meal or if they could get us anything.
Will definitely be back!

Archi's is an incredible place for good Thai food.  They have a wide selection of tofu dishes that I am able to choose from. The food came out in a timely manner considering it was pretty packed for lunch.  I have only been to the Sahara and Fort Apache location, but the service there was great.  The lunch specials rock!  Red curry with tofu and brown rice!  Perfection!
Love this place!! Everything we've tried has been incredible. Prompt service even though it's always packed full of people.

The food was amazing, but the thing that lost them my 5 stars was the service. There's this one male server with the tattoo sleeve that continued to avoid giving us service. His coworkers were great, but his lack of service was what killed it.

Our go to Thai restaurant .. Nice decor / great service / right next to the movie theatre. They are closed one day of the week can't remember if it's tues or wed .. Great lunch special deal . Fabulous soups and red curry
Archis is was one of the better Thai food restaurants in Vegas. I've been going here for years. I usually get the Penang, Thai beef salad, pad kea mow. Can't go wrong with any of those.

Food is ridiculously great! We ordered Spicy Basil (spicy level 3 is perfect, it's spicy enough that you can still taste the flavor) and the Panang (it is curry with a pinch of awesomeness).

This location, W Sahara and Ft Apache, is good if you are not in a rush. The staff is friendly but you will have to wait alot to get your drinks, to order your food, to get your food, to get your bill.... So on, you get the picture. This is why I give them a 4 stars.

Otherwise, the food is amaaaaazing and it is perfect location for a date nite (right next door to a theater!).

Clean restaurant.  Pad se Yu is out of this world. That's what I get at every thai place and this was by far the very best. Extra egg  to die for.  Getting take out tonight. Can't wait to try the fried rice.
Would recommend their food to anyone.  Vary tasty and good specials.  Customer service is questionable at times.
I love Archi's. It's my favorite place to go for Thai. The Spicy Basil with chicken is delicious!

Ate here for the first time and I will say I that I am very pleased with the food. For appetizers we ordered the won tons and the satay chicken skewers with peanut sauce, both were very good. My entr√©e was the red curry w/bamboo shoots and rice. It was DELICIOUS! My boyfriend ordered a ground chicken dish, I don't remember the name of his, but it was delicious, as well. 

I would have given them 5 stars, but we were with another couple and first they brought out our appetizers without bringing theirs and then they brought out our entrees without bringing out theirs, so we felt obligated, out of courtesy, to wait about 5-7 minutes for the rest of our party to be served first before we could eat. I didn't like that my food was just sitting there. Yes, I know I could have just started eating, but most restaurants serve everyone at the same time. Also, they serve the soda in cans, so there are no refills. I don't like when restaurants do that. However, the food was good enough for me to return.

Amazing! Had the pad puck with shrimp and will definitely keep going back! My bf also had the sweet and sour chicken & shrimp. Again very good. Spring rolls as an appetizer and we were all set. I hope they do carry out because I'd love to have them even when I don't feel like sitting in.

Well I did like this place, but I called at 9:30 on the dot and they wouldn't take my takeout order because it has to be placed before 9:30. Way to treat a repeat customer! Guess I'll be going elsewhere in the future. Sahara location.

I see others have had issues with their customer service as well.

Great food....not so great service. Arrived at 11:55 and we're seated promptly. Waited forever for everything else as did the ladies next to us.  Waitresses wouldn't even make eye contact us 
we had to speak up to get their attention on multiple occasions.

Yes - I'll return again since the food was so good and affordable....

I have eaten in once and I had take out again tonight - about the 6th time I've had Thai food from here.  It is wonderful!
