I really like the place, but since it's so close to my house and my wife doesn't do Thai, I get her Chinese on West Charleston and then bop over here to get my dinner for home.

I have been through all of their curries.  I usually get an 8 spiciness and I could go higher.  Next time, I'll do 9 for a try.

I really enjoyed the one time I ate in.  The restaurant is very nice.

Good Thai food 
Close to the cinemas
Had the tofu Kung post, veg fired rice and Lab chicken salad
All items were good 
Quick service and friendly staff

Archi's on Sahara serves up very solid Thai food. I live very close to this location and order takeout frequently, but I have eaten in the restaurant many times as well - I recommend both!

My favorite things on the menu are the pad see ew and tom kha ghai (chicken coconut soup). I love the broth so much that I usually order extra broth and less of the soup contents. Once it didn't work out so well - I got home to find that they had written "extra broc" on the top of the soup container and the entire soup was filled with broccoli! :) Even though it wasn't what I wanted, it still scores them a point for doing anything a customer asks, even when broccoli isn't actually an ingredient in the soup!!

The curries, salads, and other appetizers are quite good too (except I've never been a huge fan of the spring rolls, which are normally my favorite thing at a thai place). Prices are very reasonable and everyone is friendly. Not the best thai in Las Vegas, but good enough to keep going back!

Good place for lunch during the workday if you can risk taking a little over an hour at times.  They are usually pretty good at turning tables, but it seems towards the end of lunch they get a little tired and take longer.

The food is really good, I like the Pad Thai, eggrolls, and wonton soup.

Again, fighting a cold so soup was on my mind.

Surprisingly a lovely restaurant located in a strip mall with dark wooden tables and white shutters on the windows.

We sat down right away and ordered off the lunch menu, I was the exception. I ordered the chicken Tom Kha and some Thai Iced Tea.

I have to say the broth was very good and it was hot but the chicken was overcooked and rubbery.  Thai tea was very good served with lots of ice.

Our food was served right away but they were slow to pick up dirty dishes and slow to drop off the bill.

Overall it was okay but I won't come running back...at least not for the soup. I may come and try other items.

My absolute favorite Thai in Las Vegas.  

The Pad Thai at Archi's is excellent.  It almost has a buttery quality to it.  This is one of the spots I always take friends or out of towners and they are always pleasantly surprised.  

You will be happy at any of the three Archi's locations.  The Ft. Apache and South Rainbow locations are newer and nicely decorated.  The original spot on Jones and Flamingo is tiny and old but tasty as ever.  

Lunch specials are great.  I usually teeter between my favorites, the spicy basil beef, and the pad thai.  Other delicious items on the menu: papaya salad, spicy eggplant, mango with sicky rice, thai iced coffee.

They offer brown rice - always a nice option.  

Prices are right, food is delicious.  Archi's is a 5 star Thai experience.

This is my second time here. The first time I couldn't believe my tongue. I came back for clarification and needless to say...it was true! Lol this food is amazing! I would recommend. I ordered chicken skewers and combination rice. It will surely leave you craving more.

I forgot how good Archi's is. I tried once about a year and a half ago with family. The Sahara location isn't anywhere near me but it was a good central spot for a family meet. 
The staff is always friendly and welcoming. 
I had the Thai tea to start. It was very good. Not too sweet and not too strong.
I love pad Thai and I love it HOT! So when I ordered my chicken pad Thai at a 10 the waiter was surprised and confirmed the spice level. He also confirmed that there was peanuts and egg in the dish. I thought was a great idea for any food allergy people. I've never had a restaurant do that. 
I also got the Tom Kha soup. Great flavor and the coconut milk made it a little creamy too. The serving is enough for 2-3 people to split if you're ordering as an appetizer.

This is my go to spot for dine in Thai food. Food is always good but the atmosphere is great as well. Can get a little busy prior to movies so I try to avoid those times. Service is pretty basic but is always fast. The food is always fresh and tastes very authentic. We always start out with the Thai Egg Rolls. Really crispy and the noodles inside are delicious. Have had many of the entrees and am always happy with every one of them. Highly recommend this location.

If I could give zero stars I would. We placed a phone order and accidentally called the other location. When my husband went to pick it up the guy refused to make food for him. He said "You called the other location so pick it up there." When my husband asked if he could just place a new order, the guy told him no! They refused to make us food! The other location was way downtown, not just a few blocks away, and it's a simple mistake. We have never experienced this kind of rudeness at a restaurant before. We will never go back!

Gahhh I love this place so much! This is my go to Thai restaurant that has a well rounded menu. The place is large and spacious. It's cozily decorated in a way that kinda makes me feel at home. Haha. 

My go to is their tofu panang curry, pad thai, and tom kha - extra spicy! My family especially loves their spicy basil beef. It's making my mouth water just thinking about it. Ugh. 

However, the service is pretty inconsistent. It varies every time I come in. Sometimes it would take them a while to take our orders or for our food to come out; while other times they were efficient and speedy! I would recommend coming in at lunch time, when it isn't too busy.

I go to the Regal Cinema at Village Square quite often and have always wanted to try Archi's but never really got to go. But finally after seeing a film yesterday, my friend and I decided to check out this Thai cafe. The food are absolutely delicious, great flavors, and is very affordable.  For appetizer, we ordered a pork satay with a. peanut dipping sauce and a side of cucumber salad. The pork was juicy and grilled to perfection. For entr√©e, we had chicken pad thai and beef panang served with white rice. You can choose the level of how spicy you want your food from 
1 - 10, 10 being the spiciest!  Great food, it's affordable, will definitely be back.
The food is delicious and always prepared fresh. I come here probably once a week. I love how big the portions are and how quickly it's ready!

I love their portions and when you order takeout they give you reusable tub ware which is really nice. Other than that the food is good I can't say the best nor the worst. Shrimp was too over cooked in my pad Thai and a 7 wasn't even spicy. Prices are reasonable but I would only come here since it's close by me.

First time here, possibly the last.
Service was extremely slow. When server finally arrived at table, she said "what do you want to eat"  not how you should approach a table....I wanted to go elsewhere, but we stuck it out, we should have left.

There are much better options for Thai in this city. Food was pretty "meh." As others have stated, service leaves a lot to be desired. Came on a Friday night and pretty much started to get rushed by the server. 
Ordered Tom Yum (doesn't come in the flaming serving pot- first time I had ever seen that), Vegetarian Red Curry, and the wife ordered Pineapple Fried Rice, which she really liked. 

I wanted to see what all the hype was about but next time I'll read the yelp reviews first.
Pretty great tasting place, they do take time to get you your order. Some of the best Thai food I've had. Its right across the street from me so when I'm hungry this is my go to place.

Im a fan for the food, not the service. We got seated fairly quickly, however, it took about 5 minutes for someone to come to our table for the first time. Eventually I ordered the Pad Thai lunch special with a #2 spice level. (Spice levels range in 1-10, with 10 being the hottest) Which came with soup of the day, which our waitress neglected to inform us of, a wonton, an egg roll and of course the main dish. When the soup arrived it was OK. I asked the waitress what it was and she said coconut milk something or rather. And thats all....while the broth was good, the ingredients werent. There were thee brown hard circles, chicken, something that looked like lettuce or cabbage, green onions (I think) and carrots. I wasnt impressed. Then our main dish came out. The Pad Thai was a little too spicy for my liking and way to peanuty. I ended up only eating the wonton and egg roll and having to order a whole other meal. That was annoying. I ordered the fried rice in place of the Pad Thai and it was amazing. Thats what I go to Archi's for in the first place. The down side is I ended up paying basically $16.00 for fried rice due to me not liking my first order, they wouldnt take it off my bill. In summary: I would go again, not during lunch, and play it safe with items ive ordered there before.

Hands down, one of my favorite Thai spots to eat.  I LOVE the thai beef jerky, nobody makes it like them.  I also love the pad thai, and the pad woon sen.  When someone says 'thai food', my brain immediately thinks about whether or not this place is open right then.

Best Thai food in LV. Came here with a restaurant group, we read reviews and try new restaurants monthly then review them. Everyone rated Archi's a 9-10 out of 10. We ordered chicken pad Thai, chicken fried rice, pad ram, chicken spice basil, and Thai egg rolls with fish sauce and Thai chili. Ordered spicy 0 and spicy 10. Spicy 10 has a great amount of spice but a 6 for me was perfect. Archi's has been consistent with its excellence each time we visit. We will continue to go at least once a week!
Just ok.  Nothing special.  Last time I was there was a hair on my plate.  Food is better then other thai places in summerlin.  I'll be back.
Such great food ! Big portions, awesome environment. That are always very fast and the flavors are just beyond this world ! Keep it up!!!

The BEST Thai food in town!
Archie's deserves 5 stars for the great food, ample portions, friendly & efficient employees, and a clean restaurant.  I have never been disappointed and I eat there regularly 
It doesn't hurt that the restaurant is next door to a Regal theater which makes the combo a perfect date night destination.

Dirty dining?? WOW!! Disappointed that you're serving your faithful customers sub par food. I have never been happy with the service or lack there of but always overlooked it because the food was good. You have just  lost a lot of regulars. Shame on you!

I tried Thai food here for the first time with my girlfriend and her family and let me say, this place is amazing. The service is great and so is the food. I get Chicken Pad Thai with a level 4 spicy and it's just the perfect balance of noodles and chicken with just that kick of heat to turn up the tastiness!!!!

I absolutely love this place , the best Thai food in Vegas on my list but if we've been waiting for an hour already to get our order and everyone around us is already eating and we got there before they have ..... AND I have to say something and follow up on my order, there is something wrong ... On top of that the server did not own up to their mistake and at least say that she has forgotten about the order , "it's busy" she said... Okay... And so I give her another chance and she said give them 5 minutes ... 6 minutes later ... No sign of food coming towards our table ... Now we just look outright stupid for even giving them a chance ... HIGHLY disappointed ... I am so upset that I'm writing this review right after I walked out .. ARCHI's please increase your staff so your servers aren't running around like chickens with their heads cut off ... Smh

Success has really spoiled these people. I am revising my rating from 4 Stars to 2 Stars.

Please read my review of Archie's Thai Kitchen. This is not the place I reviewed 3 years ago.

The service has become inefficient and you can sense an attitude, and the food is not as good as it once was. It's probably safer to eat there than a number of Thai places in town that have been suspended by the Health Department, but I'm tired of feeling that I overpaid for poor service, and sub standard food.  

Time to go out, take my chances, and try some other Thai places in town. I'm done with Archie's.

Good food, reasonable prices and clean, almost swanky atmo. 
I had papaya salad, tofu panang and some kind of delicious coconut soup...I ordered it a 7 on the spiciness scale of 1-10, and it was perfect. 
I would definitely come here again...

My wife treated me to dinner tonight here at Archie's. My first time here and it was delicious. We were seated immediately. Service was great. Food was delicious. They removed our dishes in a timely manner so there was no clutter on the table. We got our check when asked and to go boxes. Everything was great. Definitely recommend for awesome Thai food.

I've been wanting to try this thai restaurant for years; passed the rainbow location (the 1st one?), noticed the drive-thru window, convenient. I even checked out the website a few times. Finally, we got the chance today for lunch. We are not on this side of town much, though it's not too long of a stretch (just one street). We watched a movie, caught a matinee bright and early, the first showing. It was noon. There were quite a few diners but it is spacious, so it didn't feel crowded.

The ambiance is very elegant and pretty, with many dark rich solid wood pieces of furniture, giving you the feel of being in a resort lobby---it is one of the prettiest thai restaurants around. I thought they were for show but they were functional. The decor on the walls were simple (silk greenery variety) and ornate (wrought iron looking, rectangular-shaped). Seating is mainly chairs and tables with some bench seating. There were touches of alters but nothing large (or gawdy, for that matter). The kitchen is well concealed but you can hear the cooking activity (it isn't very distracting that you don't enjoy your meal, if you can still carry on with conversation, it's all good).

I was so excited to dive in, I didn't take any pictures, but I can still see the delicious dishes in my head. (Before we went into the theater, we checked out the menu on Yelp, so we knew what we wanted.) We ordered the fried rice, chicken and yellow curry, chicken, which came with a bowl of steamed white rice. It was so yummy. The fried rice was flavorful without being overly salty. It was big. The curry dish was excellent. We had seconds but we also had leftovers. It was a little over $22, without the tip. 

The wait didn't seem long at all. The staff was nice and our server was attentive, refilling our waters without us asking. (We got greetings both on our way in and as we were leaving.) 

I am sure we will be back as my husband loved both dishes, and I loved it too. Really satisfied our thai food cravings.

We've been going to the Archi's locations for awhile a couple years now and like in any location that we go to, I usually stick to our "usual" (Tom You Shrimp w/ white rice & calamari) because I have a fear called-- disappointment and I hate it. But I've been trying to get over my fears and one day we decided to venture outside of the usual. Our newest discovery was the Papaya Salad. Shredded Papaya with a sweet chili flavor type sauce and leaves of lettuce. My husband loves spicy food, so he gets (from a scale of 1-10) a 6, as for me, I am a fricking wimp when it comes to heat in my food so, I usually have a few bites and eat the crap out of the lettuce since it's mostly water and it's super refreshing! 

Other than the Papaya Salad, the food is like any other Thai restaurant and can assist with any fix that you're looking to get for Thai food. The thing that differentiates Archi's from other Thai restaurant is the fact that they pay attention to detail through service and presentation. Pure white plates and carved garnishes are usually small indicators that they care about- presentation. The decor of the restaurant is very modernized. Walking towards Archi's the first time, you'd assume that the place was as plain as the exterior of the restaurant... Not at all true. 

Boo! No refills on Thai Ice Tea!! Some restaurants refill, some don't and Archi's does not. That's the only reason why I knocked one star off.

It was my bf & I's first time trying archi's and it was a horrible experience. We ordered pad Thai and was asked what level we wanted it to be. It was our first time, so I kindly asked what she recommended and all she said was that there's a level of hotness  (well that clearly answers my question).... 
 We got our food after how long, but I got to admit that it was delicious! We ordered pad Thai (level 3) & garlic pepper shrimp. Half way through the garlic pepper, we found a strand of hair and it really just ruined our appetite... 
They were polite, apologized & removed it off the bill so that's a good thing. It coulda been okay if we didn't find the hair in our food. So I give it 2 stars...

Their food is the best out of all the places i been Thai'ing it up! I always have their Chicken Panang Curry and Chicken Pad Ke Mow and for apps the thai spring rolls! Very delicious and spicy. Dont forget the mango sticky rice!!

Shrimp was a bit over cooked, and wasn't a a fan of buying a $2 canned soda without any refills. Other than that the rest of my meal was ok. Only reason I would come back again is for the movie theatre next door.
Use to frequent this place but not anymore the delicious tasting Thai place I used to like.
By far the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  We drive across the city just for their food!!!! I highly recommend!!!!!

Been to all Archi's location many times for years. Our favorite location is the one closer to us on Sahara. The others aren't bad, we just like the service here a tad better and the restaurant itself is more comfortable than the rest. Archi's is my husband and I's favorite Thai restaurant in town. We've been to other great tasting Thai spots on Chitown and all over town too but overall, we're happy with our experience at Archi's. I dont have much to say other than I highly recommend this place. Everything we've ordered had been on point and have nothing to complain about. Were lucky so far since I see some other less than 5 or 4 stars. Everything has been consistent for us. From their scrumptious food to the above average service lol and pretty feel good restaurant (Sahara).

Enjoyed the lunch menu, nice selection and good value for money.

The red curry with tofu was a little light on tofu, but delicious.

Really appreciated the staff putting tables together to accommodate our large group, after I called about 30 minutes ahead to give them notice we were coming.

Careful!  Closed Tuesdays!

Listen to all those people talking about dirty dinings... y'all need to live a little.  Some of the best food I've ate around the world has come from places that didn't even have food standards.  Honestly I've been coming here for a couple years and I've never once have had any problems.  No food poisoning and never bad service.  I can't believe you would blacklist a place like this.  Come check it out before listening to these people.  This place is very clean and very reasonable on price and serving side!

My go to's are chicken pad Thai and the Shrimp Tom Yum.

A friend recommended this place to me because I could not find any Thai restaurants that can actually make Thai hot food.  This location has a scale of 1 to 10 but they have a secret scale you can go 1 to 30 on the Hot scale and now I have a new favorite Thai restaurant I will definitely keep coming back

Great food, horrible service!!! Our server practically ignored us the entire time. She forgot to put in our order and didn't even acknowledge that it took around 30 minutes for our food to come out. Then she continued to avoid our table because she knew she screwed up. Instead of fixing the situation she just made it worse. This will only be a "take out" spot from now on.

This place serve some very decent Thai food and we eat here on a fairly regular basis. Never had a complaint here, prices are affordable and service is more than acceptable. But the construction in the shopping complex, where this particular Archi's is located, is something that you should try to avoid, at least until after it's completed.

Finally, FINALLY, got to tick this place off my restaurant bucket list, where it has aged for several years.  Three Archi's in Vegas, and this was a first for any of them.

A restaurant that has our favorite wine, Riesling, as their house wine gets an extra star in my book, because it's never happened before.  Kudos!

We started with Tom Kha, and it was up there with the best we've ever had, loaded with white meat chicken and lots of flavor.  How did it know it would be just what the doctor ordered for the flu I'd come down with the next day?

For once, I managed to convince Herb to let me take a break from our chicken-infused life, and we ordered the Garlic Pepper Shrimp.  I was in heaven!  It was delicious, and had a good-sized helping of the elusive (at least in my culinary world) crustaceans.  I even convinced him to eat a few, since there were too many for me.  That's because there was yet another chicken dish to dig into.

Country Curry (with chicken, natch) wasn't as successful.  It was okay, but a little too bland, though we'd ordered it medium.  The waitress took it back to the kitchen for an additional helping of hot stuff, and it was vastly improved.  We've been a little skittish ever since going to Australia and learning what REAL Thai "medium" is like, i.e., smoke pouring out of your ears, so AmeriThai medium turns out to be not spicy enough too often.  

Service was excellent, and even though we got there late and were the last people to leave the restaurant, we didn't feel rushed.  

I'm looking forward to trying some of the other dishes on Archi's menu, and maybe even one of the other locations.

I wanted to grab a bite to eat before seeing a late night movie next door. We arrived around 8:30 pm so I thought whatever I get should be light. Then I thought again ...I'll order a side of Pineapple Fried Rice just in case. My husband ordered the Thai Beef Salad which has grilled top sirloin, tomatoes, red onion, cucumber, green onion, cilantro, and hand-tossed in spicy lime dressing . That salad never lets me down..it always turns out really good. I ventured away from my usual chicken curry dishes and wanted to also order a salad. I chose the Papaya Salad that had sliced green papaya, tomatoes, green beans, peanuts, dried shrimp, and spicy lime dressing. When I read it on the menu my eyes failed to see the dried shrimp. I was picturing nice big juicy shrimps on top of that salad. When they served it I thought "Maybe I forgot to mention the shrimp" ..because I couldn't see them. I started eating the salad and my husband starts eating it too. Then I tasted the little dried up shrimps which are smaller than the peanuts so they are barely noticeable. I dare not say a word because my husband loathes mostly all seafood and he already ate half of of the dish! It was a nice crunchy salad because of the papaya but I didn't mind. If I were to get this again I would have them leave out the dried shrimp because I'm not a fan of it. I also had my safe Pineapple Fried Rice which has Jasmine rice, stir fried with tomatoes, onion, green onion, pineapples, cashews, raisins, egg and cumin powder. It's a nice melody of flavor that blends nicely together. I had to stop myself from taking more than a few bites so I wrapped the rest of it for lunch for the next day. We ended with the Mochi Ice Cream which comes with three flavors we chose Red Bean, Green Tea and Strawberry for my husband.( He has a hard time trying new things) I always enjoy the ambiance here because it's relaxing and the food is delicious!

One of the most consistently good Thai places in Vegas. Usually get the beef pad see ew and the chicken pad prik king. Both are excellent. The ice tea is very good here also. Haven't found an appetizer we love here yet.

I enjoyed it here! A lot bigger than expected and service was great.  We went on a Sat around 1pm, it was busy, but not unbearable or overly crowded.  The service was prompt in the beginning when getting the order but it dragged a bit towards the end.  It took about10 min to get a box and our check.  Not a huge deal, but we did notice the difference.  Also, their lunch special is only on weekends, which is normally how specials work.  Overall, the food was great.  Each entr√©e you pick, you get to choose which protein you want with it.  Shrimp, pork, chicken, etc.  

The plates are great size to share and portions are not bad.  Pork fried rice came on a huge plate and all the entrees with came with white rice.  Restaurant was clean and overall, I would come back and recommend.  Their stuff chicken on the appetizers were really good, I will definitely get those again too!!

Located right next to movie theater so parking was a little of a pain, especially since it was a Sat.

Should definitely try the stuffed chicken wings ! The soup is very authentic. Not overly sweetened like all the other Thai restaurants trying to make it tailor to customers other than Thai. Very authentic I would say.
Love getting their Pad Thai and Spicy Basil. On top of that I get a Thai Tea. Best one Thai food I had in Vegas so far!

When my youngest son and his fiancee brought me here yesterday for Lunch... I thought to myself as I walked in.... "I've been here before... but when?". They tried to bring me here last year when I was visiting, but Archi's Thai was closed that day... They took me to another place... and was extremely disappointed. As you can see by the rating, Archi's was a pleasant surprise and very good Thai cuisine... judging by the Lunch Specials.

As I told the kids... Archi's is deserving of 5-Stars for the sampling of the Lunch Special... and if the Dinners were as good and consistent as the Lunch Special that I had.

Atmosphere is most unlike Southeastern Asian.... The decor is set in medium dark woods... furniture is French Provincial in style... pictures are, surprisingly, of Thailands French Colonial days with framed pictures of their former Royalty in Thailand of days gone by. You will be surprised by this atmosphere... a little of French Colonial in an Asian restaurant.

On the menu....

Tom Yum Soup (**** Complimentary) Lemongrass, Lime Leaves and Blue Ginger infused Broth, Mushrooms, Tomatoes and Lime Juice... sprinkled with Cilantro and Green Onions. For a smallish 3" diameter cup / bowl... this Soup could be considered Thailand's version of Chinese Hot and Sour Soup. Dang good... but left me wanting more... but it's complimentary.

Lunch Special #4 - Red Curry Dish with Beef (***** $6.95 Shrimp-$7.95) Fresh Red Curry Paste in Coconut Milk with Zucchini, Bamboo Shoots (a lot of 'em), Basil, and Bell Peppers. 

When you order this... the wait-staff will ask you the degree of Hot-ness that you want your Soup (from 1 to 10... with 1 being a lack of Heat and 10 being Super Hot)... I was considering ordering the Soup with a 10... My son and his fiancee looked at me quizzically or amazingly. They really tried to convince me to reconsider.... I tried this tactic... I asked the waitress... "If you ordered this, what number would you order?" She replied with a 6. So, I compromised.... 8.

When the Soup came out, The Soup was accompanied by a very small Green Salad which was totally inconsequential considering it's size; a Thai Egg Roll (***)... I really don't like totally Veggie Egg Rolls, and a thinly fried Won-Ton (****). This was just a small sampling of from their extensive menu.

The Red Curry Soup was something else altogether... As you travel West across SouthEast Asia... you'll notice that the Asian countries will be more influence by Indian Cuisine as you travel. This Soup was silky smooth from the Coconut Milk and the Red Curry gave it a warm color and unique flavor that only Curry can impose. Coconut based Soups are some of my very favorite. If I had to penalize the Soup for any reason, it would be for the amount of Bamboo Shoots... just too much. Otherwise, something you should try whether it be a Lunch Special or at Dinner.

Lunch Special #5 - Spicy Basil Dish with Beef (***** $6.95) Stir Fried with Zucchini, Bell Peppers, Garlic, Chili and Fresh Basil. This was a sampling that my son's fiancee obligingly gave me to try.

A very delicious Stir-Fry with Ground Beef. I will try this next time... whenever that may be.

Wait-Staff was very friendly, helpful. I asked the waitress how the smallish chain came to be named Archi's... She said Archi was the nickname of the owner, who started his restaurants seven years ago. This location started up two years ago taking over a Pick-Up-Stix franchise that went bust. She also said the owner usually is at the Rainbow location ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/archis-thai-kitchen-and-thai-bistro-las-vegas ) since that was the original restaurant and is quite larger in size.

One other advantage of this location is the proximity to my favorite Cinema in Las Vegas... the Regal Village Square 18 ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/regal-village-square-18-las-vegas ). Archi's would be a good pre or post movie visit.

BTW, Archi's has been rated the Best of Las Vegas 2005-2007.

Just left this location. I a big fan of Archie's, but this particular location is horrible. The food was great as always but the service.... let's say there was none. They sat us in the back away from everyone and pretty much ignored us the whole time. We ordered food and drinks and when it came, she sat all the items at the other side of the table and walked away, we had to reach over the opposite side to get anything. No one bothered bringing us a bill or checked up on us even once besides getting the order. The worst service we've ever received.
They lucky I give them that horrible rude servers and manager we been dining there 7 years never again.

I hate that i am writing a one star review but for this location its a must. I have been a long time Archi's fan back years and years when they first started here in Las Vegas. 
Everytime I seem to come to this location either the food is bad or the service is bad. 

Today for our lunch break my boyfriend and I decided to give this place another try. Bad idea.  I walked in and got seated by some server who seemed to have an attitude. We waited about 20 minutes before we were greeted by a busser asking what we wanted to drink. We asked her to order food as well and she told us she had to get our server.
15 minutes later finally a server came over and took our order. The food took forever to come out but the food was actually good though. The whole process took an hour and a half which in my opinion is very lengthy not to mention IT MADE ME LATE BACK TO WORK! 

Of course, when it came time to pay they were super fast on picking up my credit card.

The sad part was we werent the only table that was complaining.
Panang curry double chicken w/ brown rice level 8 is BOMB.COM . I get take out here weekly! Very clean and healthy!

We've had dinner here a few times.  Love their Pad Thai and chicken!  We had an unfortunate incident on our last visit as they delivered my sister-in-law and my food order and we were completely finished before they delivered my husband and brother-in-laws food.  Once received it was cold, so it had sat somewhere.  That the staff did not notice that only two of us were eating and that we had asked a couple times and were told it was coming was very disappointing and unimpressive.  Hopefully it was a one time oversight.  Again we had ate there a couple times prior with friendly competent service.  Hot and spiciness desired is on a number system from 1-10 which is great as we have always went with friends and we all have different variations on how we enjoy our food.  The menu is extensive. Enjoy!

One of my favorite Thai places in town.  Whenever I am on the west side of town craving Thai food, this is where I go.  I feel like it used to be cheaper then it is now, which was part of the reason I loved it so much.

After reading all the raves about how good this place was I decided to try it. This place is the epitome of American style Thai food. Why ?
Well , for starters, the chicken satay is dark meat and fried. Need I say more ? In fact , I think it was twice fried because it was like eating leather.
I've had satay in about 20 different places....always grilled white meat. I could go on and rip this place to hell, but why bother ?
With a name like Archi's no doubt Jughead is running this place....

Archie's is one of the best Thai restaurants around Vegas. I always order the yellow curry with chicken and the pad Thai noodles. Both dishes are excellent. I don't usually order too many other items on the menu, but I have tried a few other dishes that were also very good. If you want to try a good Thai place, try Archie's. You won't be disappointed.

I used to come here often because it's closeby and food is really good, but something changed and it's not for the better. I still come here from time to time hoping that it's just my imagination and somehow things will improve, but I'm not sure if I should keep giving them chances anymore. My favorites are pad kee mao and basil fried rice (soo much better than regular fried rice. I didn't realize basil can make that huge of a difference). You get to choose a spice level for each dish (1-10 with 10 being the spiciest) but it doesn't really matter because it's never consistent. Sometimes level 4 is not spicy at all and other times level 2 is extremely spicy. Their thai tea is really good. Service is very lacking when they are busy and often have to wait a VERY long time to get the check. I would try to avoid coming here at peak hours or just do take-out.

Omg the food is so good! I only come here once every couple of months because my roommate and I are VERY fond of the Thai beef salad and its a little on the expensive side (about $40 for two including the Thai iced tea). Its totally worth it though. The shaved papaya is so fresh, meat juicy, and veggies crisp. Be careful with the heat though. I eat a lot of Thai food and judging how hot these places make your food is hard. I ordered the 5 my first time here and nearly choked it was so hot. The 3 was a little cooler but still spicy. This time I ordered the 2 and it was perfect. This place tends to ALWAYS be crowded. Its best to call in your order and then pick up. I made the mistake of just dropping by and had to wait in a line almost out to the parking area.

My favorite Thai place by a landslide. I go here on an almost weekly basis. Pineapple fried rice is a MUST. Panang curry is another favorite of mine (basically a thicker curry sauce, referred to as a gravy). Hope they get delivery soon.

I've have been coming to this restaurant for years and now see they were closed by the HEALTH DEPARTMENT for too many demerits and are on channel 13's DIRTY DINNING's LIST. It is very disappointing when you have confidence in a restaurant, especially one as popular and successful as Archies,  then they cut corners and put their customers health and safety at risk! This is not acceptable and I will never frequent any of their restaurants again.
The service  is so good.   Their lunch specials are very good, and the portions  are large.  Excellent Thai food.

Came here Sunday for lunch with my mom. Normally we have great service but today was very slow. One lady seemed like she just didn't want to be there but who really wants to be at work? I had some garlic chicken dish that was yummy and served with white rice. My mother has the pad woon sen which is her go to and always yummy. Had a nice relaxing lunch. Will definitely be back. Love the decor.

We've been sitting here for half an hour so far and have received just tea. They recently expanded but don't seem to have the help to cover the additional seating. Seem more concerned with their to go orders than their restaurant patrons. Pity.

I finally found a thai place by my house that it pretty good! I'm a huge fan of thai food and have been desperately looking for something comparable to the restaurants back in Denver, CO.  I  recommend this place for the yummy pad thai!

They got the best food out of all the Archie's I been in but their servers don't really check on customers when they get busy. I see them standing around a lot making the orders come out slow. And some servers only get nice when its time to pay the check and determining how much tips to give them. BUT other than that, service is okay, food is amazing especially their PAD THAI.

I continue to go back to Archis but I think I will simply go to Flamingo. Seriously horrible service at Sahara location. I was there Sunday 4/2 for lunch, we waited an unacceptable amount of time just to order. In fact we had to ask busser for a server to take our order. Staff was walking around as if pissed off to be working and really not a single smile from anyone working there. Also no management. The food is always good even though appetizers or soups will arrive with main course 9 out of 10 times. I will not be returning.

Great Thai restaurant next to village theaters and cold stone stone creamery.

Due to its popularity there is usually a bit of a wait for dinner, so be prepared. 

When we go we usually get the pad see ew, fried rice, pad won sen or any of the curries. The portions are pretty big, especially the fried rice.

I'm not a big fan of their soups but everything else on the menu has not been a disappointment.
The  spicy chicken thai basil is delicious and their lunch special can't be beat!

Every time I have dined in - whether the group has been large or small - the service has always been a little spotty and food can come out very slow. 

On the other hand, the food is always great and it's still great if it's take out. Their lunch specials are awesome and I love their beef pad see ew and stuffed chicken wings. Also love their spicy basil! Their pad thai is better when you dine in, but, it's not as dry as I would prefer it to be, however, the portions, whether dinner or lunch, are great for the price. 

Another plus is that their bathroom is very clean (always a plus). 

I am fully aware they were featured on Dirty Dining. I've eaten there before and after and still do not care. They still have great food, great prices, and if you care for service, get take out.

One of the Best Thai Restaurants in town.

Let me start off by saying I have been to all of the Archies locations and this is by far the best and most consistent. The interior is beautiful and the wait staff is very friendly. But if your like me and order take-out then prepare to suffer through ordering because one of the kitchen staff normally answers the phone and lets just say Ixnay on the English. But for the quality and price of the food you cannot beat it. 

I normally order the Chicken Satay and to be honest there have been times when this has been overcooked. But only when I phone in an order. And I can honestly say it's only been twice in 30 some odd visits. The peanut sauce is my favorite out of all the Thai places I've tried. Also on the appetizer front is Beef Jerky which comes with a light citrus sauce. I dont care for Thai Jerky on a norm but theirs is good. 

For the entr√©e my norm is Pad Ka Pow (Spicy Basil) Beef. It is ground beef in a spicy chili basil sauce with sliced bell pepper and zucchini. Seriously, it is without a doubt my favorite dish of theirs. The meat is so spicy and flavorful. It always clears the sinuses. If I'm not feeling Ka Pow on a certain night than I get Pad Thai. Their Pad Thai has a fresh taste to it. And while I enjoy shrimp Pad Thai; theirs while being good had the tails intact which is a pain in the keester. So I would suggest getting the chicken version of the dish.  I have had other various entr√©es that are equal in quality and flavor. And love trying new dishes when ever I need a change. 

And finally dessert. They feature a plate of sticky rice with fresh fruit which is amazing. It's a bit pricey ringing in at $7 but I think it is worth it for the amount of yummy goodness you get. And it is easily big enough for two people. 

So take a chance and try this place. As I have said it's the best Archies in town. 

Happy Eating,
Jace

I love the mint chicken dish with Thai Tea. Mmm.
If you are a spicy food lover. You have to give them a shot. Save room for dessert because that rice ice cream dessert thing is delicious. I just cannot remember what it's called!!

I used to come here for lunch as it was close to my work. I loved this place. The food was good. I usually ordered pad Thai, spicy basil and pad see eww in the lunch special menu here. They give you a lot of food. Pad see eww was a little oily, in my opinion, but it's very tasty. You'll get a lot of thai basils in your spicy basil. Thai basil leaves taste different from American basil leaves. 

The service is okay, it can get very slow during lunch time. Another thing to note is that they close on Tuesday :(. 

However, since I discovered Thai style noodle house on Fort Apache, I have been going there instead. I feel like their menu has more variety. Their food is good and they are cheaper. Of course, Archi's is in a more upscale shopping center and the restaurant itself is bigger, so the markup is higher as well. If you don't care about price and want a fancy date at a Thai restaurant but don't want to wait for lotus of Siam, this is the place.
Best Thai Food in all of Las Vegas.  Freshest ingredients, clean, inviting space and excellent service.  This is a go to place to take out of town guests for lunch or dinner.  A+
Good food, good portions, nice ambiance. Just don't go 30 minutes before closing because you'll feel rushed.

If I could give this place zero stars, I would. My wife and I came in 45 min before they closed to grab a quick bite before our movie started. We only planned on staying for 30 min, but they said they wouldn't serve us because it was too close to closing. IF YOU WANT TO CLOSE AT 9:15 THEN CHANGE YOUR HOURS. P.S. TURN OFF YOUR OPEN SIGN AS WELL.

AWESOME thai tea. Love their ginger dishes. This place was really good, and service is always quick and friendly. Definitely a new favorite spot. I have been here about 3-4 times in the past month already!
Great place. The food here is wonderful at a great price. The only Thai in summerlin with a 4 star in my book

Beef noodle soup has great broth and is unique in the valley.  It comes with a lot of watercrest, bean sprouts and a lot of beef (brisket, tendon, and slices).  

The curries here are solid.  We generally also order the fish cakes for sharing which comes with a small sweet & sour cucumber salad with peanuts crust on top.  We can't decide which of the two is tastier! 

There are many Thai places in Las Vegas, however the flavors are good here and quality is consistent.

I heard and saw so many great reviews about this place so I was really excited to finally try it. We ordered Thai iced tea, yellow curry, and pad see-you. I guess I'm spoiled with all the good Thai places in town but I felt like the portions were small and the prices were slightly overprices by at least a dollar on each entree. The teas were overpriced too and not that great. I've had better elsewhere. As for the ambience, the location is convenient, there is plenty of parking, and the interior is nice. There are nice upgrades that you wouldn't find in other Thai spots like shutters and engraved drinking glasses but I care more about the food than the decor.

My go to spot for curry and pad thai in my neighborhood. There are very few places that I visit on a consistent basis that make me as happy as a trip to Archi's does. It is my guilty pleasure without the guilt.

Lets start off with my favorite dishes. 

The yellow chicken curry is a balancing act of perfection. A carnival of different flavors melded together to make one kickass curry. Throw in some potatoes, onions, and carrots with whatever meat you desire and you have a hearty delicious meal on your hands. Choose your desired spicy level, give me a side of rice, and I'm done!

Now the pad thai is easily one of the best pad thais I've ever had. It is not some fancy rendition of pad thai with overcomplicated ingredients or an unnecessary presentation. It's pad thai, with a side of chopped peanuts and baby sprouts. That is it. It does not need to be more than that.

I will say that not all dishes are created equal at Archi's. Their fried rice is just not that well put together. It looks delicious but it just really falls short on the flavor department. And another shortcoming of Archi's is their inconsistant spice level. I usually order a spicy level of seven but it will vary wildly from mouth scorcher to somewhat mild. I think it depends on who is preparing it but make sure to keep that in mind when ordering.

Despite the complaints, Archi's still goes down in my book as a solid place to get some pad thai or curry.

SICK! My wife and I are both sick. Never again. We have heard horror stories about Archie's but convinced ourselves it couldn't be bad being in Summerlin. WE WERE WRONG. Whatever you do don't go. I've also been told the other locations are better? We won't find out
Best Thai food in town!! Amazing food and amazing prices.

I used to go to Archi Thai a lot when they were still small, mom & pop kind of place. Their first location at flamingo was the place we go to. I've been to their location at Sahara a few times and has always been disappointed. The food has gotten more expensive, lesser meat, smaller servings and too sweet for my taste. Don't get me wrong they are still busy but service as well is going down the drain. I can go into detail but I don't want to waste any more of my time.

Excellent food!  The ambiance is also lovely and clean.  Love all their curries and the best of all is the Pad Thai.  Service is usually very good.  THe most wonderful thing is their lunch menu!  Same delicous food but in large portion (single item only served with egg roll and soup).  A great value.  We will keep returning.

We love the food. However, on a Friday night my date & I made it there by 9:35pm & we were refused service because the worker (host) said the kitchen closes at 9:30pm & we can't serve you. Their posted business hours, 10pm closing, are not honored, very rude! Had no consideration for our time!
Everything was so flavorful and at a reasonable price! My favorite dish that we ordered was the beef panang and pad seew.

I can't believe I haven't written a review for Archi's! 

Archi's is really authentic! I haven't had a bad experience with them. I always order the seafood combo with green curry and their chicken pad thai. I also like their fried rice, spicy eggplant with tofu and seafood tom yum soup! :) i didnt like their thai tea though because it was very sour and bitter. 

Service is excellent and food is really cheap! Come by and check it out!

Archis has vindicated themselves. Today was a 180 degree turn around across the board. I guess last time they had an off night. My pops had the pad thai very tasty,solid. I had the silver noodle soup with pork to start...the ingredients so fresh and tasty seriously one of the best soups I have ever had..anywhere! I had the yellow curry with chicken also excellent. I asked for 3 on the heat and omg it was spicey lol..be careful what level you ask for....service was outstanding and pleasant. It is always a pleasure to write a great review....if they deserve it they get it and this place definitely showed that my first visit was a flook...without a doubt will return to this restaurant.

They were on dirty dining and forced to close by the health department. I'll never eat here again.  

http://www.ktnv.com/news/dirty-dining/dirty-dining-at-archi-s-thai-cafe

Nice place, plenty of space and clean.  Service was very quick and professional, drinks were kept filled.  Food was very fresh and tasty, came out fast and steaming hot.  Spice was good, but perhaps a little on the mild side when I ordered one dish at a "9", but I love spicy food.  We will definitely return.

3-1/2 starts actually, but I'll give them the other 1/2 star for good service.

So far, the best Thai food that I've tasted in Las Vegas. That probably doesn't say much, as I've only been to one other Thai restaurant. Came here around 6:30p on a Friday night. There was a little bit of a wait, (20 minutes), but no big deal. Started off with the Satay Chicken - nice and tender, and able to cut with a fork. I didn't really care too much for the Thai Egg Rolls, not that it was bad or anything, but it was just an ordinary egg roll. It did taste a little better with the peanut sauce from the Satay Chicken. Got the Larb (spicy sausage salad). My dining partner insisted on a spiciness level of 8, then after tasting it, proceeded to complain how it was too spicy - Lol! I liked it, but it was a little sparse on the salad part. Pad Kea Mow w/ chicken seemed to be a popular dish, so, we got that one too - it didn't disappoint. Even though those were the only dishes we ordered, there was enough leftover for lunch the next day. Service was good - server kept our water glasses full and frequently checked to see if everything was ok. On my next trip here, will try one of the curries, the spicy eggplant, and possibly the stuffed chicken wings.

I've never had a bad experience here! Food is good, reasonably priced and pretty quick. They have all the standard Thai dishes, so if you're looking for a good Thai place, you will probably find the dish you're looking for.

I like to go to this place for lunch. Great Thai food and good offers on their lunch specials. The service is fast and I always feel welcomed. I usually do take-out, because I'm always on the move and I have to say that their lunch specials are bomb.
My favorite for Thai food!  I have yet to find better.

Woohoo!  It's Friday night.  You know what that means.  Mommy's off kitchen duty.  ;)  Time for takeout!  I had a craving for Thai so we turned to yelp for a recommendation.  We ordered the Tom Yum soup, Pad Thai, and Panang curry.  We ordered spicy level 5 for all three but the soup was spicier than a 5.  Maybe more like a 7-8.  The pad thai and panang curry were pretty good.  I wish the curry had more a bit more curry...didn't seem to have much liquid but I liked how it had green beans.  When we ordered they told us it'd be 30 minutes.  Hubby went to pick it up after 30 minutes and he still had to wait another 10-15 minutes.  While he was waiting he spoke to a few other patrons who were waiting to be seated/pick up their orders and many of them said they've often had to wait an additional 30 minutes to pick up their orders.  And he said the place was packed with maybe six tables worth of people waiting to be seated.  I guess dinner options in Summerlin are pretty limited.  I think the food is worthy of a 3.5.  I'm going to give it another try and reevaluate.

i was a little hesitant to try another thai restaurant in vegas because it felt like i was betraying LOS by doing so. but my friends (both locals) were very convincing so we decided to finally try this place. i'd have to say this is not a bad "other thai option" if one is craving thai food and don't have the time to wait (or was unable to make a reservation) at LOS. 

the tom kha was good, the glass noodles (forgot the thai name) was one of the best noodle dishes i've had, the combination fried rice was well seasoned and could very well be a full meal on its own, and even the spicy basil pork was pretty tasty. the only thing that was amiss at our table was the red curry. it was like 3/4 bamboo shoots. will never order that again. 

i ordered spicy level 2 but next time i think i'll try a 3. 

overall, this is a solid thai restaurant.

The pad Thai was delicious! We came here when my parents were in town (from the Midwest) and neither have ever really had Thai food before. They both loved it. My mom, who hates spicy things, ordered pad Thai with 0 heat. I forget what my dad ordered, but he asked for a 7 on heat. Now, my dad has burned most of his taste buds off over the years from eating spicy things, so most things advertised as spicy barely register for him. He said the 7 was fine, it had some heat, but it wasn't too much. I didn't see a kids menu and didn't think to ask for one, but my kids, who are fairly picky, ended up eating fried rice with no problems. I really enjoyed my experience at Archi's and can't wait to go back.

Amazing food! 

However, service is not always that great. I came in once, by myself, and the waiter kept looking at me like a fool.. after about a good minute, I asked to be seated, clearly making him look like a fool, he was a douche the whole time. Second time I go, this time with someone, waitress was just apathetic.

I like Archi's but it's not the best.  It is nice that they opened up a decent Thai Place in Summerlin.  But the selection (veggie), is a bit small and run of the mill.  The atmosphere is nice, the service is good and the food is tasty, but something is just missing.


I will go back because it's close to my parents, but I still prefer lotus of Siam.
I personally think Archi's is my favorite Thai restaurant. It has great price, great food and the service was great too. If you like Thai this is the place for you!!!

I've read and heard mixed reviews but I was on a mission to try a new Thai place. I'm glad I did! I'm in love with the beef Thai basil! It's my new favorite Thai dish. I've also had the chicken pad Thai and the beef pad se ew. All 3 entrees are good but the Thai basil just sticks out to me. My service was fast and friendly. I would definitely come back!

Archi's has really great food. Anything from the wonton soup, chicken fried rice, cashew chicken, sweet and sour chicken, broccoli with beef is all really great. The restaurant is clean and the staff is very friendly. The only reason I couldn't give them 5 stars is because their take out took forever. They said 30 minutes and we ended up waiting for over an hour. The restaurant wasn't even that busy when we went in.

Really, really awesome food!!!

I live at the apartment complex right "next door" - about a 5 minute walk from my door to Archis, so I end up eating there a lot.

FOOD: The food is really great. I love the pad thai of course. I've tried all of the curries and like them a lot. My girlfriend is the opposite - she loves the curries but only "really likes" the pad thai. I recommend getting _beef_ with your pad thai. Something about it just absorbs a bunch of flavor and tastes delicious. I also recommend venturing out and upping the spiciness a bit! (They ask you how you want it 1-10.)

My girlfriend and I love getting the wor wonton soup. It's really good. The thai iced tea is _amazing_!! The beef salad was ok. There've been a couple other dishes I've ordered that I recall just being ok rather than great.

PRICE: Really reasonable! Most dishes range from $12-15 or so. Not McDonalds, but nothing too crazy. And most dishes give you a solid amount of food.

WAIT TIME: You'll usually be seated right away. Almost always within five minutes of arriving. From the time you order, the food comes out in a pretty reasonable amount of time.

SERVICE: Usually the service is fine. There have been a couple of times when I have went where they've forgotten about or ignored us. One time there was a communication issue about how big the wor wonton soup was going to be (I was with a party of four and we wanted something big enough for all of us).
High quality, VERY authentic (I lived in Thailand 2+ years), great atmosphere and wait staff.  The only reason I give this a four instead of five is that the menu is a little shallow and uninspired

Archi's is the real deal and we have been coming here for years and the food never disappoints. The only disappointment was a few Tuesdays we had our heart set  on Pad Thai Noodle and forgot they are closed on tuesdays. Its conveniently located next to the Village Square theatres so after the movie, we came over for a bowl of soup. I had the Tofu soup and it was amazing with pieces of pork in a tangy broth. Im pretty sure this place has won "Best of Las Vegas" countless times. We typically have a 50/50 ratio of dine in vs. take out. Great food!

Friend and I ate here for lunch on a weekend in June.  I had the pad thai which I usually get at a Thai restaurant I've never been to before since pad thai is my benchmark of the eatery's cooking.  It was ok.  Restaurant decor was nice and service friendly.  

This was the second Archi's restaurant I've tried and I think I'll stick with the single store, mom & pop Thai eateries.  Actually, we only ate at this Archi's because the line to Bachi Burger was too long.  I would rate this Archi's 4-stars had I been there for a weekday lunch special.  As it was, with it's weekend menu pricing, the place was ok.

Pretty good Thai food. 

I had the only curry that doesn't use a coconut milk base, I believe they called it "country style".  It was in a chicken broth.

The country style curry had a nice savory broth and plenty of heat (I ordered it hot). The shrimp were plump and juicy.  I would have preferred more and different veggies.

The atmosphere was pretty nice and the service was good if a little rushed seeming.

Bottom line?  I'd go back but they're not high on my list of Thai places in Vegas.

My first time coming here for a friends Bday and to think I've been tolerating and spending my time at Original Thai BBQ and not have known about Archi's this whole time.  Best Thai dish I've had in Vegas and service is great also.

Friend recommended the Chee Choo catfish in curry sauce. Ordered medium spicy which was not at spicy at all but other than that it still had the right touch of flavor and the curry sauce was good. But after trying out my friends spicy beef eggplant, it made me wish I ordered that instead.

Hands down the best Thai Restarunt in Las vegas, definitely worth checking out if u love Thai food, the portion sizes are good, great location, with great prices. Customer services is good. It can be better but I don't mind it because the food is execellente
Mediocre food and poor service. You ask for more water and they forget. They only see you twice and thats it.

If I have a Thai food craving and don't feel like driving to Lotus of Siam, Archi's satisfies the craving. You're not gonna find out of this world dishes, but the kind of dishes that have become staples of Thai food found in America. Service is always prompt and attentive and it's speedy when you're ordering takeout.
Nice place to eat tasty food.service is good enough.prices are affordable.staff is fast and kind.will definitely come back to have a lunch or dinner.my review is not big enough.will update it later.

In fairness to the food it was ok hopefully clean if I don't run to the restroom soon. Negative point was the service too slow and missed out the starter soup which came with the lunch special and was never given though everyone around us were sipping on their soup. Totally disappointed!

If you're looking for some solid Thai food, this is a place to be.  It definitely appeals to the American palate. Their food is a great introduction for those looking for something different and savory.
Very good Thai food and reasonable prices. My spice level was a 2 which was plenty for me, husband got a 5 which was a bit too much for him. Pad Thai and spring rolls were my favorite dishes.
I like Archi's pad thai and pad see ew...especially because they use chinese broccoli. The south rainbow location is good too.

We had a huge birthday that we needed to have catered to the house and Archie is what was decided on.  

If it weren't for our friends and family getting this then I may have never heard of it and I'm so glad they did.  

This is by far the best Thai food I've had in Las Vegas and we had a lot to choose from.  Everything was perfect.  

Pad Thai, basil beef, curry, egg rolls, green salad and fried rice were all perfect.  

I've tried several different Thai restaurants here and if this was this good catered then I can't imagine how good it must be if you dine in the restaurant.

Food is always great! It can be really spicy so be careful when you say "10".  Only reason its 4 stars is because service is not great.  Understand they are extremely busy during lunch time but it should not be an excuse for bad service.  I now order "pick up" only.  Highly recommended.

I tried the chicken pad prik king here for the first time and fell in love! I've actually been craving this dish ever since I first tried it. We also really enjoyed the pad see ew which is a solid noodle dish at most thai restaurants for those who aren't familiar with what to order. 

Archi's also had a great peanut dressing, for a few extra dollars you can get a side of extra peanut dressing to throw on a salad during the week. Overall great takeout experience.

This used to be my favorite thai place. I used to order almost every week. I love pad see ew. The past few times I have ordered here it has been very bad. The flavor is bad and not enjoyable at all. I will not be ordering from here again. Their quality of food has gone down a lot, very disappointing.

Archi's Thai Cafe changed my outlook on Thai food.

I've never had good experiences at the Thai places I've been to in the past, which pretty much made me avoid Thai restaurants in general.  All I remember are "bean sprouts" and "peanuts" - LOTS of them.

So I was a little reluctant to try Archi's, but am SO GLAD that I DID.  Can't believe I waited this long.  Their chicken pad thai is so good and their chicken fried rice is bomb. I was pleasantly surprised to see that not everything is bean sprouts and peanuts!  

We ordered those 2 dishes, an eggplant dish and a Thai iced tea which came out to be ~$40 including tax.  I wasn't too thrilled with the eggplant, it was a little bitter and harder than what I'm used to.  The serving portions are fairly large and we pretty much ended up taking 75% of the food home.  Yeah, pretty ridiculous that we ordered that much food for lunch, but they served as nice leftovers :)

I would DEFINITELY go here again.  They also do take-out!  There are a few locations so make sure you call the right one to place your order!

Waited for about 10-15 minutes. Order the food, and waited for about 1 hour before the food came. During the waiting for food, the server never stopped by to give updates or anything. Food is good but not great. Ordered Fried Egg on the side, came cold. Server told me that she will get a new one. 30 seconds later with the same egg that I cut in half soggy... They must put it in microwave.
Service: 3/5
Wait Time: 1/5
Food Quality: 2/5

I've eaten here a few times. The food is very good and the service is ok. The lunch specials are priced great. I do feel that they can turn it up and do much better with the service. The friendliness of the staff lacks genuine feelings.

On the last visit I ordered a cola to be served a can of cola and glass of ice. Really? No soda fountain! No fresh brewed tea? Ok so the food is good but they also deliver it at very spaced and awkward timing so not all parties receive their food at the same time.

The name Archi's doesn't scream Thai cuisine or anything Asian for that matter, but once you get passed the unusual name, this place is definitely one of the better Thai restaurants in Las Vegas (chain or otherwise). 

Tom yum soup is delicious here and you can really judge a Thai restaurant from the quality of this traditional Thai soup. The Lunch specials they have from 11 a.m. - 3 p.m. are a very good deal and equally as scrumptious!

Overall the interior of the restaurant is very pleasant and appealing for what it is and the menu prices are very reasonable. If you like Thai food you should stop by here sometime!

Archi's is a Las Vegas Thai chain with 3 locations, and I must admit that a recent obsession with Thai Noodle had caused me to forget about how much I do enjoy some curry and noodles at Archi's, particularly at my neighborhood location. 

When we first moved to town, Archi's was our go to spot for Thai. The food can be great, which I will get to later, but I think what distinguishes Archi's from most restaurants in Las Vegas is their interior. They have done a brilliant job transforming a strip mall space into a warm, clean and welcoming space. There is a coherent sense of design, which puts me at ease for some reason. Maybe it just makes me feel like Archi has a good handle on things. 

And he does! After being a little Thai adventurous and eating all around town, I can confidently say that when the food is good it is really good. Granted, they do suffer from inconsistency from time to time, and their spice scale baffles me. A 3 can be mind-blowingly hot despite the fact that the scale supposedly goes to 10. Consider yourself warned. 

Despite that, when I want curry or Pad Kee Mow or a very respectable eggplant dish, I am happy to visit Archi's. The tofu in their stir-fry and noodle dishes is not the most flavorful, but I was obsessed with their Pad Kee Mow for at least a month. I became a little frustrated when the vegetable selection kept changing. How hard is it to give a girl a solid helping of real vegetables (baby corn does not count) with her noodles? However, on my last visit, I told the waitress "lots of yummy vegetables please", and apparently that is the secret phrase to unlock garden delight because I got mega-veggies. Splendid!

The service has always been no-water-glass-empty amazing when I have visited. Food comes out quickly and hot. Servers are always nice.

I was teetering between a 3 and a 4 for Archi's, but Archi, I am slapping a 4 on your establishment because although the food is a little inconsistent, I really really appreciate the atmosphere, cleanliness and service, and when the curry stars align, the food is definitely fan worthy.

Once again, Archie's came through with the tasty lunch. The ginger chicken is well prepared. Always worth a little extra for the brown rice. Both locations I visit tend to have the same quality and consistency which is nice.

3 words: YELLOW CHICKEN CURRY. The curry is not a paste thick sort but rather a mixture of  sweet and spicy yumness! The spices in this dish are not overwhelming at all and they provide a taste like no other. Like most curry dishes you have to choose a spicy range from 1 to 10. I love spicy food and let me tell ya, 7 is pushing it but I've tried 8 and while it is very spicy, you can still taste well enough to enjoy the dish. So far everything I've tried has been delicious from Pork Phad Thai to their Tofu soup to Tom Kha Shrimp. If I had anything bad to say about Archi's it would be that their fried rice is mediocre, I've most definitely had better fried rice before, but its not terrible- just bland.  Make sure to try the Thai Tea with your meal- DELICIOUS! :)

For some reason this location is hidden away like some redheaded step child. Its a tiny location in the Village Square shopping center, but once you find it and go inside you will find a warm and friendly environment. This location is always clean and ready to serve. The staff is so friendly- I once picked up some take out and  the waitress offered me a drink  while I waited (which wasn't long).
Very good thai basil, independent of what you enjoy in it. I also must say the service is very good.

The food is great!! Had chicken pad Thai level 5. It was the right amount of spicy. Service not so great. Was never offered water. When they came to take my order still waited to be offered water. Nothing. I called the busser over and asked for a thai iced tea (which was delicious). No one came to check on me to see if the food was good or if I was finished. I had to wave a waitress down to say i was ready for my check. But the food is great.

Whoa. Their Thai iced coffee is gargantuan! I forgot to look and see how much it cost but I could only finish about 1/4 of it and so the rest went to waste. :( I also ordered a red curry with tofu and it was very good even though I only ate maybe 1/10 of it. I liked the fact that the tofu was lightly fried which means less fat! My friend Adam kept me well distracted and I totally forgot to eat my food. Oops. 

This place is casual, nice, clean and spacious. It's right next to the movie theater so you can grab lunch or dinner before the movie. I kind of wish we had more time so I could try the mango and sticky rice dessert. This warrants a return trip in the near future!
The soup was great but the entree left something to be desired.

This place is goooood. I came with a friend for dinner, and he ordered a pad thai while I chose the pineapple fried rice. The food was served quickly and the ingredients are fresh, and the prices are reasonable.

Inside it appears somewhat small, but the decor is very well laid out and there's a lot of open space. The nighttime dining atmosphere is well-lit to ensure you don't accidentally jam food up your nose instead of into your mouth.

There's not much service here, all they do is refill your water and hand you the bill, but it's likely the quality of the food will make you forgive them for the crappy service.

I just ordered takeout from Archi's and the food is amazing! I ordered the Green Curry with Beef (medium) and the Penang with Chicken (medium) and they're both delicious. Both were $9.95 each. It's exactly how spicy I wanted it to be. I've been looking for a really good Thai restaurant since I moved here and thankfully I've found it. The host was friendly and the place was clean. They deserve 5 stars!

Out of all the archi in the Las Vegas area this is probably the most spacious one. I feel like they cleaned this location up a lot too. We came and ordered different dishes and ordered family style. One tip... the food is abundant so if you are a group of 6 then you would do well to order 5. 

The panang curry is really creamy and one of my favorite. The papaya salad is crunchy but a little bit in the sweet side for my taste. The pad Thai was a bit dry though. They do spicy by levels of 1-10 with 1 being not spicy to 10 being spicy. 5-6 is the most common. Keep in mind the curry itself is already a little bit spicy and the noodles are not so you can adjust as needed.

Staff was efficient. Our waters were never empty and they were friendly. If I want to eat Thai food the first thought is archi!

Spur of the moment lunch time stop turned into restaurant love affair! That's what happened last weekend between Archi's and I. 

What a great find! What I loved immediately about this place was the warm, welcoming interior. I forgot that I was in a huge strip mall somewhere in Vegas.

My cucumber salad was sweet and refreshing and my chicken was delicious. The veggies were fresh and tasty. Our drinks were filled at all times, and we never went without anything we could need or want. 

The prices were fair (really good lunch specials during the week, but we were there on a weekend). 

I think this is standard everywhere, but it still bugged me that we weren't able to just pay a little extra to upgrade to brown rice (we had to get the steamed rice that came with the meals and then pay for a huge side of brown rice). If that's my only real complaint about this terrific restaurant then I know I'll be back (but only when I have to be on this side of town). 

There's something so exciting about stumbling in to a new place and being totally blown away by it. I'll be thinking of this restaurant and that meal for quite some time!
Pak Kee Mau and stuffed wings are my personal recommendations. The spicy basil with minced pork is also a highlight. Friendly staff and relaxing vibe.

Archie's is delicious, the beef curry fried rice spicy 10 can't be beat. The portion size is extremely large and cost is affordable this ratio is why it is a must eat place in Las Vegas. Food taste fresh and it has the right amount of spice along with flavor.

The service has its hit and misses, normally though they get it right ... I think twice out of a dozen times I had to wait roughly an hour for my food. My girl friend and I learned its easy to call and order it to go and enjoy the food at home while watching a movie. The space went under a remodel giving additional (much needed) space so wait times for a table are next to nothing when we go to dine in. 

Can't compare if to other Thai restaurants as this is my first Thai restaurant, but I do enjoy their food and believe they have set the bar high. Their food is good, menu has options for everyone, atmosphere is comfortable, service is okay could be slightly better, portion to size ratio AMAZING... so Give them a try you too may enjoy what they have to offer.

Best Tai food in the area. They get busy but it's worth the wait. Order to go and it's fantastic too. The environment is ok, a little crowded but not too loud. Chicken Satay is the best, next level delicious. Great! I could eat here everyday.
Really love this restaurant! Good service, good food. Their beef salad is the best!!! :-) Highly recommend!

I am not really a Thai food enthusiast; however, my boyfriend is and I have heard great things about this place so I wanted to give it a try. The place was very busy during lunch hour but we were immediately seated. We both ordered $6.95 Lunch specials which is really a great deal of food for the price. His red curry was fantastic! My Kung Pao chicken was just ok. All the other food with the meal was delicious. I will go back again but will stick with ordering curry.

The two of us are Thai food afficionados & haven't any decent restaurants of that cuisine in the neighborhood.  Archi's was once terrific, in service, quality & ambiance, but last weekend was unfortunately the 3rd time in a row that left us wanting.  

When we arrived after 5:00 on Sat. night there weren't many people there which was unusual for Archi's.  The lighting felt like a big cafeteria, without warmth (the Rainbow location is more intimate).  The servers remain robot-like, as if owner/manager demands they not chat up a customer. 

The Pad Kee Mao was as good as usual, but the spicy eggplant had no spice (we asked for a #2) & was swimming in oil.  Our water glasses weren't refilled & our server didn't ask if our meal was okay.  

When I have in the past left a few msgs. for Archi (is there an Archi?), the mailbox was filled each time.  So, how much care is really given to the Summerlin store any longer?  So, we'll keep looking.

I will never ever ever eat here again for as long as I live!!!!!!!   My brothers thought it'd be a good idea to take me here for dinner since I lived in AZ and there is no thai restaurants in my town.   They had been here before and said it was really good.  But OMG it was a big mistake.  about an hour after we ate here we just started vomiting and we got severe diarrhea that lasted for 3 straight days.  I mean it was non stop, so severe in fact that on the first night I slept on the bathroom floor next to the toilet.   I know it was this food that made us very ill....   This is why I don't recommend this restaurant to anyone, cuz I have nothing good to say about it.  Even our waitress was so rude that night.       "EAT HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK."....   This place traumatized me so, that i'm afraid of going to eat thai food.   This place SUCKED!!!!!

I was never a big fan of curry, but Archi's has changed my mind.

There are several Archi's in Las Vegas, but this location is my favorite.  I love their pineapple chicken curry and they put the right amount of spice (#5). 
The service is good, very friendly, and check on the customers regularly.  

The atmosphere is simple and the restaurant is clean.  I would definitely go back and must try an new item.

I lunched here today with a coworker. The decor and atmosphere are delightful. The food was delicious! I ordered the chicken with basil lunch special (lvl 4 spicy). My friend had the green curry chicken (lvl 7 spicy). I will order it more spicy next time, but the dish was very flavorful, fresh and delicious. The egg roll and the fried wontons were standard, nothing special. The soup of the day was nice and refreshing, although one bite of the big chunk of ginger was a bit overpowering. We weren't told the name of the soup, but it was in a broth with chicken, lemongrass and veggies. The lunch specials were a deal at 6.95 each, and the portions are not skimpy! I will return here soon!
Great service, ambiance, food, and the lunch menu is so affordable!  $7.95 for a half serving of entree, salad, egg roll, and house soup. I always have to pack mine up.

I would say food is good but service not good at all , most of the waiters and waitress have unfriendly faces and look like they don't like to work here and they don't know what's the meaning of customer service .
I ordered medium spicy chicken but some how chicken was sooooo spicy , I didn't want to wait to make a new plate that's why I had to eat a little bit.
Since they brought the food till we leave none of them ask how is the food ? Or everything is ok ? They didn't refill the water as well !!!!

Horrible customer service.  My husband placed a to-go order and I went to pick it up.  Paid, left a 3.00 tip on a 12.92 order, ordered pad thai.  Got all the way home and my husband was calling me telling me they sent me home with the WRONG order and I needed to go back.  I went back and asked how I was going to be compensated.  She either had no idea what I was asking or was playing dumb.  She offered me a tea "to make me happy."  I went 20 minutes out of my way, gave a $3.00 tip on a to-go order and SHE screwed up and offers up a tea.  Our business will be taken else where.
2 days straight I've on school lunch ordered the Red curry thai entr√©e with a SEVEN heat level and it's been consistent both times which is rare with thai food!  So good I want it again tomorrow.

When we are in the vicinity and feel like Thai, this is our place to go. The food is pretty expectant that of Thai Food. I mean, it isn't anything different than from another authetic Thai establishment...but they're pretty good! They aren't a hole-in-the-wall business, but its ambiance isn't stuck up. I like.its ambiance/decor. Feels kinda homely for some reason.

What makes this place stand out for me is this is the "closest" place for pad prik pow. I swear everytime I hit up a Thai spot that dish is like a rare find on a menu. More so, it isn't some exotic or unique dish. Well anyway, they got it and it's good enough! Beats driving all the way to russell/215, but dang...it's almost there being I'm driving all the way from the North side.

The service is a hit or miss for us. Sometimes they're attentive and other times you're thinking, where the hell...but never have they been rude. Makes a difference, right? It does! Good thing the lack of attentiveness doesn't drag-on like some other places. So nope, no yawning here.
