Definitely recommend if you're feeling Thai and you're nearby. You don't gotta jump into your car to drive through the creation for. Kid and stroller friendly!

Enjoy!

Archi's has become my regular Thai place.  The food is consistently good, the service is nice, and the lunch specials are awesome.   I love that I can ask them to make my food without all the sugar, and they actually do it (unlike some restaurants that say they will, and make the same thing they always do).   The atmosphere in here is great, so eating in is always nice.  Take-out is always packed very carefully.  I've never had an order mix-up, or a leaky container. 
The only issue I have with Archi's is that they don't seem to give you as much rice as other places.  If you order some curry, you get a box of rice.  If you order two curries, or a curry, and a tom kha gai, you still only get one box of rice.  I sometimes end up having to make more at home, which kind of negates the whole take-out thing.  I'll just have to remember to ask for more before I leave next time.
Best Pad Thai in town!  I LOVE THIS PLACE

Big fan of this place. They have a great lunch special that is priced very good. Last time I was there I had the sweet and sour shrimp. The spice level I chose was a 5, but wasn't that hot. Next time I'll try the 6. I definitely recommend this place to someone who loves Thai food.
Panang curry was only grease,,,,, with a drop of curry,,,   So bummed..

Great service, beautiful place, but the good wasn't great. The country curry was bland, the fried tofu was alright, and the Tom kha soup had a good broth, but the size of the tofu took over the soup which made it impossible to take in a full bite of the other ingredients. I wanted more with it being Vegas...eh

The food here is fantastic!! But the service is incredibly slow, they don't seem to communicate between their employees because my party had to frequently deal with the same issues regarding orders, checks, and sluggishness. 

But if you order to go you won't be disappointed!

Love this food here! I like the pad Thai with chicken and also the red curry for lunch.. Thai tea is a must get and the beef pad see eu is bomb here as well!! Lunch specials are the way to go in this place!

We order takeout from Archi's almost weekly. We love the crispy fried wontons, tom kha soup, pad thai, and yellow curry. We get the 6 spicy rating and it is perfect! I highly recommend this place for great Thai food!
The best green chicken curry ever! I recently found out about this place and have been going about twice a week Definitely my new addiction

My wife and I ordered Pad Kae Mao (drunken noodles) Spicy Level 6 and Spicy Basil with Pork Spicy Level 7. 

The restaurant has a nice and open layout. A good amount of space between tables. The waitress and servers were nice and attentive.

- the drunken noodles was delicious. I usually order this in most Thai restaurants and this is probably the best I have had in Vegas (so far). I personally don't like Thai food that is towards the sweet side, and this was definitely very savory with a nice light basil flavor. There were lots of vegetables like mushrooms, baby corn, and green beans. The spice level was up there, so if you don't like spicy food, I recommend ordering much below a 6.

- spicy basil with pork was an above average dish. It came with a tiny bowl of rice. With all of the sauce, I was hoping there would be more rice. The dish comes with ground meat, and we requested sliced pork instead and they accommodated us without any problems. There is a soy sauce, basil, stir fry flavor. I would probably try something else off the menu next time.

All in all - good place to eat with a convenient location next to the movie theater.

I love Archi's however we walked in at 9:30pm (they close at 10pm) and they told us we couldn't dine in, they were only doing to-go orders?! Very disappointed with their customer service, as we are regular customers.

A friend who's very critical of food establishments told me this place was good so it's got that going for it. I've only been once but would definitely recommend it. I got the Pad Thai lunch special which was a good deal. They give you a regular sized portion of the noodles as well as soup and a salad. 

The servers are super nice and attentive. I'll be back to try out some curries!

Love to try any good food when I am on vacation and my friend bring me here .. taste is so good and love Thai ice tea too .. why I give 4 stars because they forgot our food .. I think she probably didn't order and we didn't get it .. in the pay check .. didn't included also .. so I guess she totally forgot our order in first place ... anyway I love the food chicken bazil so yummy ..

I love this place. The food is always good. It's consistent. I always order the Panang or masaman curry, pad Thai, tom yum soup, spring rolls, Thai beef salad, and spring rolls. No complaints. The service is good too. Not spectacular, but good.

My experience of Archie's from another location was notably better than this location. I may be trippin', but I don't think so either. 

Panang chicken curry- 4 stars. The other location was a definitive 5 stars. 
Curry fried rice w/ pork- 3 stars. The other location was also a definite 5-stars. 
Stuffed chicken wings- 3 stars. It was good. 

I'll be heading over to the other location to get my Archie's grub on. But, I'd say it is one of the best Thai food in town from my experience at other location.

I love it when we get to come here. The food is soooo good! Usually I have left overs to take home the portions are so big but this last time my son shared my fried rice with me and I think he ate more than me he liked it so much, and he's 3! Also they are true to their word when it comes to spicy level. My husband likes that since he loves spicy food and he will get a level 10 on his curry. 
Again, great place and the staff is quick and courteous. Food is done quickly and served hot and flavorful.

I've seen Archi's Thai Caf√© for years as it's right next to the Regal Cinema at Village Square. I finally got to try it for lunch and was pleased. I got there at what is probably just after their busiest lunch time and was seated immediately. It was five to ten minutes before anyone stopped by but the waiter did eventually and took my order. The food came promptly and my water glass was refilled without my asking. I had the pork Pad Thai which was very tasty and at a heat level of 5 or 6 was pretty mild. The extra accompaniments were good as well and the portions are generous. I confess to not being a Thai food connoisseur but this was a very enjoyable lunch with good service (once it started).

Spicy Basil, always amazing. Their tofu was cooked well, which is hard to come by and they didn't skimp on the zucchini (huge plus).  I like really spicy thai food, but my friend ordered this dish mild and it was still super delicious with a good amount of spice.
Must try the Pineapple Fried Rice and Thai Toast! Great prices for their large portions! Great quality food! Super clean! My husband loved the Pad Thai.

I was very disappointed in my visit today. From looking at other's reviews, it seems like Archi's takeout service is horrible. I can definitely agree. When I called this afternoon, no one picked up the phone. I called again and placed my order at 1:17. The lady said she will "see me in 25 minutes." We got there at 1:44. The food should have been ready by then, right? We waiting until almost 2:15 to get our food.. I placed my order almost an hour ago. My boyfriend had to wave down a server 3-4 times. I ordered spicy level 4 and 5 on my dishes and they were not spicy at all. Portions were lacking for paying over 10 dollars for 1 pad thai dish. I've dined in here before and it actually replaced Thai Style Noodle House for a while. Don't think I will be coming back though.

This place is consistently great.  I've been here for lunch and dinner and enjoyed it every time.

For lunch, I definitely recommend ordering off the lunch section on the back of the menu.  Food is great and the price is a good deal.

For dinner, I recommend starting out with the Tom Yum soup.  Noodles are fantastic, as are the curries, and the fried rice is delicious.  The only disappointing thing I've had was the shrimp roll appetizer.  It was whole shrimp wrapped in rice paper and deep fried, which was not at all what I was expecting.

One thing to note is Archi's has a few restaurants around town and the numeric scale they use to tell how spicy you want a dish is not consistent.  A 4/10 at one location is more like an 8/10 at another.
great food, great price.  if i want to eat archies on the weekend i order take out because this location gets packed.

Worst Service worst Customer service. My family and I have been coming to this restaurant for over 5 years. Never did we have a problem with the food. Yet, after 5 long years of Patronage, one dish was not to our taste. Upon asking for a different dish, we where approached and scolded for sending back one dish, ONE DISH!  Immediately the service stopped to our table. The manager was talking to the server in the kitchen right before our eyes! And never approached us, instead we had to call for him. He stood up by his employee and basically agreed that the scolding was in place. The tab was thrown in our table. No one picked it up so I walked to the host booth and handed them the bill and my CC, the server came to the booth and where speaking about me not leaving a tip, I started speaking in Spanish to them, to what they reply "We don't speak Spanish" and I replied I don't speak Thai and I don't appreciate her looking at me and saying something in Thai. After 5 years never Again! Rude RUDE RUDEST PLACE I HAVE EVER BEEN TRATED EVER!

Great Thai food!!!  Their curries and pad thai are among the best I have ever had!  Love that you can choose your own spiciness temperature for each dish, which many Thai restaurants don't offer!  They also have great Thai Ice Tea.

Great and convenient for take out!

My mouth is watering just thinking about this place. Best thai food around!! I've enjoyed every single meal I've ever eaten here, and I continue to crave it after I've left. The service isn't outstanding, but the food is the best part and will keep you coming back for more! You won't be disappointed if you love some good thai food. Highly recommend.

Archie. Man. It's been awhile. I thought about you each night. Anyway... I'm here. The food you prepare for me is just so awesome. The price you charge me is even better. I can't get such a deal anywhere else. You treat me like a king, level 6 spicy of course. Thank you Archie. You deserve better. Farewell.

I love their curry which is all I ever get there. They have a few different kinds but they are all delicious! I usually come before going to the movies next door. It's not usually too busy and you don't really have to wait. They are a little slow with the service though. Worth checking out.

Fine, Archi's....you win! 

The Tom Kha soup here is soooo delicious, I start salivating (and sweating) just thinking about it! Coconut milk mixed with an abundance of spices like lemon-grass and basil...and cute button mushrooms....ugh, I want some right now! I get it with level 3 spicy and it's perfect. 

They have a pretty complete menu of authentic Thai food here, and you can order Pad Thai noodles with varying degrees of spiciness (from 1-10). Pad thai is nothing special, and I've tried the Rad Na noodles as well, which was a little too saucy for me. Overall, noodles are like 3 star quality. 

Also, if you order the Thai Iced Tea, get ready for a HUGE glass of tea :D  It's a little sweet for my liking, but they are very generous with portion size!

Decent service. Food tasted great. Real restaurant quality. 

I love how much amount of food they give you. Its usually more than enough so I take them home and enjoy them later on. Tastes just like other delicious thai restaurants but with more food.

Especially for pad thai, i've had better pad thai but just cannot go anywhere else anymore because of the amount that this place give us.

I have two favorite thai restaurants and this one is one of them.

The best desert of all time , coconut ice creme and sticky rice with fresh mango. Nothing, and I mean nothing at all beats that just so simple but so delicious! They also have the best drunken noodles and pad Thai in town.

I was looking for a Sprint store and remembered there being one near Ft Apache and Sahara, but I arrived too late and they were already closed.  So I decided to check out Rising Sun Sushi, which is supposedly located in the same strip mall (sign is still up), but after driving around the entire strip mall and not seeing any sign of Rising Sun and finding Archi's Thai Cafe next to the movie theater I decided to check out their dinner menu.

The restaurant itself looks nice, the dining area is split into 2 sections (at least), as I was directed to a corner table in the smaller more secluded dining section closest to the parking lot.  I was hoping to be seated in the main area, but whatever.  They have a few waitresses and 1 waiter, and I am not sure if they take turns in getting customers/tables, but I ended up with the waiter that still have a lot to learn about getting better at being a waitperson in a restaurant. If the number of guestcheck holders in their apron is a direct count of the number of tables they are currently assigned, then I would say he has 3 tables to look after while I was there, and he was overwhelmed with just those 3 tables.  After I ordered and the food was served (by a different waitress), he did not come by to check up on the table until I was practically done eating, and it took forever (at least 5 minutes, but most likely not more than 10 minutes) to have him come by again to pick up the money.  This while at least 10 people were eying me sitting there waiting, while they wait for a table to be freed up so they can get seated and order some food.

Anyway, moving on to the food.  I have tried the curries before, and I thought about trying something new.  Sukiyaki (Thai Style) was what i ended up ordering, and I was thinking a Japanese Sukiyaki with Thai ingredients.  Completely wrong imagery!  What I ended up with was a bowl of Thai noodle soup that I remember eating at one of the street food vendors when I was a kid in Bangkok.  The flavor was the same as what I vaguely remembered. It was served piping hot (good), with lots of vegetables (sure why not), a lot of pieces of chicken and 2 shrimps, plus a side of chili paste (cool, you can adjust how spicy you want).  But still I thought that item was overpriced for what it really is, and I will not order it again.

The Thai Iced Coffee is still large, and I think is worth the price of admission, and still very enjoyable.  I sometimes feel like just ordering that to go, if I am too lazy to shop at one of the Asian supermarket that sells them premade in cans or as a mix.

Overall:
Service: 2/5
Food: 3.3/5
Price: 2/5 (For their Sukiyaki - Thai Style)
Atmosphere: 4/5

This location is not recommended if you want to try Archi's and staying on the Strip, as their W. Flamingo location would be closer, and my experiences there have always been a good one. But if you live near this location, by all means drop by and try any of their curries.

I frequent Archi's at least 1 time every 1-2 weeks. This is my favorite place to go to whenever I'm being indecisive for lunch/dinner. They have huge portions with very decent price and their food is always full of flavor.

My usual go to items are the pat kee mow (stir-fried wide noodle), basil fried rice, red curry, green curry, or koowakai (also stir-fried wide noodle but with chicken/squid and a side of dipping sauce). 
I prefer their pork over chicken/beef because it is always tender with the right amount of marination. I even took my parents here and it soon became my dad's favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. He really likes their pad cha cha cha which is a seafood stir fry.  

So why is this place a 4 star to me instead of 5? 
I understand that this place is a popular spot in Vegas and is always packed during dinner time. However their service will go down drastically during their busy hours. There were two  occasions where we had to wait 30 minutes to get our check taken care of. Despite the occasional inconvenience I still keep coming back because their food is that great. I suggest ordering take out during their busy hours because it'll take awhile before you'll get seated.

Dishes in order of awesome:

1. pad kee mao with pork- spicy (although only a 5) with plenty of veggies. Weird to have lettuce underneath though. Pretty darn awesome.
2. pineapple fried rice- addictive!
3. pad thai- a tad sweet but still tasty
4. house curry- not as rich as other curries but still alright

Large portions, good service, reasonable prices. I'd come again.

Archi's always delivers! This was my first time at this location and I gotta say I like the other locations better. This one is much bigger (read- more busy/crowded) and the service left something to be desired. But once we dropped a hint the main guy, things went alot more smoothly. HIGHLY recommend the red curry and the papaya salad. Just a warning the salad was WAAY spicier than I expected, so be conserved on the level you ask for. Also got the flat noodles with chicken- pretty solid. I highly recommend Archi's to anyone and everyone!

We were quite disappointed that we ordered a meal to share - portion quite adequate and some leftover - however, sooo hot and we only ordered a '2' in hot... other than that - good service, clean, probably tasty if we could taste it over the hot...

It seems as though they give you half the portion when you order out but you still pay full price.  Which is a catch 22 because when you dine in they take soooooo long to make your order it gets annoying :/

Really Archies??!!   We put our trust in you every time we eat at this location.   It is my daughters favorite place but to see that you got 42 demerits from the health district and a closure is very concerning.   The eggs and meat were 20 degrees off safe temp???  The kitchen was gross,.    I dont know what happened, if this was being cheap, lazy or just no concern for your customers health.  The worst part is knowing that this is a family place and you allowed this to happen..... shame on you.....

My third favorite of the three Archi's locations around town. It's the farthest from me, so therefor the one I frequent least. 

All my same favorite dishes apply to this location. Curries, noodles, soups and eggplant are always my favorite. I still steer clear of the chicken dishes. Pork, tofu, catfish and shrimp are the way to go usually.

My Thai obsession knows know boundaries and Archi's (all locations) is always there to feed the addiction. Cheap, clean, good service and food. That's all I ask for in a great restaurant and Archi's delivers every time. 

I don't order drinks here either. I hate having to pay for refills. Only my favorite Archi's on Rainbow has a fountain.

Good for the location and especially right before or after the movies.

This Thai restaurant is quite a ways from the Strip.  We had went to another restaurat before Archi's, but that restaurant had too long a waiting time.  So we decided to try this place instead.  Fortunately, we had no wait time.  There was one table just waiting for our party of 4.  The ambiance was relaxing, and the restaurant was nicely decorated.  Staff was attentive without being intrusive, and the food came out quickly.

So, this is what we ordered and shared.  Beef Pad see ew for $8.95, ginger ginger ginger chicken for $9.95, spicy chicken basil fried rice for $9.95, green curry chicken for $9.95, and Thai iced tea for $3.95.  Everything tasted fine.  Not outstanding, but above average.  

Las Vegas has so many restaurants to choose from.  If I was in the area craving Thai food, I would certainly drop by here again.  If I was not in the area, then I would not come all the way here to eat.

Overall though, Archi's Thai Cafe is a good spot to eat.  If they were in my hometown, I'd rate them 4 stars.  In Vegas, though, because of all the choices out there....I can only give them 3 stars.

Eh, i honestly don't see what the hype is about. Pad thai was mediocre to say the least-had no tofu, the noodles tasted of shrimp (never tasted that before) and it was spicy after i specifically said "no spice". Service was below an "eh" but above "awful". I asked for extra napkins and instead of responding he walks away so my friend asked if he heard me. I waited to see what he would do before i said anything and he ended up walking to a station to get napkins...is it that difficult to say "sure" or "yes"? Not the worst thai place but i will definitely be visiting OSHA in San Fran next month!

Great meal. Tom yum soup hits the spot on a cool day. 
Last couple trips here it seems the soup and entrees come out very close to each other. I would prefer to eat the soup before the entree arrives. 
But a solid meal everytime.

The food was good. The establishment had a nice decor. The give you sodas in a can with a cup of ice. 

The service was less than okay. Our waitress only would come by to drop off our drinks, soup, and meal. She never stopped by to ask how we were or if we needed a refill.

Always consistently good. It isn't the fastest service, but the food is delicious, the restaurant is clean, the staff is friendly. We just don't come if we are in a hurry or we get take out. Can't compare it to other Thai, because we are always pleased and don't feel the need to go elsewhere.

Spent $50 at this restaurant and couldn't eat any of the food. I'm putting this place on my Top 10 list for worst service and worst food. My husband and I ordered takeout at 5:30 this evening and was told the food will be ready for pick up in 25 minutes. We arrived at 5:55 and they had us pay for the bill. I waited until 6:30 before my takeout was ready. During my wait I asked the girl, why is it taking so long? She replied that she wasn't the person who took my order over the phone and she would've told me it was a 45 minute wait.  First, I'd like to point out at this restaurant they make sure to take your money before they even begin cooking your food. That's why we waited 35 minutes after we got there...unacceptable. We finally get our food which was overstuffed and piled to the very top of a plastic bag. We had to take some of the food containers out and place them in a second bag. I ordered ginger ginger ginger chicken not spicy. They didn't even get that right. I had to throw it in the garbage because it was so spicy and there was red pepper sprinkled all over the top of the dish. Then we opened the fried wonton container and the wontons were hard as a rock and tasted like they were fried in burned oil. We ordered Thai toast and that was hard and tasted like it was cooked in old oil. They wasted my time and money:( 
I went to bed upset and hungry:(

This is actually my second time here. The first time, we waited ten minutes to be seated at the almost empty restaurant. We eventually gave up before walking two does down to Bachi Burger. I decided to give it another try. I have to say, both food and service are unimpressive at best. I will not be returning.
